Nos gusto mucho.
Volveremos.
El paisaje,un entorno en pleno Elche, con unas palmeras espectaculres todo ello en un parque o zona jardinada bonita y bien cuidad, una grata sorpresa no lo conocia

Si bien es cierto que el palmeral de Elche es muy bonito y por lo general est√° bastante bien cuidado, me parece excesivo que sea patrimonio de la humanidad, aunque eso beneficia al turismo por lo que es positivo, pero no hay mucho m√°s que palmeras....

titulo: Uno de los dos Patrimonios de la Humanidad de Elche
conteudo:
Siendo Patrimonio de la Humanidad poco m√°s se puede a√±adir: es algo extraordinario.

Los ilicitanos nos damos cuenta de lo importante que es nuestro palmeral cuando nos viene una visita y alucinan de ver la cantidad de palmeras que hay por todo Elche, y la maravilla de 'bosques' de palmeras que tenemos sobre todo en el centro hist√≥rico, que son las declaradas Patrimonio de la Humanidad.

No veng√°is buscando un parque con palmeras,el palmeral de Elche es todo Elche, es un oasis en mitad del asfalto, hay huertos de palmeras por toda la ciudad y son espectacularmente fuertes y resistentes como lo somos los espa√±oles para aguantar tanta pol√≠tica est√∫pida. No dejes de venir a Elche si quieres ver una ciudad diferente.
The city park was quite lively during our visit. There is a very interesting fountain as well as many palm trees.

Small botanical garden with many plants, little streams and fish.
Very nice place for a walk and a rest and beautiful pictures
A beautiful park which we came back too. Shaded by the stunning varieties of palms, there are cacti and flowers too as well as water features with turtles basking in the sunshine.
A grand area to walk through and enjoy the beautiful palm trees. Lots of benches to take a rest . An information center has a nice display.

This a unique experience of walking the city and seeing he various Palm groves. Whilst also enjoying the city streets. You have to end by seeing the Imperial Palm in the Hort del Cura. If you park by the train station, it is free ( apart from the ‚Ç¨2 you pay a local to help park your car in any gap). From here you can visit the tourist centre close by. This parking also puts you next to two parks. If you do not feel like walking you can take a hopper train through the city.

titulo: Public Park with magnificent palm trees
conteudo: The Palm Groves of Elche are World Heritage status because of the irrigation system used dating from the Arab rule. The Public Park and the area around the river preserves many magnificent trees in a free site and the Huerto del Cura is a magnificent botanical garden which you have to pay to visit but which preserves the most spectacular trees.

This small garden is very easy to walk around being a relatively small area and level walking. The plants are interesting and provide great photo opportunities. The ponds are lovely and have koi. turtles & ducks which can hold your attention for far longer than planned. There are also pigeons & peacocks around the garden. Small shop is good as are toilet facilities. The signage to the garden is not great. we found it on 3rd pass of the area by
car. Tourist information office was really useful so go there first if you're only in Elche for the day as we were.
Well worth the time spent to see the beautiful palms and gardens of Elche. The restrooms were closed, but that was the only downside.

titulo: Great place to meander out of heat of town
conteudo:
Lovely park. Plenty to see.
Well signed.
Lots seating areas.
Toilets on site - very clean
Worth a visit
A quiet and interesting garden, and not to mention very beautiful. Palm trees and some cactuses from around the world.

This is a lovely garden, not overly big, but well laid out. It‚Äôs very quiet here and has some nice shade. A walk around this garden is a delightful way to spend about an hour. Don‚Äôt miss the amazing multi-trunk Palm in the middle, it is quite a sight. And take time to look at the old photos of it along the wall of the building on the left side of the entrance. It shows the palm growing up, and the photos are quite cool.
Little parque in the middle of the town of Elche. Variation of plants and cactaceae. For the flora lovers : count 2 hours to see it all and to enjoy.

titulo: Pretty place with interesting plants and places for kids to play
conteudo:
Shady, quiet, green space with places for kids to play. Plenty of places to park nearby.

Walk around it and look at the different types of tree and cactus.

Pick a (very small and almost entirely stone) date from a tree and eat it.

Hunt the dragon (it's on google maps if you want to cheat).

If you feel energetic, walk to the Basilica, climb the tower, and then look down on the groves where you've just been walking and realise how green they are compared to everything around you.

I loved it here, not only were the palm trees, flowers, cacti and other plants beautiful and the garden so pleasant to spend time in, it was a haven of peace and tranquility. Well worth a visit, as its Elche itself.

titulo: Amazing that the Moors planted all those palms...
conteudo: It is interesting to see and imagine during Moorish Spain how this place must have looked like a dessert without the palms.
The Elche palm grove is a great place to visit in Europa ! So pleasant, so peaceful ! I recommand it with no hesitation !

titulo: Nice place for short walk around
conteudo: Lovely place to go to for an hour, good little walk around. Lots of palm trees, cacti and various other plants. Some fish and terrapins there too. ‚Ç¨5 entry not too bad

This park is fantastic the palms are so large and so different from any I have seen before, add to that the quite surroundings you could spend hours just wandering around , but if you have children there are swings and slides for them to use up there energy so a great for all the family
a superb place to visit, both to see the wide variety of plants, but also to enjoy the quiet atmosphere and the cool surroundings

What a gorgeous place! Take a tranquil stroll through this amazing place ... meander through the palms and cacti, sit and watch the beautiful peacocks, we were a matter of get from them and we just watched them get on with their lives. The white one is particularly eye-catching. Watch the turpins play ... just a joyful place to be.

we spent a couple of hours slowly wandering around the beautiful, peaceful park in the centre of quite a busy city, well worth the visit, sadly there was nowhere to sit and have a coffee or snack, but there are lots of cafes and bars nearby.

Drop me into a garden filled with palms and cacti, and I just might not leave until I am forced out. That is exactly how I felt entering Palmeral of Elche. Filled with exquisite specimens of palms, cacti, and other succulent and subtropical flora, this well tended garden is truly an earthly delight, inspiring me to go home and ‚Äúpush the envelope‚Äù, acquiring, on a small scale, a number of the specimens I discovered here, trying to recreate an homage to this inspiring place.
A great place to spend an hour or so wandering the paths and chemins of this well maintained park complete with fountains, benches and follies.

Most of this 2.5 km walk round the palm groves, marked on tourist maps, is along pavements and roads. Better to wander in the groves themselves.
We thought the nicest part was the Parc Municipal which has informative notices in English about particular specimens.

titulo: Go, even if you‚Äôre not interested.
conteudo: Most enjoyable time spent walking around this park. Interesting to learn that every variety of palm tree in the world is in this park. Well worth a look and worth the cost. Buy some dates before you leave.

If you are a visitor to the long Costa Blanca beaches around Alicante, you should not miss the interesting little town of Elche (Elx). Maybe not very many visitors know that Elche has two (2) World Heritage attractions. The first is rather obvious: palm trees all over the place. Some people say, here you will find more palm trees than in all of Arabia.This I can not confirm, but it surely is the biggest palm tree occurrence in Europe. It gives the town definitely the look pf an oasis.
The second heritage is the so called Mystery of Elche. A ancient church spectacle to give images to death and ascension of the virgen Mary to heaven. You will have to come in August to see the church play on some days followed by a great congregation of local people which makes it even more authentic.
Great little park, with beautiful palms and cactus. Plus the added attraction of white peacocks. Quite a small park but a great way to pass a few hours.
Amazing that the whole city is surrounded by palms with the park running through the City. Palm trees everywhere and even a ‚Äúpalm‚Äù fountain/water feature.

It is really amazing to see the palm trees everywhere in Elche and outside the city. More than 200,000! There is a great view from the Basilica's tower, it gives a good ideea about the presence of these trees.
We spent an hour and a half wandering through these lovely gardens on a beautiful November day. Unusual palms and cacti and pools with ducks and koi carp.
Nicely maintained palm grove. Avoid the wedding photos parties. See ducks and peacocks. Learn a little more about palm trees.

‚Ç¨3 entry per over 60, otherwise its ‚Ç¨5.
Thanks to the Moors, this 1000 year old garden wouldn‚Äôt exist.
There‚Äôs no official parking area so it‚Äôs street parking or one of the underground ones as this garden is slap in the middle of town.
A haven of tranquility‚Äôs when you arrive.

Enjoyed a walk around the palm groves. A unique park / garden area with cathedral and cultural sights nearby. If you have time worth walking down to the river (stream) for a different perspective of the city. We followed the palm tour available from the tourist office next to the park.

We drove up from Mercia expecting some sort of large expanse of Palm forest/wilderness, it was not that. The area around this urban garden is full of many tall Palm trees but they tend to just line the roads and neighbourhood. That said, the gardens themselves, although small, were very well looked after with some very exotic looking palms, cactusses etc. There are some water features with fish, terrapins, ducks and frogs, you may even spot an albino peacock hiding in the undergrowth. The noise of urban environment we were in, never let you forget exactly where you were, if it were silent you could have imagined being anywhere exotic. On a hot day, a slow walk around here with a nice cold Callipo lolly can be just the job. A nice and relaxing urban oasis.
we enjoyed our visit , nice well kept gardens , very peaceful , they have toilets and a small shop with cold drinks ,snacks and a selection of cactus and plants , seeds etc
One of the hidden gems in Spain, good quality of train tour, old history in this oasis, beautiful park, good for walking

Worth a visit while in Alicante, Not a massive park but some lovely waterfalls and water features.
Located on the outskirts of Alicante. I went on a local bus here.

Spent a very pleasant afternoon wandering through the gardens. The shade from the trees on a very hot day was very welcoming.
There are a wide variety of tree varieties and the buildings and water fearures contribute to an interesting visit.
The park is on the edge of the town and the area offer lots of choices for food and drink.
This is an incredible place and well worth a visit. We spent a couple of hours walking around the gardens and there are some amazing plant and cacti formations.

worth the small entrance fee, there is not very much to do here apart from look ! children might get a bit bored, but the trees and cactus are amazing and Im glad I went. Its one to tick off your list,

The Huerto del Cura is one of the nicest gardens you've ever seen with hundreds and hundreds of palm trees, cacti and flowers. With a few special and even historical palm trees. Well worth a stroll with the whole family.

Palms and more Palm surrend the city of Elche with a wide variety of Palms.In the center of the historic town a gorgeous garden of palms.The fragrances, the music of the birds and the air I thought I was in paradise. A must see!

This is a beautiful and very old Palm park. There is ample parking at the outer edge of the park which runs against the River Segura bed where the locals stroll. Sunday is a good time to go, there are small craft stalls at the car park end and it's lovely to walk through the shady palms watching the world go by.There are play area for children too and dogs are welcome. At the other side of the park, the city end, stands the castle and the Basilica and lots of pavement cafes which are very reasonable for tapas or just a cafe con leche

This park is such an important resource, especially for the weary and overheating. The garden is well maintained and clean. With ample benches and picnic tables scattered all around, one can certainly find a spot that suits you -- to enjoy a quiet time away from the hustle and bustle of the crowds, facing the scenic palm-lined skyline and during leaves, surrounded by the sounds of kids near the play areas, or a combination of all three. There are open spaces to stroll, run and play, hide and seek. Our kids love it and I believe adults will too.

If there was a garden of Eden in earth at present, this would certainly be a candidate in the running. Much better even than some of the paid entry gardens that we have visited. The best things in life are free... true at least in this instance.
It was absolutely great and very beautiful! The birds, fishes, turtles and palm trees are very well taken care of! Loved it!
Really enjoyable hour just browsing various palms and plants from all over the world. Pleasant stroll in late afternoon sun!
Very nice garden. Not so big, but very nice for an hour or so. Admission 5 Euro/adult. Small....but beatiful

The idea of a palm grove so big and ancient that it has made the UNESCO World Heritage list had me curious enough to plan a visit to Elche. I wish I had adequate words for just how special a place this is. Well worth the visit

Loved all the Palms and the huuuge park(s).
So much too see and lots of benches and play areas for kids, it was just a wonderful day in the park!
Cozy area around and close to the city.

The historic Palm Grove of Elche was declared a World Heritage site by UNESCO in 2000. Thousands of palm trees fill the city. The Municipal Park is an excellent place to visit to see them. The park is carefully laid out to allow easy walking for all abilities and trees are clearly labelled. It is a very tranquil, reflective area to visit.

Enter the Park near the Tourist Information Office, where you will find very helpful staff eager to inform you about the area. You can also catch a small tourist train here for an orientation of the city, for ‚Ç¨3.

Parking is a challenge, but at the opposite end of the avenue parallel to the park, there is a car park, where you pay on exit, at the little cafe. There are also very good toilets there, just next to the underground station.

Please give me a helpful vote, if you found this useful!
I would count this as one of the must see locations when visiting Elche. I was wonderful just sitting in the garden and enjoying the palms, the landscape and the other plants.

Visited on 8th October and it was breathtakingly.
The work that as gone into landscaping and maintaining this exotic paradise was exceptional.
A place to visit.
Very pretty park to visit and cooling in the heat. Free entrance and plenty parking outside the park. We visited on a Sunday which was lovely and quiet.
It's worth a visit to see all the different palms, I particularly liked the cactus garden, some amazing cacti there. Please walk around the garden.
Makes for a nice two hour or so visit. We went with the kids, they enjoyed it as well. Walking around the park is a relaxing and beautiful experience with small streams of water. Very nicely done.

Elche itself is a nice small city, located close to Alicante. famous for its palms. Really a must visit if you're staying in Alicante, Can be a day or an overnight visit. The Palm Groves itself is an amazing place if you want to relax and enjoy nature and see something you will not see anywhere else in Europe. : )

Here's all the useful info I could find before and found out by going (once on the wrong day).
The fireworks are on 13th August every year no matter what day that is. Its called Nit de l'Alb√† (night of dawn). It was on a Sunday this year (2017) so don't go up there on the Saturday night waiting for the big show and wandering where everybody is!! (Like me).
We parked at the nearest large shopping centre called Centro Comercial L'Aljub after reading about it on another review. It's pronounced eljub just in case you need to get a cab back to your car like us. Its about 25 minutes walk, 2 straight roads, to where all the bridges cross the riverbed in the city for the best views. Free parking at the shopping centre, no barriers on car park entry/exit, car park open 24hrs. Loads of places open very late to eat at shopping centre if you need it beforehand. There is also a seperate Burger king next door to the shopping centre which is open till 2am in case you need a coffee/toilet before heading home.
Fireworks start properly all over the city at 11.15pm. They go on until just before midnight. Then the city falls silent, hundreds of people on the bridge around us, silent, they switch off most of the city street lights as well at this point. The basilica de santa Maria plays the city's favourite hymn out through loudspeakers, then towards the end, 3000 rockets the palm of the virgin are shot from the basilica tower at the same time. It is great, do not look away. Other writers can do it far better justice and it deserves more reading up on, I can only say the whole thing was a real moment to remember. The fireworks, the total silence, the hymn, then the palm of the virgin.
We stood on the carer reina victoria above the riverbed which was rammed, but, stand off to either end a little and it's no bother. They also let fireworks off from the riverbed below. You can sit on the barrier which divides the road and pavement if theres room. Just off the bridge is the Ayuntamiento de Elche I think its the OLD town hall, which was one of the many places over the city to let off fireworks from their roof. There was a barriered off area around the old town hall building because of sparks falling into the street. Nothing to worry about though. This bridge is 2 minutes from the basilica de santa maria where they let off the 3000 rockets at midnight. After the fireworks, continue straight over the bridge and go straight for 300 metres or so and sit in the square with the water fountain with the hundreds of others and enjoy it for a few minutes. This is what a normal saturday night in Elche looks like, i know because i was there by mistake the night before. loads of children out with family until the silly hours all perfectly happy. Many many firecrackers are let off in the streets, so don't be alarmed, it's OK & the kids loved it. There is much much more to the Elche festival than just the fireworks and I feel a bit like we took the highlights and ran. If I'm back here again I'll be sure to give the whole festival more time. Loved it.
I have never seen so many palm trees in the same place! Quite fun, specially if you have kids... you should not miss it.

It should cost about ¬£6 each to visit but our hotel had discounted tickets that we used. Worth a look around if in Elche but I wouldn't go out of the way to see unless you are a botanist. Quite an array of rare palms and cacti and we strolled around for about half an hour - as it's not that big.

Visted Elche on the way home as heard the Palm Groves were nice and the were. Had some really interesting trees which never seen before. Also against the Spanish heat was a nice cool walkaround. Nice wat to while awat a couple of hours or if you are visting for the Market, etc.

We found some free parking around from the park by the station but unsure if we were lucky or not as the had a festival on and a lot of roads blocked.
A lovely place to stroll aming tall swaying palm trees and watch the fascinating Palm Sunday procession
Had a nice walk around the park. If you head out one side there's a path all the way along a man made river type thing with a graffiti base. It's quite interesting.
We drove through and decided to have a walk about a lovely selection of plants and palms nice are for a walk and picnic we really enjoyed the area.
Worth a visit if you love plants and are in the area. We were impressed by the large kaktus an d Many variations of palmtrees.

It shows All the beautiful palmtrees and also Some other plants and trees. Enjoying walking in the shade during the hottest part of the day. Only disturb by the soft sounds of falling dades. (Be careful with your head)
A good place to go for a couple of hours and not expensive lovely water features and cactus area and nicely planted out

The Palm Groves are within the town of Elche. The Tourist Info office were very helpful to guide you to get the most out of the visit. We did the Elche Tourist train which was great to see the groves and the town. Super visit üòä

titulo: Small garden with some intersting palm trees
conteudo: A small garden of palms and cactus plants some of which are very very old. Not worth the long drive from the ship port.
Enjoyed a lovely stroll through the trees , grown year after year with a fantastic irrigation system that goes back a long way in time . Well worth a look .

There are just so many palm trees in Elche, it's amazing. The locals take them for granted, but for us to see them everywhere was exciting! The palm groves and parks offer a tranquil and shady place to be in the hot weather. Well worth a visit.
The palmeral is a realy nice greenspot with many palm trees and other plants. For us, the long drive (2.5 hours) was not worth it and we somewhat expected more.

We visited four adults. We all enjoyed the calmness in the park where both a lot of and different palm trees and many other plants/trees can be seen.
We missed a place to sit for a coffee and soft drink (is probably there but we did not see).

Interesting city with a lot of palm trees everywhere! You can find all kind of palms and other vegetable species and it's beautiful seeing all that green in the city and surroundings, like a lush oasis. For a moment you feel like you are not in Europe! Too hot in summer but recommended anyway.

We only had time for an hour in the municipal park but loved it. So clean and calm. Parking was cheap on street. Would have loved to have taken the train ride but did not have time (and it was full anyway!)

Much of the Costa Blanca looks pretty parched by the end of May, so this botanical garden was an oasis of green shade even by Elche's standards of palm trees everywhere. Apart from palm trees from every corner of the globe, many succulent s and cacti were in abundance, along with Strelitzias and what those of us from cooler climes would normally regard as houseplants. A very good selection of plants were available for sale, but how to get them home.....
Elche is full of palms but Palmeral has too be seen if nothing else for the historical references, and the variety of palms and cactii

titulo: Enjoy a ride & a meal among the palm trees,
conteudo:
Elche contains about 200,000 Palm Trees, with many of them with a large park, accessed either by foot or on a land train. The land train weaves it way through the park & then tours Elche, looking at various notable buildings.
It is about a one hour ride, with a commentary, which does not always link to the places it is describing, due to traffic congestion in the town.
Overall it makes a nice excursion & the cost is very reasonable.
Within the park is a very large restaurant offering a good selection of food & drink.
At the entrance to the park is the tourist information office.
There is a fascinating history to the original planting & cultivation of the palm trees

Impressive yearly Procession on Sunday before Easter! Good atmosphere.
Beautiful people joining the procession. Later a nice walk in the Palm Groves and it was a peaceful place with a lot of places where you could sit and enjoy the garden.

I was there today. First of all there was the palm sinday procession. A spectacle it is. Most people dress up (read over dress) and walk in that procession te be seen an noticed) few are devote but still I loved looking at it. The city was vibrant, thousands of people all over the city centre. The palm garden had a special meaning being there on palm sunday. It was a great day.

Well, this is part of the city cultural and sightseeings that anyone in the city must walk around and enjoy, as is very nice to enjoy part of the uniqueness of the city/region. In summer may be hard to stay outside for too long due the local temperature is too high, but on spring or autumm the Palmeral gets the best of your visit.

titulo: Elche gardens - so much better than befor!
conteudo: I have been to the Huerto del Cura a few times over the years and as nice as it was, it wasn't particularly impressive. However things has certainly been improved prior to my recent visit last week. Paths were clean and tidy, and the planting displays and plant quality were so much better than they were before. Huge amounts of work have been out into these gardens and it shows. Congratulations to the staff is well deserved. I Would definitely recommend, but take plenty of water on hot days. be aware that parking in crap!

titulo: Lost in Arabia ‚Äì Elche's Palmeral: Stupendous
conteudo:
I have gait/walking challenges (stroke), all sightseeing has to be well-researched and not overly taxing; I wear a legbrace. Elche's Palmeral is awesome; escape to the blissfully cool shade of more than 200,000 palm trees - it is the largest, only, palm grove in Europe. Palmeral is a generic name used to designate date-palm forest in Elche, there are different pockets of palm orchards, a lot of it runs parallel to the Vinalopo river. Feels like an oasis of middle of Arabia. Elche's calling card, Unesco World Heritage site; not to be confused with Huerto del Cura (the Priest's Garden), a subset within the larger Palm Grove.

Bring a hat, water, comfy shoes for walking. It's hard, stony/pebbly ground, but walkable. Located within Elche's Palmeral; dovecote, kids playground in Municipal park, Moorish-influenced tourist office, atmospheric Castillo de Altamira, Basilica de Santa Maria (climb the dome bell tower for a bird's-eye-view of the Palmeral). During Palm Sunday, Easter, Medieval Festival, Elche's August Fiestas it is spectacular.

I had a laugh at the criticism by another Trip Advisor visitor that this was OK if you like palm trees.True - but the point of it is really the history of the palm plantation which goes back to Arab Spain. It has several sections worth visiting. I saw a lot of it from the little tourist train as well as walking in the parks. Some bits are gardened and decorative and some are still agricultural. There is a linear park along the river banks which is also part of the palm forest. One nice thing was people-watching; the municipal park was full of families taking their toddlers out to enjoy playing on the children's swings etc. And there were old people using the outdoor gym equipment too.
The Palmeral is truly astonishing -- 200,000+ palm trees -- and El Huerto del Cura is its premier garden. Worth the tiny charge for entrance.

A massive area of palm trees. A lot of different kinds of trees and plants everywhere. Really big place, and u might get a little lost too wondering around. You should visit this place if you want to see all kinds of plants and feel like your not in the city.

The palm groves are interesting to walk through but don't expect even pathways. There are many trees so you are sheltered from the hot sun. In the centre there is a large dovecote where you can feed the birds. There are free exercise machines to try. You can buy food and drinks in the glass structured restaurant. As you exit the park there are some fountains and across the road is the castle. A pleasant way to spend a couple of hours.

titulo: if you love Palms you love this
conteudo: its a pleasure just to take a slow walk around elche, if you haven't done it yet, whats stopping you .Go and see it now its not so very hot anymore.

This is the reason for visiting Elche - a park which goes round the city, free to enter, magical for strolling in, amazing trees, good explanatory writings, splendid children's playgrounds, terrific dove-cote - we loved it

We wandered through park mid morning in September. The temperature was pleasant to walk in . The palms are amazing & the park is well maintained we watched the maintenance of the trees & the brave council men undertaking the climb (rather them than me)! The park is respected as there is no litter & people instantly pick up dog poo, coming from England where there is little pride in public spaces this was impressive.
We walked all around the palm groves & particularly enjoyed the quiet lane where Sempre Pipe tree is, though beware character changes in this area at dusk. We went for an evening pre dinner walk to look at Sempre pipe & at the end of the lane where ring road is were working girls & some unsavoury looking males.
Elche is famous for its Palm trees , so this was just an extension to the rest of the area. Could be made more spectacular with water features .

titulo: Nice park to visit and look at the thousands of Palm trees and cacti
conteudo: Very old park which is beautifully kept and open to the public for free.Accessable for everyone as the walks are paved and smooth.Plenty of benches to sit on for a picnic and it has a lttle cafe for drinks and snacks

It was surprisingly impressive especially since i was not expacting to be that impressed. Elche is famous for their palms and they showed off their cultural heritage in their different shapes natural and artistic designs. It is a beautiful place to visit.

My partner and I visited Elche for a weekend and the Huerto del Cura was the best memory we take. There were all sorts of beautiful palm trees and cacti, stunning views and in general a lovely place to visit.

Also known as El Huerto Del Cura, this small garden exhibits a large variety of palm trees and cacti. The jewel of this well-maintained garden is the Imperial Palm Tree, which is shaped like a candelabra. Located in the city center, parking is across the street. There is a small fee for both the parking and entrance to the garden.

We went to Elche palm groves on our way to Rio Safari zoo. The city is interesting for its palm trees (worth visiting) but I would certainly not make it a day trip. Go to the public park there are quite nice pictures to be taken there.

More than 200 000 palms in Elche (Elx) town. It is easy to reach this unique Palm Forest from Alicante By Cercan√≠as train from Alicante Terminal-train station, line C1 to Elche Parque station. It takes only 26 minutes. There are several Palm Parks. The most beautiful park is Huerto del Cura. There is also the most unique Imperial Palm tree with seven suckers from the same trunk. Recommended relaxing day trip from Alicante.

The palm trees are so beautiful and calming to walk through, the views are amazing and it's a nice touch of nature you don't see very often. It's a nice area to have a stroll other than palm trees there's not much there
Lively park in the city with fantastic, old palms. Not very big, but worth a trip to see and enjoy the shaded walk & ponds with turtles.

titulo: An oasis, shadows from under many thousands of palm trees.
conteudo: The park is big but the the palm trees are spread over a much larger area. Also many amazing and gigantic cactus and areas with small ponds with water. The palmera is located in the centre of Elche and one of the entrants are neighboring to the archeological museum. Don't miss that attraction when visiting the palmera.

We took a drive to Elche from Altea especially to see the largest in Europe palm park. Well, i can't say it was something amazing. Of course, the place is a real hideaway from the hot Spanish sun but it doesn't worth a special almost 100 km drive. First of all, it is dusty. The dust comes from gravel roads and with kids running everywhere and pigeons flying everywhere it gets into the air. Second minus is pigeons. There are quite many of them and there's a special dovecote where they live. I don't like birds flying very close to me and my daughter so it wasn't nice. And third, there was no WC in the park!!! Taking into account that it's a family-oriented place, that was a very negative surprise. All special plastic cabins where closed with locks, WC buildings marked Cabalieros/Senoras were locked too ((( the only possible option is a restaurant in the park, but as we did not want any food&drinks we just finished the walk and drove away.

The palms are the main part of Elche really, as they are integral in the town. Walking though the groves is very peaceful, and there are plenty of places to sit as rest, and take in your surroundings, either in one of the groves/parks, or in a cafe or bar.

You can park nearby for free (look for places on the road without blue bay markings), and the tourist information is at one end of the mumciple park, where you can get a map of the town, and they will point out which groves to go and see.

We went during the hottest part of the day but the park was lovely to walk through. The palms offered a lot of shade and we even saw a couple of tourists having a siesta on one of the many benches :-)
There is nearby parking

titulo: Compact, but my goodness, it has so much to offer.
conteudo:
Frankly, palms have never been my thing, however that didn't stop me from enjoying the hello out of the Palm Groves.

What an amazing place with a plethora of incredible palms of all sizes, shapes and colours, interspersed with ponds, lovely ground et al.

You seriously don't have to be a garden lover to get a kick out of this place. Well worth the small investment!

P.S. There's plentiful seats, nice little nic nak store and a cafe.

Our Barman in the campsite said we should visit Elche as it his home town. We got a little lost on the way in and couldn't find the university where we were told to park, but we found the museum with underground parking. Sunday afternoon and everything is shut but still surprised to find this little gem. We took the sight seeing trolley train with our dogs to see the sights, I've never seen so many palm trees. This journey cost 3.50pp and takes 40mins! It's a great way of seeing all you need to.

titulo: fantastic gardens an oasis in the city
conteudo: Wonderful gardens with many exotic plants and trees. well worth a visit to spend an hour walking around the well laid out pathways

We were taken to the park by our Spanish friends Laura and Marino, and we're so glad that we went. It is a lovely, peaceful oasis of tranquility in the middle of the vibrant city of Elche. Highly recommended.
Palm Groves is the largest Palm Gardening Europe. It has many varieties of palms and is a lovely place to walk and just relax.

titulo: Nice to See All The Planted Palm Trees
conteudo:
Most reviews for this attraction seem to be misplaced as they refer to the Municipal park, which has it's own review site.
The Palm Groves in the city have lots and lots of planted palms which are nice to wander by and look at, no wonder Elche is known as The City Of Palms
Impressive easy stroll, much to learn about palm trees, irrigation, history and cultivation of palms
It's very good place to visit, you will enjoy the palm trees everywhere. We enjoyed walking in the town, and found a good restaurant nearby a palm-garden.

This park is very large and filled with many well maintained plants, shrubs and trees. There are facilities to buy food and beverages and there are nice play area for children of all ages. It is not an intimate garden like the Huerto del Cura Artistico Nacional but it is very well done. It is a great place for a picnic or just to relax

Visit this park 8.05-2016

It,s a nice park, a big one...
You can easy use 2 hour here if you walk allover, but I would say a hour+ is enough..
Roads are made of small stones, so use shoes and not sandals. Easy to use a boggy for kids.

They have play place for kids... And it's ok..

They also have some orange and lime trees there..

All in all worth a visit but nothing speciel..

The park is for free.
Good for a family excursion, maybe have a picnic lunch here. The trees provide excellent shade and the place is very large.

titulo: The beautiful park in the center of Elche
conteudo: Visited underway to Murcia by car during hot sunny day. It was unplanned, however have got wonderful impression and place was not so touristic

The largest palm forest in Europe which supplies all the palms for the whole of Spain celebrating Palm Friday.

If you're into flora and fauna in a very natural setting then this is for you.

The dove house with its numerous inhabitants makes it fun for all the family especially the younger age groups as you can feed the tame birds. Just don't look up. Just in case. Lol.

Parking is easy around the outskirts of the park and it's free, too.

There's a great visitors centre with the latest VR Occulus headsets which give an immersive history of Elche.
I assume we are talking about the Municipal Park which was a delight, water features old buidings and plants by the truck load. A haven of tranquility on a hot day.

We caught the little land train from the tourist office where you can obtain free maps. The train runs on the hour every hour and costs ‚Ç¨3.50 and covers most points of interest and is an excellent way to orient yourself . With an informative commentary in three languages.
If you want calm, this is the place! it's perfect to have a little walk and admire the big and beautiful trees.
Worth a walk around, although can get a bit repetitive. Only need an hour to see it all. There is a gift shop and facilities on site
Very cool peaceful and relaxing all year round. A great place to stroll sit and rest. There is a souvenir shop if interested.

Take a bus from Alicante and spend some time in the pleasant city of Elche...the Palm Groves are amazing, especially considering how long these beauties take to grow. Discover the Lady of Elche and admire the white peacocks...we thoroughly enjoyed it!
Beautiful and original gardens in the city of Elche. Many different species of plants, a pleasant stroll through the gardens and enjoy its beauty
Very good place to find, if to stroll or have a lunch trip. I return here every visit I make to the area.

It was by going Geocaching that we found this wonderful park. We had a lovely stroll through, the kids loved it too (7&9). We plan on returning with a picnic so we can spend some more time there. There is also a playground for the younger children too.

titulo: Great park to spent your day in
conteudo: In this park there are so many palm trees and each of them had a name. Its located next to Palacio De Altamira you can visit the Palacio via the musea Maha. We didn't visit the musea or Palacio because it was a Nationsl Holiday in Spain and they were not open. There is a very large playground in the park for kids.

a lovely 'garden' full of exotic, tropical palms, trees, plants and flowers. notably 'la palmera imperial' the star of this beautiful collection. have a walk in the park then lunch at 'els capellans' across the road. both worth a visit if you're in elche.

The palmeral is actually a walking route which takes about an hour or so. It is clearly marked and on the route you can see a few palm tres with odd shapes. It is a good activity early morning or in the evening before dinner when the temperatures are benevolent. A pity in some areas it is not very well maintained, but the overall experience is quite nice.
...not overwhealming though. It was a really nice walk, and ocasion to see some rare kinds of tropic palms. If you haven't been in tropics yet, it's worth to see it.

Quite hard to find in the middle of the city, parking not easy, a five euro per person or 3 euros senior rate, interesting place to visit lots of different plants to see nice to walk around in the shade, no where to sit and have drink.

titulo: Fascinating remains of an Ancient Palm Forest
conteudo:
It is a widely held view that Elche's Palm Park was originally planted by the Phoenicians over 2500 years ago to provide dates for their diet.
Today, Elche has provided a tourist path through the many 'Huerto's' or plot's of land, which each contain thousands of date palms, and are named after the Owner. A Tourist map is available which gives you the walking route plus the trail is clearly sign posted. This is an amazing and welcome site in the middle of a big city.
If you leave Elche by the road to La Marina look out for the huge nurseries that are cultivating Palms and Olive trees for sale, probably around the world.
It was several Palm groves in Elche, we visit the nearest to turist info kiosko, it was nice and hot, manny tree and some bulidings to see in this park and free entrance in this.

So nice to see so much greenery in the city and was nice just to walk through when it was at the hottest time of the day and find some shade. We also found a large dome like building which had tour guides inside who gave us goggles and headphones for a full visual 3d experience overlooking the city. Was pretty cool and only ‚Ç¨2 or something.

it is lovely to walk through and see all the diffirent kind of trees there is it is such a shame that a lot have had to be destroyed because of the weavel but it is worth a visit Also Elche is a lovely town to have a walk round shops and cafes.
It is really a very unique collection of palm trees and other beautiful plants, it is worth visiting. There are some areas where you can eat your lunch or just relax under the palm trees.
well worth a visit to see the many different palms and cacti. Not expensive and educational for all ages
Having visited a couple of years ago we chose to visit again. The area was surprisingly quiet. The collections and variety of unusual plants are fabulous. Definitely worth visiting.
Really beautiful place. Some palms are breathtaking, I like the Catapult and the Sempere Pipe the most ;)

Spent a good few hours here on a day visit to Elche. Stunning environment good walkways well kept and so peaceful and tranquil. Open air gym was a surprise and good fun to try. Pond with ducks was lovely in municipal park. Overall a lovely way to spend an afternoon walking through the amazing palms and cactus and relax. Well worth a visit.

If you have a couple of hours to kill in elche then would recommend this.
Only 5 euros to get in and good history to trees and specimens as well, very relaxed and peaceful couple of hours!

titulo: Cute museum, beautiful walk through the palms
conteudo:
The small museum was free on Sunday when we visited. Interesting facts and history of the palm inside.
we then took a walk through the groves, grateful many of the trees had signs so we knew what kind they were.
nice, pleasant walk through the trees, easy flat walk.

titulo: Dont look for a park,, they are every where
conteudo: Great and lovely walks between 200.000 palm trees! Garden and the town are worth to visit. The Parque Municipal is a good place to relax with children and have decent food.

We visited with our Spanish class- and the experience was very pleasant. The guide spoke clearly in Spanish so we could understand the history behind the garden. Impressive collection of palms and cactus.

titulo: This was a beautiful place to spend time.
conteudo: We have been here before and can say that it is always a pleasure and treat to re-visit. The Palms are magnificent and the setting is peaceful and tranquil. There are many places to stop and reset or contemplate or even fall asleep!. It can even give you ideas for your own gardens. A must visit if in the area and never been before

Spent a couple of hours here wandering around this well kept gem in Elche. The gardens are in great condition considering how hot it was. We found ourselves jumping from shade to shade but this did not detract from the beauty.

Well worth the effort to find it as it is not well signposted on roads into Elche.

titulo: Awesome kids playground and manicured lawns
conteudo: We walked through this park and found it stunningly beautiful. They had a kids area that gave us and the toddlers a welcome break, plus beautiful fountains, walkways and just a good spot to watch typical Spanish life.

Lovely drive from Quesada. Not well sign posted for people without satnav, but a quick visit to Macdonalds to use their WiFi then off we went.

Really tranquil despite the hoards. Kids enjoyed feeding the doves then went into visitor centre and sported the latest technology.....occulus rift goggles. A real treat. Kids 50 cents each.

Palmeral is a really special place. I live close by so I go there almost every day, just for a stroll or to have a cup of coffee in the cafe located in the middle of the park. The whole place is kept in a perfect shape, alleys are very clean and colourful. You can sit on one of many benches covered in beautiful tiles, you can observe the birds or simly walk around. The park is very tranquil once you get away from the playground for kids.
If you're a sporty type, you can definitely jog there, an open-air gym is also available!

The historical Palmeral of Elche is actually a UNESCO World Heritage site. The groves of date palms were planted almost 3000 years ago and formally laid out during the times of Arab domination.

There are several palm gardens throughout the city with the municipal park and Huerto del Cura being the most popular. Some of the palm gardens are public parks while others are privately owned.

A walk through the palm gardens is a must for any visit to Elche. You can also see how vast is the Palmeral of Elche from atop the mirador of the Basilica de Santa Maria.

titulo: Elche and its World Heritage attractions
conteudo:
Iberians, Phoenicians, Greeks, Romans, Visigoths and Moors have in turn, invaded the Land of Valencia and nowhere in this region are the legacies left by these 'guests' more evident than in Elche.
The most visible memento is the palm trees that were planted by the Moors. Elche is simply inundated with them! Over 200,000 palm trees surround the city making it more like a forest than an urban landscape. The Moors formally laid out the 'Palmeral of Elche' in the 10th century. They installed elaborate irrigation systems and these are still functioning today as are the agricultural practices developed by these enterprising people. Elche is a World Heritage site because the palm forest is so impressive and important.
When I recently visited the city, I went on a delightful walk - the 'Ruta del Palmeral'. It is 2580 metres in length although it covers only a fraction of the total extent of the Palmeral.
The little map that can be obtained from the tourist office suggests starting at the orchard of Sant Pl√†cid. It is as good a point to start as any and is opposite the 'Huerto del Cura' - the Priests Garden. It is known as 'The Jewel of the Palm Park' and rightly so - it is a calm relaxing place - a delightful garden of palm trees, tropical plants and cacti. It even has a pond with ducks!
Elche has a number of historic monuments and one in particular is worth a visit - the 'Basilica of Santa Mar√≠a', a spectacular building with a bell tower and an imposing blue dome. The present Basilica is the fourth religious building occupying the same site. It was the site of a Muslim mosque when Jaime I, King of Arag√≥n, conquered the town in 1265. The present building was started in 1672 and finished in 1783.
A visit to the bell tower is worth the effort. From the top, panoramic views of the city can be enjoyed - in particular, the groves of palm trees. On the different landings of the tower information is displayed about the building of the Basilica, its architectural styles and its importance in regards to Elche's other claim to fame - the 'Misteri' or 'Festa d'Elx' - a medieval sacred play. This 'Passion play' is acted out in the Basilica every year on the 14th and 15th of August. It is listed as 'World Heritage' making Elche one of the few places in the World to have two 'UNESCO World Heritage' awards.
Elche is one of the inland cities of the Costa Blanca although the Elche district does comprise some coastal areas only 12 kilometres distant from the city. I would recommend anyone who visits the Costa Blanca to pay a visit to Elche and to the 'Huerto del Cura' in particular.

We walked through the Palm Groves from our room to the church. You should hike up the bell tower in the church if you are in good shape so you can have an amazing view of the Palm Groves. I am glad we stopped to see them.
When visit Elche, it is a must see place. Palmtrees and cactus from all over the World. Very good information at the entrance. Payment a Little high.
Wow lovely garden..amazing never seen so many types of palm trees..nice place for a day out..think I'm going to come and live here ..just so peacefull and beautifull

titulo: The Best Palm oasis in Spain
conteudo: Elche Palm‚Äôs Park is a unique park in Spain. More than 200000 palms are planted in this city. Go to Municipality Park in the center point of city and enjoy one hour inside the park.

Elche is a very beautiful city, with beautiful people and the best ice cream that i have eated in my life. El Palmeral de Elche is a oasis in the center of town, where you can enjoy a book. It's very close to a beautiful curch and the fortress of Elche.

titulo: A welcome diversion on a scaulding hot day!
conteudo: Elche is a really beautiful city, and to top it all, it is home to the largest palm forest in Europe, absolutely stunning, tens of acres of palm trees, cactii, landscaped parkland, statues, little open areas for the kids to run around in. I've never seen a place like it, If you are flying into Alicante and staying in the area, visit Elche, you won't forget this place, and like me you'll swear that you'll come back, and share it with someone next time, loved it, and I know you will too.

An oasis away from the soaring temperatures of the August heat of Spain.The arrangement of different cactis was stunning. We went into the town of Elche ant the church was very nice. Elch was a clean place to visit.

If you're into trees and plants or just need a break from beaches and busy towns, this is a must if you're anywhere near Elche. Even the kids were impressed with the old palm trees, the absolutely huge cacti and the dates. Free parking around the corner and nice little bars nearby.
Stunning place! Didn't think I would enjoy it as much as I did. My family had a great day out and the photos are amazing with the children! Lots to learn too!

Such a unique, ancient, well laid-out palm grove. Great place to relax despite being in a very urban setting. Great photo opportunity. Lovely gardens, lots of varied seating, fountains and statues/sculptures.

went there for the day to see the castle(FREE ON SUNDAYS AND WEDNESDAY) and palm groves there was a moor's and christens festive with awesome street stalls serving all kinds of food and drink, fireworks planned for the evening it was also a lovely place to look around very relaxed atmosphere plenty of shops would be a great weekend break if your on the area its about a 20min bus from santa pola
There's not much to it but it's something different. It's within walking distance to the town and there are nice parks and gardens around the palm trees.

A very big palm garden-forest 20 min from Alicande.You can spend 2-3 hours walking between palm trees anfd flowers. There is a small river with many bridges. Nice place to take photos.The town of Elche is realy nice with very good and cheap food and wine.Also visit the cathedral.

titulo: Visit tourist information and get a map.
conteudo: We arrived from Alicante by bus with no map. We should have waited until the bus station but we got off in the centre and started heading for tourist information and got lost. We came across a shop which said Information and a very helpful shop keeper gave us a map and circled sites to visit. She directed us to the Huerta and we spent over an hour wandering round. It is a small garden but I would say quite unique. The wind suddenly became a howling gale and it was interesting to see how the palm trees sway in rthe wind. We found tourist information, found the train station and curtailled our visit due to the weather. I would go back again to wander round the other gardens.
Lots to see and do in Elche parks full of palms everywhere nice walks shopping malls close shoe factories to walk around and get a bargain must be seen
Just i small park whit palmes, nothing special if you not are extremly interested of different sorts of trees. Not wort paying 2 ‚Ç¨. No restaurant and just a small shop whit souvenirs.

Having visited Spain for over 20 years everyone said we should go to Elche and this year we went... Let's just say we won't be rushing back in the next 20!!! The palm groves were lovely but not really worth the 3 hr drive.... The palmeral was difficult to find and we ended up following the tour bus!!! It was very hot & humid & there was nowhere to cool off- don't be sucked in by the oasis pictures they are in the hotel!!!

Visited the gardens admittedly at the end of the season. Palm trees don't seem to differ, once you've seen one you've seen them all!
Although the actual gardens themselves were worth a visit but only if you are staying locally, we had driven 2hrs to get to Elche
Fascinating range of palm trees, plants and some cacti. Tranquil, calm and well laid out, the garden was very interesting and even taking in everything did not take a lot of time to get around.

titulo: Not sure if we found it or not
conteudo:
As other reviewers have commented you're never sure if this is 'it'. The tourist office tried to be helpful but we found it difficult to grasp 'what can we see here'.
Nevertheless what we saw was interesting and there is plenty of potential for photography here.

There are supposed to be around 181 000 palmtrees within Elche's city limits- but if you ask someone, where to find el palmeral, they stare at you as if you came from outerspace....to cut the long story short: there is no ONE palmtreepark - Elche IS the palmtreepark! But el palmeral might be commonly understood as the huerto del cura, a small park of 13000 qm with around 1000 palmtrees. You pay an entrance fee of ‚Ç¨ 5.- and you dive into an oasis of tranqulity and peace, you watch the high palmtrees shaking in the warm breeze, and you relax in the shadow of the palmleaves.
It is easy to get there by local train (cercan√≠as) from Alicante, this takes you about 25 mins. to Elche parc . If you leave the station building in Elche parc, turn left, pass the parking lot and turn again left, then all straight towards the city centre. Takes you about 15 mins to the huerto an the palmeral-museum (museum closed from 2 pm to 4 pm, sundays only open from 10 am to 1.30 pm).
If you love palm trees, this UNESCO world heritage site is a must.

titulo: If you like palms... this is the place for you!
conteudo: Elche is full of palms, it really is. The palm groves are spectacular - take your camera with you and a packed lunch!

One of the biggest Palm parks in the region, here you will find all sorts of palms in a nice well maintained parks. Beware of the summer months it can get very warm (don't forget your bottle of water)
Loved this town. You could spend a day here discovering the museums and parks. visit the tower by the cathedral, it gives you views all over the province and the palm trees.
A good place to visit but not when it is pouring with rain.Lots of different palms to see and a restaurant if you are hungry.

titulo: Wonderful Palm Garden and combined with a visit to Elche town a nice day out
conteudo: This park has a hughe amount of different palm trees with lovely paths to stroll along. You think that you might be at some very tropical location. If you combine this visit with a walk through the lovely town of Elche and maybe with lunch in one of the excellent restaurants it will be an unforgettable experience.
Very peaceful gardens, with lots of interesting plants, especially the strangest palm tree in the worls, with 8 (I think) trunks all originating from one root. Also many turtles in pools.

This is a must visit when in Elche, As you walk around you see lots of different kinds of trees and palms, it was like a small botanical garden but for trees rather than flowers. Elche doesn't have a beach so this is definitely the place to visit on a hot day. But if you dont get to this exact park remember Elche is FULL of parks and all of them are full of palms. To get your bearings go to the tourist office (outside municipal park - also amazing) to get a map and park hop your way around the city. Another little tip when crossing a bridge look down, under the bridge is another park area where you can see the city from another view. Enjoy !!

Although only a small park area, it was lovely, very well set out. The exhibits were all healthy and there were good facilities. A shop for souvenirs was reasonable and it was a most enjoyable hour or so.

Elche proved to be a worthy place to visit with the historical sites in the city centre & the fantastic Palmeral and the municipal park.
Whilst staying in the Alicante region, pay a visit to Elche & Palmerals, I don't think you'll be disapointed.

titulo: a bit of shade on a hot day
conteudo: From Alicante you can get to Elche by train. It would take about 25 minutes. Get off at Elche Parc train station and walt just 2-3 minutes to the Palmeral. It will give you some shade on a hot day. Enjoy!
a peaceful oasis right in the middle of busy elche, always with a beautiful selection of flowers and palms. The walk alomg the river is particularly enjoyful.

Elche is a phenomenon in itself as it has thousands of palm trees. As you travel around the town they are everywhere. Although this is a little away from the main tourist areas, if you have a car it is well worth a visit.

titulo: Interesting but..............don't go there on a Sunday
conteudo:
Elche is worth a trip, but not on a sunday when its 36 celcius an virtually everything (tourist office, cathedral, museum, most restaurants an bars) is closed.
We were very happy to find the bar across from the cathedral.
But, the palm groves along the river (a 1 mtr wide trickle in juli) are spectacular and the restaurants look good.
The center of Elche has a nice feel but the old part is small and in a few locations spoilt by new buildings. And the newer part looks like it could be buzzing on any other day.

Elche is one of the most beautiful places I have visited. There are palms everywhere. The municipal park is stunning and I could have spent the whole day in there. Lots of places for children to play.

titulo: Unique Palm Groves of unique Elche
conteudo: Palms are everywhere which gives a unique feel to the city of Elche.

Difficult to find from the motorway as there are no signs at all. Impossible to park if you are lucky enough to find it, we drove around for an hour and finally gave up. We don't have a problem parking in any other Spanish cities including Madrid. We would have loved to visit the other attractions but had nowhere to put the car.
Must visit if you are in Elche. During summer time choose to visit in the morning or late evening when the sun is not to hot !

Worth the visit amazing cool, and all plants in very good condition.
Weddings use this for photos places to sit and take it all in. Loved it.

This garden seems such an unassuming little place at first, it carries a relaxed air and you soon slip into it. Everywhere you look there is something, often things are not as they first appear, lawns are often not grass, what you think are weeds, aren't, even the wondrous palms aren't what they first appear. Once you look closely there are so many varieties, so many differences and you find yourself choosing favourites before you know it. I have to admit that the star of the show is the 6 trunked palm really didn't do it for me. Don't get me wrong it was wondrous but not the best thing by far for me. Now that would be the cactus gardens. I have never seen cacti like that before ever! The thoughtful planting, the architecture of the design and then the astounding specimens themselves! I have never really even liked cacti before visiting the Priests garden, but now they are amongst my favourite plants.

This is a must if at all possible. A truly wonderful garden.

If you are planning a visit make sure to get good directions. This isn't well advertised and is tucked away down a side street so without pre planning you may have difficulty finding it however it is worth the effort.

wasnt far too go taxi cost 8euros lots of people travelled here from miles around my sister also took me here and my brother in law its lovely you must always try somewere even if people say no whats not good for them may be great for someone else
the variety of plants and palms were amazing very well kept and well worth the admission fee

titulo: not a single indication, but nice
conteudo: you have to drive around and around and there is no indication ,promotion, explanation and it is often surrounded bu ugly buildings

titulo: You have to go and have a look!
conteudo: It is amazing the amount of trees this place has and diversity of them.  The history is amazing as well with the background of the trees as well.  a must see.

titulo: interesting place for people from the north
conteudo: I like palms, and visiting of Elche was logical choice, while we were enjoying our vacation in Alicante. It's a good place to relax in one of gardens and see rich collection of palms. Since we had just 3 hours time for this stop, we decided to take a little train and together with singing group of local children visited most interesting places in a short time. Maybe Elche can surprise also those, who can see palms every day?

a breath of Nature amongst the palm trees of Elche. How simply lucky one is to be able to spend a night or two in the lovely Huerta del Cura Hotel in a World Heritage Center . Peace and quietness , surrounding a beautiful pool and delightful tropical gardens . the room was perfect, large and a cosy bed with a great bathroom. If I may add a suggestion , the room would be nicer if it was a little less plain , ie paintings or photos on the walls. thank you for a great stay

titulo: A place of calm and beauty
conteudo: If you want to take a little break from the Alicante seaside this is the perfect day trip. The Huerta del Cura of Elche is an amazing garden wiht the largest diversity of palm trees in Europe. It offers the visitor a nice stroll in the shade

We have been there in February and it was great. Just a small advice: start the exploration from the Municipal Parc of Elche. We have pointed the spot via the GPS and took us to the opposite side of the park...
Wandering around this palmeral was a delight.we both said we'd visit again but at a different time of the year.

titulo: A tranquil garden in the middle of a city
conteudo:
The old town of Elche is surrounded by palm groves but there is a garden called Huerto del Cura which is worth a visit. It's not very big but has nearly 1,000 palm trees and lots of other plants including a collection of cactii.

The garden is well laid out with curving paths and ponds.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: Super interesante este bonito museo dentro de la preciosa fortaleza medieval que sirve de envoltura del museo. Al final de la visita hay una sala privada para ver una reproducci√≥n de la dama de Elche con los colores primigenios que tuvo est√° sobresaliente sacerdotisa de rango supremo. La figura en si es una urna funeraria.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
titulo: Conoce la historia de Elche de forma amena
conteudo: Fuimos por la ma√±ana de viernes santo y aprovechamos la visita guiada de las 11:00, el gu√≠a Dani hace la visita s√∫per amena, entretenida e interesante. A mi hija de 10 a√±os le encant√≥, cuenta toda la evoluci√≥n de Elche desde la prehistoria. En el museo est√° incluido el Palacio de Altamira. Muy recomendada la visita, dura 1 hora y media aproximadamente.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo:
Fuimos en domingo por la ma√±ana y la entrada era libre.

conteudo:

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: Great value for money at only 3 euros to learn about the history and lifestyles that existed in this part of Spain since the iron age. Exhibition also included tour of castle with spectacular views.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
titulo: Impressive museum exploring several areas of historical significance.
conteudo: Another impressive museum in Alicante province presenting the history of the region. This museum preserves a large collection of remains found in the excavation of the many sites in the region, including the Venus found in a water tank on the Alcudia site. Presentation is clear and well documented, but most impressive is the way the museum uses historic spaces. You enter through a modern building and then go through an underground passage under the square to see the Arab walls and towers and then into the castle where the final rooms are to be found. There is also a cafe and a public car park beneath the building.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: The museum is very well laid out, tons of information on each of the exhibits. The staff we met were very friendly and helpful. The views from the battlements are spectacular.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: A nice place to visit if you are in Elche. The Basilica is great to walk around. Parking is under the building and not too expensive. Most exhibits had explanations in English. Enjoyed it.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
titulo: Worth a visit + free entrance on Sundays
conteudo:
I‚Äôve learnt a lot about Elche and the surrounding area - it has made the rest of my trip here a lot more enjoyable because it has given a bit more depth to the places we‚Äôve visited!

We were pleasantly surprised that almost all information was given in both Spanish and English. We also discovered that entrance is free on Sundays.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
titulo: Worthwhile visiting for a better understanding of the ancient history
conteudo: The museum exhibits with good didactical guidance, artefacts and information (in English and Spanish (to the town history. Thus giving interesting information bout the Iberian, Roman, Arab, Christian influences to the town development

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: I really enjoyed the way this museam is structured, starting from early ages to more modern times. Very interesting way to spend the day, with lovely views over the park behind the museam. Please note all the other museams in the area are closed on Mondays :-)

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: We had an interesting 90 minutes or so looking around the museum. The kids loved the interactive displays which showed them each article on display in English and told them more about that artefact. They were quite engaged throughout the whole museum, a hard thing to do with 3 young children! Ever so cheap to go in. I bought a guide too (Spanish only I think) and for 5 of us and a guide was only ‚Ç¨12. A fab way to get out of the sun and cool off for a bit while learning some history of the area.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
titulo: The museum is a work of art in itself
conteudo: We loved this museum! Spacious, neat, well set-out displays, not crowded. Lots to see, both inside and out. Excellent value for money. Well worth the visit.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
titulo: excellent preservation and interpretation of this building
conteudo: We parked underneath the visitors centre, not realising the experience we found above. This place is set out very well with interpretative displays, education spaces and easy to follow layout. Definitely worth a visit (and easy parking as well)

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: Fantastic afternoon in the historical town of Elche. We were overcome with emotion when we visit The Basilica De Santa Maria. A must see. Only 45 minute drive from our place. Look forward going back again to bring friend's.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: An interesting introduction to the history of the city. Modern displays which are well designed. The building itself is interesting and views from the top are well worth the climb

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: What a lovely city , spent a lovely hour wandering around the museo and we had it allby ourselves . The view from the top was lovely . Only ‚Ç¨3 to get in so well worth it .

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
titulo: Great local museum and well worth a visit
conteudo: Attractively presented and well-laid out museum covering the archaeology and history of the area from prehistoric times right up to the twentieth century. Artefacts are displayed in context and there is interpretation in Spanish, Valencian and English. Includes opportunity for external walk around the old walls. Well worth an hour or so and 5 euros.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: This museum built into an historical medieval building and it host a lots of gems of cultures that flourished in this part of Spain. Essential to understand the history of the region and very well presented

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: We eventually found the entrance which is down some steps near the cafe Mahe. 3 euros entrance fee and what a journey. Going way back in time through the different occupations. Plenty of relics on display as well as written explanations. Follow the signs to the roof and walk the walls. Great photo opportunities from up there. There is a shop at the end of your journey.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
titulo: Stunning combo  both the palace and the museum
conteudo: The museum was extended as recently as 2006. It's divided clearly into two parts . One deals with the archaeological side and the inhabitants of the area up to the Islamic occupation and the rise of the 'new' city. The other focuses on the historical aspects of the city's development to the modern day.Sounds dull but far from it. Once you've taken in the awesome collection , you can wander round the walls and appreciate the beautiful building. On leaving, admire the fountains outside-pity I couldn't see all this at night as I imagine it looks spectacular.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: Very interesting and well thought out museum with the lay out and linking it to the castle. Lots of things to see through the thousands of years of history of Elche as well as some films very well done depicting life as it was thousands of yeas ago. At 3 euros entry fee, worth a visit. Nice view from the top.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: By chance I visited on a Sunday and so got free entry and a free guided tour from a really knowledgeable and enthusiastic museum guide called Enrique - even more surprisingly, there was nobody else on the tour so there was plenty of opportunity to ask questions and have a proper conversation about the history of Elche. I feel I have added a few important pieces to the jigsaw of information I have in my mind about the various peoples and cultures inhabiting this area over the last few thousand years, eg hunter-gatherers, Phoenicians, Iberians, Romans, Muslims, Jews and the Catholics of the Counter-Reformation. I went away thinking about the idea of the melting pot of humanity and the overlapping of different languages, technologies and belief systems as prehistory gave way to cultures which left written evidence. This was a far cry from the usual scripted and wooden tour you get in some museums. The exhibits are clearly labelled in three languages including (slightly odd) English. translations. My only quibble about the whole experience of the visit is that the traditional exit through the gift shop showed a neglected aspect of the museum. They could subsidise their important historical work by adding a bit more commerce here, with souvenir pens and so forth, as many museums in Britain and Ireland do. There were a few random things for sale, but a lot of empty shelves. The cafeteria is run by a local restaurant and is independent of the museum. Its choice of food is very limited but its location is excellent. it can be entered from the street even when the museum is shut.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo:
Far too much to record in a review, it is just somewhere you have got to visit and see for yourself. The Museum is really well laid out and the exhibits easy to see and read about, the large screen TV's are very interesting to watch, our visit was just a very, very enjoyable experience and we would gladly go back again because there is so much to take in and see in both the museum and the castle, that one visit is not enough.
An excellent attraction.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: Fascinating look at the history of the area audio visuals really bought this to life. The real treat was going up to the walls to look at the views.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: Interesting ancient castle in the center of the city of Elche. For history buffs, and just for tourists will be interesting to visit the Museum

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo:
Had a whirlwind visit here (I'd recommend at least an hour) as I was meeting friends but nevertheless I was impressed with the way in which the story of Elche has been shown.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
titulo: Excellent to visit with children, though we are 33 and we liked it :)

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo:
Visited with friends when it first opened in the morning meaning we had the place to ourselves. We really enjoyed the spacious air conditioned rooms with all he artefacts and exhibited items although the lighting could be better.

You follow a marked route around the museum which takes you up and down stairs so be aware.

A great way to spend a few hours, with the park behind and Basillica across the road it's a great area to spend time.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: Although the MAHE is not exactly the British Museum, the focus here is on quality rather than quantity: the number of objects on display is not overwhelming, but some of them are quite impressive, even if the archaeological jewel of the crown, the famous Dama de Elche, is in exile, alas, at the Museo Arqueol√≥gico Nacional in Madrid.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
titulo: Lovely place for a family visit. Good quality exhibitions and artifacts.
conteudo:
Spend a good few hours here in the lovely air conditioning. Good selection and also entertaining for younger children. Lots of multi media screens for further in depth information.

We combined it with a trip to the basilica del maria with is just across the street. Good little local food places around also. It was also free for some reason (local holiday, sunday or something else). Please note on sunday there are some different opening hours for all museums.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
titulo: discover elche in the historical times
conteudo: its fantastic, very good price, and the museum was well equipped to give the audience a back in time journey in the history of elche

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo:
... just when one would like to visit, free time etc.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: Nicely explains what this particular area of Elche meant to our ancestors, and what they used to get up to. surrounded by some impressive looking ruins too, Situated in an ancient fortress that dates back to the Berbers. What I did find very nice about this place was the plaza in which it sits, nice squeeky marble pavement, a line of letter bollards signifying the name of the place, I really liked it, and will be back next year when I visit Elche.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo:
The Museum is located inside the Altamira Palace and right next to the aqueduct ruin which used to supply water to the city, built in the XVII century.

Its six rooms take you from the neolitic period to the recent history, including ceramics, jewels and representations of iberic graves and habitats.

Opened only six years ago, the MAHE has a mixture of historical, archeaological and leyend feeling that keeps you entertained for a couple of hours.

As the Basilica is located right opposite the MAHE, we visited the museum whilst the Basilica de santa Maria was closed, at 36 degrees temperature outside and the MAHE had a wonderful air conditioned temperature of 20 degrees.

The only things I would improve would be the lighting in some of the exhibitis seems to be poor and the text is too small as it is in Spanish, English and Valenciano.

estabelecimento: MAHE - Museu Arqueol√≤gic i d'Hist√≤ria d'Elx (MAHE) - Elche
conteudo: Well set out artefacts and excellent views from the castle roof. Very good value at only ‚Ç¨7 for 2 adults and a child.

titulo: Patrimonio Inmaterial de la Comunidad Valenciana
conteudo: El Misteri de Elche es un Drama Sacro L√≠rico Religioso que se celebra todos los a√±os en la Bas√≠lica de Santa Mar√≠a con motivo de las fiestas mayores de la ciudad.

titulo: TODO EL MUNDO DEBER√çA DE CONOCERLO Y ASISTIR AL MENOS UNA VEZ EN LA VIDA

titulo: Quieres ver algo diferente en tu vida especial?

titulo: Toda una referencia para la ciudad de Elche
