Visit√© el Zoo con mi hijo de 3 a√±os y un par de miembros de la familia. Nos dieron tickets de descuento que nos dejaron pagar s√≥lo por 15‚Ç¨ por persona. Cogimos un almuerzo de picnic ya que tienen bancos para el uso de picnickers. Hay pocos lugares que venden comida y bebidas.
Por lo poco que pagamos creo que fue un gran d√≠a. Aunque tiene un aspecto un poco descuidado en lugares los animales parecen ser muy bien cuidado. parecen estar en muy buen estado de salud y ninguno de los signos t√≠picos de estr√©s o aburrimiento que ves en algunos parques. Los espect√°culos son en dos veces al d√≠a y un paseo en el tren pasa un par de veces al d√≠a. Todos disfrutamos. Llevar una maleta grande de manzanas y zanahorias con usted para alimentar a los animales o puedes comprar cacahuetes para alimentarlos. Nunca me he alimentado una jirafa antes y no pod√≠a creer lo que estaba tierno.
Hay una piscina para uso pero estaba cerrado porque era invierno!
Sin duda volveremos el a√±o que viene.

Un mont√≥n de animales que ver, 3 espect√°culos a trav√©s del d√≠a, loros, leones de mar y un elefante.
Las pocas zonas del zoo parec√≠a un poco vac√≠o, pero bastante grande zoo, ya que s√≥lo esper√°bamos un lugar peque√±o con 4 diferentes animales!
que intentan llegar a haber un mont√≥n de fotos con animales, etc. para hacer dinero.
Llevar repelente de insectos ya que hay un mont√≥n de moscas, mi esposa me picaron mucho!
En general, aunque el buen d√≠a especialmente si tienes ni√±os.
Tome sus troncos como ofrecen a nadar con leones marinos y tambi√©n hay una peque√±a zona de piscina con un gran tobog√°n. zona de juegos para ni√±os y yo vi una se√±al para karts.

titulo: La crueldad a los animales, as√≠ que no visita.
conteudo: Fuimos un poco esto, me pareci√≥ un poco cutre pero a√∫n as√≠ pagamos nuestro dinero y fuimos. Cada recinto era demasiado peque√±a, sucio y descuidado. Los animales estaban sufriendo de estr√©s mental. Nos fuimos despu√©s de 15 minutos, molestos.

titulo: excelente d√≠a para toda la familia
conteudo:
Visitamos aqu√≠ al principio de Agosto conmigo, mi marido, nuestro 6 a√±os, mi madre y mi suegra. El precio de entrada es muy razonable en 16 euros para adultos y 12 euros para ni√±os y pensionistas (esto fue un descuento ya que recoge un 30% descuento en la Zenia Boulevard).
Es un poco descarado que tienes que pagar para aparcar, pero esto parece ser bastante com√∫n en atracciones en Espa√±a, s√≥lo un par de euros.
El personal no puede fallar, son muy serviciales.
El parque es impecable, los animales bien cuidados y hay mucho que hacer. Me qued√© muy impresionado que te permite entrar y salir del parque de safari, as√≠ que puedes conseguir cosas desde su coche como ropa o picnics.
Como con todas las atracciones la una cosa que hacen su dinero en las fotograf√≠as con los animales. Compramos 10 en total costaba unos 46 euros adicionales, pero ya sabes lo que vali√≥ cada centavo para ver el aspecto de nuestros hijos cara sent√°ndose en elefante, ten√≠a el le√≥n marino poner la cabeza en √©l y todos nos jugamos con los leones de mar (30 euros cada uno). Fue incre√≠ble de acercarse a estos mam√≠feros marinos.
incluido en el precio de entrada es una peque√±a caminata safari alrededor del sitio, un espect√°culo de leones marinos, loros y Elephant show.
Las cosas adicionales justo fuera de la entrada son los paseos en camello, paseos en burro, go karts - peque√±o cargo por cada uno. √°reas de picnic gratis, piscina con un tobog√°n y zonas de juego. peque√±o restaurante que ten√≠a buena pinta, pero s√≥lo compr√≥ bebidas fr√≠as y helados como ten√≠amos nuestra propia picnic
No puedo esperar para volver el a√±o que viene. Sin duda recomiendo una visita. (llegamos a las 10:30 h y nos fuimos a las 7.30 pm, hacer tiempo para ver todo!)

titulo: Un poco caro pero un d√≠a precioso
conteudo:
Nos lo pasamos muy bien en el parque safari.

Los animales todos parecen estar bien cuidados y hay una buena variedad.

El zoo permite un buen nivel de interacci√≥n con los animales que nuestros hijos disfrutaron.

No era un fan de los 'opcionales extras para comprar, pero supongo que va con el territorio cuando usted recibe un 30% de descuento para la entrada.

La piscina y el tobog√°n gratis era una gran ventaja que nos utilizado. Tambi√©n el tobog√°n no tiene - l√≠mite de altura que nuestro hijo de 4 a√±os se apreciaron mucho.

Uno de los mejores zool√≥gicos que hemos visto en Espa√±a. Todos los animales eran muy animado y alerta a diferencia de otros zool√≥gicos hemos estado en donde apenas ver cualquiera de los animales. Todo parec√≠a muy bien cuidado y felices en su entorno. El personal es muy amable y servicial. algunos espect√°culos estupendos y la interacci√≥n con diferentes animales como el monkey's, serpientes y una piscina muy grande con el le√≥n de mar's. El zoo es muy buena relaci√≥n calidad-precio, sobre todo si te dan un vale de descuento que son un mont√≥n de lleno en los mercados locales y centros de informaci√≥n tur√≠stica.

El zoo est√° muy bien distribuida. Hay algunos espect√°culos con animales y una piscina. Buena relaci√≥n calidad-precio. El personal era muy amable y servicial. El show de leones marinos fue genial y alimentar los animales era lo m√°s destacado. Los animales no parec√≠a ser la m√°s cuidada que me enfad√≥ y por esa raz√≥n que probablemente no volveremos.
S√≥lo he estado una vez pero volver√≠a otra vez! buen d√≠a. podr√≠a hacer con un poco de modernizaci√≥n pero es un zoo al final del d√≠a. Sin duda vale la pena visitarlo!

Mi hijo ama los animales y as√≠ que visitamos este parque en julio, en el lado positivo el personal (todos ellos) fueron maravillosos, todos vinieron como c√°lido y servicial. El caf√© est√° bien, hicimos comidas empaquetadas pero utilizamos la cafeter√≠a para bebidas y aperitivos a un precio razonable. Los animales tienen forma y bien, el mayor inconveniente para nosotros eran los recintos, hab√≠a muy poca imaginaci√≥n utilizada, algunas dan muy triste. El lugar tiene el tama√±o para ser algo magn√≠fico pero todo parece un poco cansado. Los espect√°culos nuevamente dejamos un poco de mal sabor en la boca, no s√© si un elefante de baile es apropriate hoy en d√≠a! La piscina no est√° mal, no es enorme y tiene un tobog√°n de agua. bien para terminar su d√≠a all√≠.

titulo: lobos marinos hacen gala bien, evitar el resto!
conteudo:
A mis hijos les encanta animales, y estando cerca de es incluso mejor. Como el R√≠o Safari Elche ofrece encuentros cercanos con lobos marinos hacen gala, parec√≠a un destino perfecto. Nos dieron nuestros billetes cinco minutos antes de empezar. El evento estaba fuera del parque, as√≠ que se apresuraron a entrar a la habitaci√≥n para cambiarse y en la piscina. Disfrutamos cada minuto! El poder KISS la leones marinos era el para√≠so para ni√±os amante del animal.

Pero luego nos dieron dentro. La primera cosa que nos recibi√≥ una chica que quer√≠an tener nuestra fotograf√≠a tomada con una serpiente. Por supuesto, s√≥lo diario Park fotograf√≠as, no nos permitieron utilizar nuestro propio c√°maras. Cuando le dije que quer√≠a coger el Elephant show que estaba a punto de empezar, ella minti√≥ y dijo que no empezar por horas. Despu√©s de unos minutos, nos enteramos de que hab√≠a sido enga√±ado por alguien que prefieren pulsar fotograf√≠as en nosotros. Luego cogimos el recorrido en el parque. No era nada pero deprimente. sucio o aglomerada o a veces ambas jaulas era el orden del d√≠a. Los animales parec√≠a descuidados. El zoo estaban cambiando el agua en uno de los cocodrilo piscinas, pero no se molestaron en limpiar entre. Los caimanes parec√≠a desinteresado en la comida - hab√≠a muchas gallinas en la piscina, flotando o tumbados en la planta baja, que para m√≠ es una se√±al de malhumorado lo hubiera hecho pedazos.

Algunas veces demasiado a menudo, he ido a parques zool√≥gicos y estado deprimido sobre c√≥mo los animales son tratados. √âsta fue otra oportunidad de ese tipo. albergues de animal debe ser apoyado, pero no R√≠o Safari Elche. Parques zool√≥gicos est√°n haciendo m√°s milenio pasado.

Puede querer hacer el nadar leones marinos, ya que no requiere de entrar. Pero despu√©s de eso, por favor.

Hemos visitado R√≠o Safari varias veces antes cuando est√°n de vacaciones en la zona de Alicante. Aunque parece un poco descuidada, creo que es s√≥lo una cosa de espa√±ol.
Esta vez aunque la zona de la piscina estaba abierto el tobog√°n de agua estaba cerrado, lo que era una pena, ya que los nietos est√°bamos deseando ir. El personal en todas las zonas son todos muy amables y la nataci√≥n con sellos para los discapacitados era agradable de ver.
El safari en s√≠ fue tomada en remolques alrededor del parque, que dura unos 20 minutos. yo no lo siento por los animales, como sus bol√≠grafos/√°reas estaban muy est√©ril y con temperaturers en los 40 era casi tortura para nosotros que solo ellos. Luego caminamos por el resto del parque, que de nuevo era dif√≠cil ir con el calor. Pero los peque√±ajos toque zona fue genial, en un punto uno de los guardianes tir√≥ una cabra de un plomo en uno de nuestros nietos y dej√≥ con √©l, que ten√≠a un trabajo volver. no la derecha horarios para ver los numerosos espect√°culos en el diferente arena's. Pero en general disfrutar de la experiencia.
Nos pareci√≥ que por recoger folletos de Elche Tourist Office ahorramos mucho en las tarifas de entrada.
solo se paga para entrar en el Safari, todo lo dem√°s es Pague como usted Go. Lo que no fue un problema. El aparcamiento es gratuito aunque un hombre de venta 1 ofrece un billete electr√≥nico como una donaci√≥n por alg√∫n costo proyecto mientras.
Puedes montar en camello o Shetland pony, tienen mini coches el√©ctricos, etc.
Los Go Karts son algo m√°s, el chico que trabajaba ellos era genial con los ni√±os y les anim√≥ a carrera m√°s dif√≠cil. Nos gust√≥ tanto que volvimos varios d√≠as despu√©s, justo para los karts.
Todo el parque es photograhers y puedes comprar la foto en las heladeras con imanes de fobb clave o simplemente como una foto por unos 3-5 euros.

Un gran d√≠a.

Este safari park es una joya escondida que es genial para cualquier persona local para que

El parque ofrece entretenimiento todo el d√≠a con grandes espect√°culos de animales (elefantes y leones de mar en particular) y algunas magn√≠ficas oportunidades para tomar fotos de acercarse despu√©s.

La espectacular atracci√≥n es la posibilidad de nadar con los leones de mar (no hacer esto personalmente pero no ver otra familia disfrutar) - ver los Mammoth leones de mar nadando con los ni√±os era incre√≠ble y estar√° haciendo que la pr√≥xima vez que visite.

Tambi√©n hay muchos otros animales en exhibici√≥n, chimpanc√©s juntando, jirafas, leones, tigres y incluso un Hippo o dos!

Aseg√∫rate de que te dan en el recorrido safari gratis por la oportunidad recintos - una gran foto

Visited today, 3/11/21, slightly out of season so the park was very quiet. We maybe saw 10 other families / groups of people and this was mainly at the Lemur talk and then the Sea Lion show. Some might argue that the prices do not reflect the quality of the experience, but for what the place is they are fine. Some of the enclosures were in need of a bit of TLC but we imagine as it‚Äôs only just the end of the summer months some improvement may be made in the off season. In fact we saw quite a lot of maintenance men working on one of the old display stands which is promising. We were impressed by the train ride (kids loved it) and how close you could get to the lemurs as part of the talk. The staff were all very helpful and the photos taken of us on entrance to the park and then on the train were brilliant. The covered food court area is nice when it‚Äôs hot as it provides some much needed shade, as well as the adjacent play park which was good for letting the children burn off some steam. We will no doubt visit again in the future. Unfortunately the splash park area was closed, again we think because of the time of year.

Please don't visit this park. Firstly it is way over priced for what it is but worse than that is the way the poor animals are kept.
One lonely seal swimming in a small, not very clean pool. Lonely little monkeys, on their own in too small cages, obviously depressed from their body language. Very neglected small enclosures and the Safari Train is a Pick-up truck pulling two trailors with rows of seats bolted in, (certainly not safe for children) with only a piece of rope across the opening. Even the toilets didn't work properly, the one I used didn't flush. There were weeds everywhere along the paths. We didn't bother staying for their displays becuse we couldn't wait to get out of the place. I feel sorry for the employees as well as the animals, I imagine they are too few and badly paid. Animal welfare should really close this place down. Certainly, as an animal lover I regret having visited.

titulo: Safari was great. Avoid the pool.
conteudo: The safari was lovely. The animal enclosures were cleaner than the pool. AVOID the splash park. There were two poos in the pool and no staff seemed to care. They were removed with a bag and the pool stayed open. stains were left and nothing was disinfected. Not what we expected, especially in a pandemic. Asked for a refund for the splash park, and the staff didn‚Äôt care or seem surprised about this. No refund was given. Would not recommend, unless you enjoy playing dodge the poo when you swim. It was an enjoyable day until then.
The animals aren't looked after properly, they are kept in dirty VERY small spaces, it really upset me seeing them like that

We went to the zoo yesterday and throughly enjoyed it. We were lucky enough to arrive just before the lemurs had there snacks and we were allowed in with them they were jumping all over us what an experience !!! The staff were very informative and helpful. The rest of the zoo and the Animals are very well taken care of clean and well loved. I would definitely recommend going in November if you can we felt like we had the whole place to our selves it was Brilliant !!! The water park wasn't open but it wasn't warm enough to swim anyway. You can definitely make a full day of it here they serve food but we took sandwiches and ate them watching the tigers. I think that it was definitely worth the entry fee which you can get at a discount if you book online beforehand. So if you have a free day go and visit you won't be disappointed let's help this place to keep going with their breeding programs and animal care, They had no help with money over the 3 month lockdown as one of the keepers were telling us and it would be a shame to loose such a great zoo. Oh and theres a new baby giraffe nearly forgot about that little cutie so much to see !!! Will definitely be going back

Very enjoyable day out, you can really get close to the animals unlike UK zoos. Makes it a magical experience, despite the Covid situation they had done their best at keeping as much open as possible. Was a good day out, the only negative thing I would say is they need to improve the paths. They are made of a light dust/gravel mixture and on a windy day like today we spent the whole time shielding our eyes from dust flying in to them (recommend taking sunglasses, we left ours at home because they steam up with masks, rookie error!). But got extremely up close with a female lion, 3 feet the other side of the glass, a cheetah who was joining in playing with a girl (through the glass), and when the orangutan spotted us she climbed up & handed us a stick through a gap in the woodwork, was a beautiful experience. Best bit of the day was when a lady banged on the tiger glass to get them to look over for a picture. The tiger waited for her back to turn then charged at the glass & roared through it at her, that‚Äôll teach her! Well worth a visit :)
Spend family day out there, park could do with money spend on it, the bird part was so sad.... why not put music in there for the parrotsbtomlearn new words.

Had a lovely day out with my daughter and granddaughters. The park was really well kept, the animals all looked content and well looked after. The ‚Äòtrain‚Äô ride around the park, as well as the talks , were included in the admission price and were interesting and informative in Spanish and English. Just a few of the older area looked perhaps a little smaller than ideal, but overall a good day, and it exceeded our expectations.
Animals did not look good, seemed like maintanace budget was spent of food area‚Äôs and not the animals

Spent the day there with my 1 year old son and wife used the 2 for 1 offer so cost a total of ‚Ç¨22 for us all, very decent money for a day out!
The place itself is very clean, the safari trip is short but quite good, the animals look in good condition I just felt the enclosures could of been bigger hence no 5 star, Animals in captivity arnt really nice to see but lioe i said conditions are good and my son loved seeing the animals up close.
Very good day out for the money.

Had wanted to visit this attraction for some time so took the opportunity to do so when 2 x 1 deal came up this month whilst out of season. Had read some reviews prior to visiting, one of which was very negative about the standard of care towards the animals which was a little off putting Glad I went with an open mind as my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our day. Personally, could see no evidence of animals not being fed enough or being neglected in any way. Keepers attended to and interested with them throughout the day. Was nice being able to wander round at our own pace without the usual queues! Venue is a little tired but great for families with young children.

My wife and I visited the park in early December this year.... Finding the place is a little bit challenging as the signs for the park are a little bit scarce.. but once there the adventure began... Free ample parking and a 2 for 1 deal on entry.... ‚ÄúBARGAIN‚Äù the very friendly staff ran thorough the timetable of events for the day (in English) we arrived at about 11am just in time for a train safari, the running commentary
in Spanish and English was very good.. the train safari lasted about 20 mins and gets up close to many of the animals, the best part it‚Äôs FREE and you can ride as many times as you like.... We then went to the parrot show. Not your normal show with animal doing tricks, it was a very informative talk by a keeper about the welfare of the parents in the wild.. then on to the sea lion show.. this had the same theme as the parrot show. Very informative..
we then walked round the park following the easy to read map.. 95% of the park is well kept but in some parts did look a bit run down... I must say all the animals with the exception of the crocs looked very well looked after, not that the crocs looked mistreated just the cages was bland and a little run down.. we also had a very good time in the Leymers enclosure at feeding time... this is a ‚ÄúMUST DO‚Äù the lovely critters jumping on and off y ou it‚Äôs amazing... and finally the zebra and giraffe talk was very informative... we spent about 5 hours at the park and totally loved every minute...

titulo: Fun day trip for the whole family
conteudo:
November is not the peak season so we basically had the zoo for ourselves! Short drive from Torrevieja and smooth parking at Rio Safari. The staff was friendly and helpful. The zoo was clean and all of the animals well taken care of. We're pretty sure we met King Julien as well. üòÑ

The facilities could use a lil improvement, but the restrooms were clean, if a lil worn out. Big plus for the amazing coffee sold at the small kiosk!

titulo: Lack of animal care and poor shows !
conteudo:
Not really what we expected. The Safari Ride was rushed up with barely audible comments. Luck of care for all animals. Crocodiles suffered form luck of space and water. Some of the animals looked unhealthy. Shows very short with luck of interaction with audience. Staff only interested in taking fotos after each show and make extra profit.
This place needs a proper review by animal welfare organisation.

A very interesting day out, fun filled with exciting animals at every turn.
We took our 8 year old Grandson for a day out while on holiday in Salinas and this is what he chose. He loved it! So many different animal species to see, all very well looked after and healthy looking. Plenty of fascinating information on each enclosure in several languages for those who don't speak Spanish. Lots of stops throughout the Safari park for a bite to eat, a cool drink or just a little rest (as a disabled lady with walking sticks this was perfect for me)
We spent most of the day at the park and our Grandson wasn't bored or fed up once! The sea lion performance was a favourite as was the giraffe which we were able to feed. Very reasonable entry fee with a train ride around the park thrown in with the price. Thoroughly enjoyed our day out. X

Booked this trip with one of the travel companies within benidorm and for 25 euros each we where picked up by the coach and taken to the safari park which is around an hour's drive away. There is a large selection of animals who are all despite what others say well looked after and cared for extremely well. There is plenty to keep you busy all day until the coach picks you up and a lot of entertaining talks on with various animals of which this is offered in multiple languages.

What a lovely place this is. We paid extra so the grandchildren could swim with the sea lions. It was a marvelous experience which the girls loved. Mind you so did Nanny lol.

The water park is also worth the extra 6‚Ç¨ a head.

All in all a wonderful day.

I‚Äôve just got back from visiting this place. I feel sad and ashamed that all the animals are being treated this way. All the enclosures were filthy, old poo everywhere. Animals looked unhealthy, hungry, completely neglected. Crocs enclosure had a tiny bit of water which was green. In the reptile section they have a small Nile crock, in a glass tank with no space at all, it basically just sits there on show all day and night.
There is no attempt to make the enclosures similar to each animals natural habitat, the meerkats need to dig yet they are kept on solid rocks. This place needs to be closed down but I‚Äôm not sure how high the Spanish standards are for animal welfare. Sad and traumatised

Visited here with my husband and two year old granddaughter, brilliant day out getting to see animals you would hardly ever get the chance to see, very well run and staff are so lovely caring and friendly. Splash park is a must to add if you have children with you. Has a lovely restaurant/cafe too.

If you are looking for somewhere to go to fill a couple of hours this is o.k.
If you book the excursion be aware that you are there a long time as the return coach is not until 4.30 and 2 hours here will give you all the time you need. If you have mobility problems use a wheelchair or use a kiddies buggy you will have problems as many paths are soft gravel and some steep slopes. The animals all look well cared for and there is a good selection but the catering is very poor.
Nice zoo for the kids. Plenty of exotic animals to see. The water park is also very nice for the kids. Didn‚Äôt try the go carts though. Would recommend for a family with young kids.

Grandparents, parents and a very active almost 2 year old grandson, where can you go to suit all age groups..... I will tell you Rio Safari Elche. The admission charges were reasonable with concessions available and on line a discount for all was available, and we often see leaflets being handed out offering discounts at Alicante airport and lots of other outlets. Admission includes a ride around the park through the middle of some of the enclosures. This is a area, spaced out well and gave a lot of vantage points at each enclosure. There is a small
Animal area where the children could feed and pet them. The giraffes were the most tender animals to feed, even though they have huge tongues. The park offered displays which to be honest due to the heat we didn‚Äôt sit around and watch, but there are enough things to do without watching. We found the food good, not cheap but actually not extortionately priced. The staff were all lovely. They took ‚Äúofficial‚Äù photos for you, but there was no hard sell to buy them, but what Grandparent worth their salt could resist buying them. There is a small water park alongside and for a couple of euros more you can enjoy this too. There are go karts and small motors for children again outside the park. This was a lovely experience and we will be happy to return with other family members and or friends when they visit, both children and adults would enjoy.

If you visit book online because the queues are very long.
The zoo is fine but nothing to write home about. The enclosure's seem small for some the animals
The water park is in a word dangerous. Some of the slides are just not safe. You come out of the slides at a serious pace into a pool with other people in it. Seen lots of kids getting knocked over by people coming off slides . Then the changing rooms ... they are tiny and not fit for purpose and not at all clean.

After reading a couple reviews i thought that the zoo may have gone downhill in 5 years.
I was wrong , the animals looked fine , in the natural wilds of africa etc water is hard to come by but there was water available, they seem to be fed before it opens and for first couple hrs most animals are resting after food , later they are up and about. The staff was great.
Any downside ? No, maybe the seal lion show is a bit short but ok.
You can buy animal food but only a certain selection can be fed these nuts.
All the cafes and food stalls looked very clean , food was usual stuff of burgers chips baguettes etc etc and looked good portions.
Plenty of shade if you need it.Prices seemed reasonable.there are picnic areas for taking your own food but remember to take something to wipe the table.
A very rustic place.
Just for those in gran alacant , if you are wanting to go but cant figure how to get there go to GA Commercial Centre (down from Lidl side) and look for Costa Blanca Travel Agency shop.
For ‚Ç¨22.50 per adult it will get you into the zoo and a rio safari minibus will pick you up outside shop and bring you back to shop 6 hrs later.
Excellent value for money. They also do many other holiday things.

It‚Äôs taken me a while to write this review because I wanted answers.
I visited Rio Safari Elche in April 2019 (It was a hot day). I am not a fan of zoos in general however, I gave this one the benefit of the doubt considering it is advertising itself to be a conservation centre. What a joke! Where do I begin with this animal prison, sorry ‚ÄúConservation Centre‚Äù.
How about the price. It is ridiculous for what this place is. Money wasted. I cannot believe I paid to enter a place like this. I cannot believe I have contributed to the wages of staff that are allowing animals to live in such conditions. I knew from the first enclosure as I entered this was not the place they are advertising in all the stores, online and in the airport.
The condition of ever single animal, every single one was appalling. It brings tears to my eyes just thinking back to what I saw and the fact I could not do anything. All of the animals looked fed up, miserable and generally unwell. They looked hungry, dehydrated and many very injured.
I have never seen birds in such a state. They were stressed to the point of ripping out there own feathers. And I am not talking about the odd bird here and there which I first thought. It was every single bird with the exception of the show birds, the ones they use as circus animals to preform on demand every few hours to satisfy tourists and try justify the high entertainment price. Not a single bird cage had water or food which should always be available but on such a hot day, this is inhumane. This was a running theme throughout the entire ‚ÄúSafari‚Äù. Lack of water for all animals, which was paying its toll.
The lack of staff was a joke. The only members of staff we saw during our visit I could count on two hands, the majority working behind counters selling tickets, food and souvenirs. The other 2/3 members of staff were doing the ‚Äúshows‚Äù which honestly you can tell these animals did not want to and did not have the energy to ‚Äúperform‚Äù.
I mention the lack of staff not only because you expect to learn about the animals from experts which was not a service available here but also who was looking after the welfare of these animals??? I can tell you, no one.
When the birds from around the world type show was over. We waited for the member of staff to inform her there was a large number of plastic nut bags (sold in store) and a variety of other rubbish within the ostriches area and informed her they were intact eating this rubbish. (I did try to reach out as much as I could however it became rather dangerous and this is what the staff are paid to do surely). The woman showed no interest and stated she would be late for the next show and walked off leaving the ostriches to consume the plastic.
What affected me the most really was the condition of the animals, from the plucked depressed birds at the beginning, the the giraffes covered in scabs and scraps to the bleached crocs with hardly an inch of water to lie in. Nor did the skinny sad looking tigers have water to drink or swim in. I could not believe this place was open and doing so well with tourists. I will never get the images out of my mind of the poor meerkats. Everyone knows a meerkats instinct is to dig. These meerkats were digging into solid ground. Every single one of them having bloody paws and broken nails from trying so desperately to dig holes. The most heartbreaking being one meerkat with what looked to be a bloody broken jaw. This little guy came right to the glass, still bleeding from the mouth, still trying to dig out and all I wanted to do was reach in and give it some help. Once again no staff around and when later reported nothing was done. I know this as I have read recent reviews and this little guy had been mentioned.
What triggered me to write this review is close to the end of my time in this place I witnessed a child kicking a goat that had jumped out of its enclosure. The child was chucking food at the animal then as it got closer to pick up the chucked food the child was nudging and pushing the goat away. Both family and staff said and done nothing about this. I had to address this personally. Which did not go down well with the family. However I do not regret this at all.
When deciding to leave we witnessed the apes drinking out of a filthy pool of water and one even with a plastic bag stuck on its head. I was so shocked and traumatised. Watching members of the public laughing and staff wander past.
It was at this point I took a photo and wished I had taken more to show the harsh reality of this place and beg people not to go.
You may say, ‚Äúbut if more people go they will have more money to look after the animals‚Äù. Well this place is a top destination in Alicante and makes a lot of money. Secondly, the animals should be the priority. If they cannot take care of them they should not have them.
I have contacted the Safari themselves for explanations (excuses) but have received nothing in return.
I know this place will continue to get large crowds, however I truly hope my experience reaches out to a few of you and I beg you not to go. I‚Äôd hate for you to leave feeling the way I still do 4 months after witnessing this.

titulo: Not a lot of animals but a great water park
conteudo: We visited the zoo on a very hot day and went on the safari train around the zoo when we arrived. All the animals were sleeping hidden in the shade, so mostly saw camels, goats and deer! A couple of lions were lounging under a platform, an orangutan was curled up in a corner - not sure if there were more. However, although we didn‚Äôt go into the water park, the kids looked like they were having a fab time in there!

titulo: Dont eat here, take food with you
conteudo:
Rio Safari is a place between Santa Pola and Elche, there are parking spots outside that is free of charge. You get a 4‚Ç¨/ person discount if you buy through the web or if you have the advertisement papers with you. Today with the discount the price is for adult 18;50‚Ç¨, children/senior 13‚Ç¨ and Disabled person 11.90‚Ç¨, University Student 15.75‚Ç¨ (Children: 3-12 years | Adult: 13-64 years | Senior: +65 years)

If you wish to use the waterpark it is an 6‚Ç¨ extra. No family prices or discount Cards if you visit the park often. When entering you receive a man of the area and anime when there is a sea lion show. There is also a time when the safari train goes.

We started of seeing the sea lion show, they do speak both english and spanish in the park but during the show it was very little english and most spanish speaking but the show was cute and plenty of spaces to sit and watch, afterwards you could take a photo with the sea lion. There was also a parking lot before the entrance to the show for the wagons and inside there was a small kiosk where you could buy water.

After the show we descided to walk around in the park, it was high season so very warm. At some places there has been put up ‚Äùroofs with net‚Äù but I would have wanted to see that on more places. The most of the animals looked to be very healthy, except for the horses. Theyre mission seems to be to take care of the animals but there isnt written anything anywhere that they have taken care of the horses and given them a safer home. As they presented a video of a monkey finding its way to Elche.

Some of their drink/ icecream machines didnt work and there was only seen a changing machine in the beginning of the tour.

If you are hungry, take food with you!! Its not worth eating in here cause it is the worse meal I haveever eaten. And for paying that entrance its sad that they dont have better restaurants. And the tables are filthy! Instead the should take some staffs from the entrance and move them to the restaurants and helping out since they were very busy. The staff should also anonymously try out the food so they know what they are serving the custommers.

We descided to skip the safari train since we walked around the whole area and got a pretty good view at the animals and the surrounding. It was a medioker park, could have worked up a little more on the walking areas.

We also skiped the waterland since it was pretty small. Looks bigger on images but smaller closly. Not worth spending another 6‚Ç¨ for using it. It would have been more fun if they had a fountain comming up from the ground instead for the children to play with at warm sunny days at the picnic area as there is on plenty of places. (For free).

Dont have to high hopes, this is a medioker zoo

We stay in Santa Pola regularly so this was a short taxi ride to the park. I was slightly skeptical due to bad reviews but for us, a family of 7 between the ages of 14 and 42, it was a perfect day out. We arrived at 10am when it opens. We were given all times for the shows and the safari ride around the enclosure. We cannot find any fault with the park, it was bigger than we expected and there was plenty to see. I think going first thing helped us have a good experience as we were able to get round in peace before it got too busy. The animals look fine apart from the lions did look a bit thin however the enclosures seem ok for them. The safari ride was fun and of course the park take a photo when you first walk in and when you are sat on the ride waiting to go round. It's not a problem, we didnt buy them and no one pushed us to so it was fine. After seeing the animals we then went to the splash park which was great fun! The slides are great for all ages and the pool is fab. When we went, there were plenty of lifeguards and they were very specific about safety so no worries there, and they were very friendly which was reassuring. You can lay on sunbeds there for free which is nice and it was very clean and tidy. There was also a cleaner by the toilets constantly cleaning so the cleanliness is good. We didnt eat there or take a packed lunch and yes the food and drink is expensive but there are so many picnic areas you can take your own food which will make things cheaper. By the time we left at 2 30 PM it was getting very busy so my tip would be go as soon as it opens to get the best experience of the park and splash park. The lady at the ticket office even called us 2 taxis after to get back to Santa Pola, nothing was too much trouble. We were much more impressed with this place than we thought we would be and found it good value for money for the amount of us. I would recommend as a day out and we would definitely come back!

We were very happy with our day at Rio Safari Elche.
The park is nicely maintained, lots of shade, areas for picnic, etc.
We ate some of the fast food sold at the park and it was ok, just fast food.
We had a really nice day, the kids really enjoyed it.
We didn‚Äôt do the water park so cant say anything about that.
I would recommend it especially if going with small kids. How good of a time depends on one‚Äôs expectations and we enjoyed it very much. We even got nice printed pictures (purchased ofcourse) which was an added bonus for us as we are not good at printing pictures from our travels üôà.
We would go back.

Took a coach to the park, took about an hour. Seemed very slow queuing at entrance. Then another queue for our wrist bands. Photos taken, we could view on way out. Toilets out of order and the working ones had broken doors. Went on ride round park. All animals in the outside enclosures had plenty of food but not much water. Tigers and crocodiles did not have any deep water to swim in. Parrot show was a disaster. It took visitors longer to sit in seats then the show lasted. We were shown one parrots tail feathers then its wing feathers. Two other parrots were brought out and flew from one side off the enclosure to the other. Show was over. We then went to the parrots kept in cages. They looked very distressed. We brought a picnic with us and ate at the picnic area. There is also a water park but this costs extra. We bought photos on way out, You could also have key rings with the photo in it. Our coach left at 5pm. We wont be going back.

titulo: Not worth the trip or the expense
conteudo:
We were picked up by coach at 0930 and arrived at 11am. First off this is definitely not worth that amount if travel when you have Terra and other parks nearer. We were told in the bus we would have only 4-5 hours after the travel time was added there and back which we thought for a water park and zoo this would never be long enough. We were wrong. This is more a small animal park with some lions, jaguars and some varied species worth visiting but it was all done after just over an hour. The water park which we paid an extra ‚Ç¨6 for was no more bigger than any swimming bath in the uk and the main pool is no more than splash pool.

The worst thing of all was the lack of concern for health and safety.

This place is dangerous. The slides led down to a cordoned off area which the stairs leading out are 2 foot away from the landing zone. We saw 2 or 3 adults land very close to children that had landed at about bottom of the slide near the exit stairs but not once did the attendant at the top make sure it was clear for the next person to come down safely. One man landed straight on top of his own child who thankfully was ok but still no warnings for people to be careful or wait for the area to be cleared before the next person was allowed to come down by the staff at the top sending the next one down.

The next issue was the parrot show. The seating area was no where near big enough for the amount of people they had there. But, if they even had one member of staff providing assistance/guidance it may have felt more safer. The sodden seating area did not feel strong enough to cope. The show itself consisted of perhaps information about the Macaw but the presenter forgot to do his English translation in between talking Spanish but hey ho we were in Spain so that fine.

Food wise, we saw some people with pizzas so we asked if they sold pizza on the park
In the restaurant and she said no, not I don't understand but no pizzas sold. Except for the other end of the same restaurant we saw in the way out. Maybes lost in translation so again hey ho.

Food was not the worst price, meal deals for ‚Ç¨9 plus a drink. Quality was very poor, my burger was pink in parts so we left it.

Overall the park itself could be good but it fell way short of the standards others have set in safety as much as entertainment. Certainly not worth the drive put past the parks closer to Benidorm or the price you pay (‚Ç¨150 with the swim park and transfers) but for locals fair enough.

We‚Äôve been here many times, but not in the past 4 years. It has been expanded and the enclosures have been made much better. However it is still a rustic park. Not a Animal kingdom or Colchester Zoo by any means but my kids are really enjoying the new splash park.

Food is a bit quite expensive and not great quality, but you can bring in your own food.

Entry is also a bit on the pricey side, 83 euros for a family of 4 and that was with a discount, that they give out at Alicante airport!! They photograph everything, cost about 7.50 euro for a photo.

Staff are great, most speak excellent English.

Would recommend it!
Ideal family day out lots to see and do kids loves the water park and the train ride to see all the animals

titulo: BEWARE HEALTH RISK! Girls loved it. Animals not as bad as other reviews make out...
conteudo:
1st immediate and important point. Largest slides in water park which adults allowed on has poor, inadequate and unsafe signage. It DOES NOT tell you to sit up. You are not advised to sit up. You are advised to lie down and keep arms folded on chest. Exactly what I did. Nearly ended with concussion, cracked skull, or worse... thankfully not (@ least not without MRI or CT Scan that I'm aware of yet). When I came out of slide at speed. Once I crashed to floor of pool and grazed back / shoulder area. 2nd time I landed head first on bottom of pool. Clearly in pain emerging from pool dazed... the lifeguard told me I should have sat up. THEN ASKED if I was ok.... which should have been his first question. No incident report. No first aid attention whatsoever. No checking injuries. Didn't care. Or even appear to care. Reckless. Negligent. Dangerous. Be warned!

Rest of visit was fine. Kids enjoyed. Animals ok. Shame they don't admit for water park only too, as they appear to possibly do for locals, as place was swarming with locals in water park but not zoo. Kids would have loved to have gone back just for that facility alone. Needless to say I wouldn't be going on death slide for adults water slide again and would certainly raise full and serious complaint with management about this incident... which we have on film, incidentally!

titulo: Best zoo experience but be careful of the extras
conteudo:
I have been to many good zoos, Dublin, London, Chester but the access to the animals at this zoo is second to none. Animals 2 mins from the entrance and you get so close to them especially the lions! The safari ride is as good as a real safari (I‚Äôve done the Masai Mara) and as good as Disney‚Äôs animal Kingdom) However this parks marketing and attempt to make more money than the entrance fee is worse than Disney. ‚Ç¨1 for the car park. What‚Äôs the point? The food and drink prices are just silly but you can leave and return as we did. A photographer was going round taking pictures of kids beside a dressed up giraffe. She almost had a fit when I took photos ‚ÄúI take the photographs‚Äù she said, despite not asking my permission. I‚Äôm
Sorry but they are my kids

It‚Äôs easy to find despite the lack of signs before you arrive at the entrance. Getting in is easy when you buy tickets online. I don‚Äôt recommend eating there even though the paella was tasty there were no health safeguards to keep the flies at bay. A slush drink was ‚Ç¨3.80 - quite a lot for a cup of coloured ice. Though there are several picnic areas to sit I struggled to find seats throughout the zoo circuit to rest my arthritis. More benches please. There is shade but it was still pretty hot so some drinking fountains and maybe a mister here and there for people to cool down would be helpful. I saw very little evidence of the zoos participation in conservation? I imagine it‚Äôs popularity is mainly for the small water park attached to it.
Fun place for small children. Swimmingpool very nice. We loved it there. It's our second time there.

Absolutely well worth money. Mostly on flat so fine for walking about and small safari train takes you around park to see most animals. Animals are very alert and well cared for, well worth money we paid for bus and entrance fee from Round Town Travel, Benidorm

titulo: Great animals, shame about the water park and cleanliness
conteudo:
Lovely safari/zoo and wonderful tractor ride around some of the enclosures and the animals looked really well cared for. The enclosures were lovely and definitely better than some of the other zoos in the area. however the state of the pools, slides and disgusting changing areas let it down. When we went to get changed and use the toilets there was poo all over one toilet, toilet paper blocking another toilet and the floor to the women‚Äôs changing room was black. When I went back at the end of the afternoon it was still in the same state. The baby pool at the top and the splash pad were so dirty and worn down we didn‚Äôt use. The splash bit with the slides was lovely but water was extremely cold so we couldn‚Äôt stay too long. The slides at the back were great, however slightly worrying that they leaked!

Overall it was an average day trip but I would suggest going somewhere like terra natura in Murcia if you want a decent water park.

Buy your tickets online to save 4 euro per person and expedite access.
A nice park with good view of animals, better in the morning. Aqua park on site for an extra ) euro which is quite good. Easily a full day out. Take food with you to save on cost. Your are given a wrist band on entry which allows you to return to your car and collect lunch etc. No need to carry it around with you.

This was our second visit here. Our first in February with 2 grandchildren ( 5 and 7 years) and then this visit with 5 year old twins grandchildren . It was a hit both visits.
You can make the visit as short or long as you need. In February we took our own picnic, did the safari ride and then waked round all the animals and saw bird and sea lion shows in about 4.5 hours.
In May we did the same but could have used the water park as well if we had the time, sadly we had to get home.

The park is clean and well run and the animals do look in good condition. I really don‚Äôt like the idea of caging animals but the majority do look happy, relaxed and healthy.
We had great fun interacting with the orangutans through the glass window.
The only criticism I would have of the whole experience is the commentary of the sea lion show. This is in Spanish and English (I speak both) however it is so fast I couldn‚Äôt understand either!

All in all a good value for money experience.

We stumbled upon doing this as we were planning to do some paddle boarding but the sea was too choppy. We spent 5 hours here and could have spent longer. We found a ‚Ç¨4 discount online so it cost us ‚Ç¨37. You get a FREE train ride around part of the zoo, there are lots of animals and they they appear well looked after. Listened to some of the tours and watched the sea lion exhibition and found both very educational. All signs, tours and exhibitions are both in Spanish and English which was helpful. I can‚Äôt comment on food as bought our own picnic in with us which you are fine to do and there are plenty of places to sit and eat. A really wonderful find and I hope we come back one day!

A great visitor attraction, a good variety of animals to see, animals are well looking after, staff are knowledgeable & friendly.Definitely worth doing the train ride & visiting the Lemurs. I would definitely go back & recommend.

To start our day we got there around 1 as it's a small park and we have a 5 month old. Free parking which is always good, i already paid for the tickets online as they are alot cheaper we paid 37 euros for all of us to get in gate prices were 22.50 each children under 3 are free. they take your picture as you go in and its 6 euros for one picture which we did buy even though our child looked moody! We then looked around at the monkeys and tigers as we needed to feed the baby and ourselves we ate at there outside cafe and fed baby. Ok food what you expect at a zoo park I had pasta which was 7 euros and a bottle of water which was 1 euro 50 was nice we then looked at the big monkeys killing time till we could go on the safari ride which was at 3 (they give you a timetable of events at the gate) we did then notice some people throwing nuts at the monkeys which I found a bit odd as in zoos in England its alot stricter and your not meant to feed the animals apart from farm animals, so I did see them and think it was a bit rude.we carried on and saw the giraffes again a nice a English family were feeding the giraffes nuts... I then asked them they said they thought it was allowed. So I have marked them down only due to no signs saying these nuts are for the animals or told were allowed to feed them. We then headed to the safari we loved it bare in mind we have a 5 month old so our experience of things may differ. Then we went to see the lemurs now if u can go! This is an amazing experience its just a walk though but I think they must be so used to people they jumped across everyone as you can see my boyfriend held our baby and a lemur jumped across! They seemed very happy. There is also other shows but I'm against watching animals perform for money just personal I prefer not to. They have karting but ofcourse I didn't do this due to a little baby! For a small zoo they had alot of animals we ended up buying some nuts and going to feed the giraffes and we have come not in season so it was lovely for us as it wasnt busy atall so alot of the time we saw the animals just us! I cant comment on staff as I didn't have much interaction with them apart from the gate safari ride and the food cart. All in all we had a good day! For 37 euros all the animals we saw feeding giraffes and holding lemurs!!! Definitely would recommend I'm not sure what it's like in busy season and it was a sunny day today so this may have played a part I recommend looking at the weather if you can and picking a day you would prefer! They also have a water park but unfortunately it wasnt open probably to do with not in season! Hope this helps anyone planning on going there and costs!

A three generation visit grandparents grown up kids and two year old granddaughter. We booked direct and saved 4 Euro each. We thoroughly enjoyed the train ride and the shows. We took our own food as food is expensive in the park, there are plenty of places to eat your picnic. You can buy a bag of monkey nuts for 2 euros to feed the animals feeding the giraffes was amazing all in all a great day would recommend.

titulo: speant half a day at the zoo when the weather was pouring down.
conteudo: we were in spain for the weekend & the weather was awful, someone suggetsed the zoo & we went thinking that it wasnt going to be very good, but we were pleasantly suprised. highlight of the day the kids hand feeding the giraffe. that memory will stay with them.

We visited here with our son and Daughter-in-Law and had a great day. We visited in April 2019 and the change from our visit in 2005 was unbelievable. We vowed after our first visit that we would never step foot in the place again, but Rio Safari has undergone a total transformation. All the animals looked well and happy. The enclosures were clean and whilst it wasn't the largest of places, we wandered around a couple of times, watched the shows and just totally enjoyed our day. We booked direct with Rio Safari on-line and saved 4 euros per person on the entry cost.

titulo: Elche Zoo visit with all the family
conteudo:
We visited today with 2 pensioners and 2 children and there was plenty to see and do with a variety of different animal shows spread out through the day. The feeding time with the ring tailed lemurs was excellent. There is a small land train that takes you round inside the enclosure or you can walk round the outside. The animals looked well kept, healthy and in good condition. Unfortunately there were a couple of areas closed on our visit today, the kids splash park and a small kids playground but there was an option of karting which was good fun and camel and donkey rides. It's acceptably priced (¬£20 entry for adults and ¬£15 for seniors / kids) although there were online discounts of ‚Ç¨4 available so book in advance if possible.
Indoor play area and restaurants also very good although slightly overpriced for cold drinks! Well worth a visit from Alicante or Murcia area.
what an amazing experience! The fact we got to play with lemurs free of charge was just an amazing added bonus! I can‚Äôt recommend this more, best ‚Ç¨25 you will ever ever spend!

When we visited it was quiet in the park.
Very reasonably priced on the door, merchandise and gift shop. Food was served fresh and hot in the restaurant.
Zoo tidy and animals seem very well kept. All the shows were informative and enjoyable. The safari ride was amazing to be able to be so close to the animals. Our favourite was by far the lemurs! We were one of two families in there and it was an amazing experience to be up that close. They were extremely funny and cheeky!
Would definitely recommend and visit again!

titulo: Day out in Alicanti Rio Safari
conteudo:
Wanted a little day out away from the beach and hussle of Benidorm.
A really great place to visit not only good day out for a couple but a great place for families.
The zoo os well kept and the animals look content. However i did see the Bengali Tiger get a shick whilst drink its water due to the water being too close to the water supply.
The staff were helpful and friendly worth a day visit.

Had a lovely afternoon here with the family. Age range from 4yrs to 59 yrs and we all equally enjoyed it. Couldn't believe how close you could get to the giraffes. The prices of food, drinks and the official photos when you are inside the park are reasonable too. Highly recommend it for all ages.

We went to this zoo last year. The other two zoos in Benidorm are closed this time of year. A small friendly zoo. Which is easy to get around for young kids and older folk. Great price to get in with the promotion.
2 for 1.The bird area could do with an upgrade. Good information on the animals in Spanish and English. New splash park being built and also has a go kart track. Nice to get pictures with animals for a reasonable fee. ‚Ç¨7.

Rio safari is located on the road between Santa pola and Elche. The animals are well looked after and a lot of fun for the kids to see. There is also a very good sized swimming pool there, to cool off after seeing the park.
Very enjoyable day plenty of animals and interaction with them. enjoyed the Seal's would recommend for all the family.

I have visited about 3 times and loved each visit. One thing that sticks out was how you are able to feed Giraffes and yet in London Zoo you have to pay extra for that. If you do decide to go, make sure you go to all the shows!

we loved it here! visited on the 27th December, not busy at all so we could leisurely stroll around the park at our own pace! inexpensive and all the photo merchandise was affordable compared to other places we have visited. Frieny staff, well kept animals and lots to see / do! All the animal exhibitions were operating as normal, we thoroughly enjoyed the mi I safari ride! our favourite part was meeting the rather friendly giraffe and mischivious lemurs!
Nice place to spend for half a day. No comparison to a large zoo, but good enough to spend a few hours and at a reasonable price.

titulo: Good for visitors of all ages
conteudo: Good to get here early to enjoy all the displays. Look for the discount leaflets when you arrive at the airport.
Great place can‚Äôt wait to go again especially now they have the water park too..more fun for the grankids

This a great day out for the whole family. Take a ride on the land train through the animal enclosures then walk around the park.

On arrival you will be given a list of all the feeding times and show times

The restuarant near the entrance do great food at a reasonable price

We came here for a day out. I love this zoo, the animals have big enclosures although I would like to see all the birds in bigger cages and there are a lot of cracked glass enclosures which need to be fixed!!
The animals you can tell are well looked after, they seem very happy.
Lots of animals to see and isn‚Äôt swarmed with people.
Very impressed to see a water park there and go karting so never a dull moment.

Terrible place staff are so rude. 4e for a wheelchair user to sit and watch kids swim. Even tho the person in the chair was not swimming they still got charged. I found the staff very very rude and the food was disgusting. Burgers were red when we bit into them. There was a thunderstorm and the electric went off while food was been prepared. The place was flooded. And trying to push a wheelchair in a pools of water was disgusting. We couldn't leave as the bus was gone and not returning till 5. The place was filthy after the rain all the animals waste was pouring onto the walk ways. I would never return here even if it was free. As the staff and the food was outragous. Way to expensive for what we got.

Me and my wife went with our two kids, 11 and 4 year old. I have been to several zoos but no zoo has been that dirty before. The previous raining did not help whereas water on the non-concrete walk routes. We needed to wash all our shoes after this trip. It seemed like moat of the animals felt the same way as we, dirty. If my 4 year old had been to a zoo before I'd regret this visit but he was able to see all the important animals every zoo needs to have, lion, zebra, giraffe, tiger and many more.
More like a Circus than a safari park. The animals are used to entertain the public.l was not impressed.

Visited the park with an open mind and was pleasantly surprised. Being able to feed the lemurs and giraffes up close and personal was amazing especially when there was no extra cost for this. We also got to throw fruit to the orangutans and gibbons too again free. We enjoyed feeding other animals too whilst wandering in the grounds. The sea lion show was good as was the parrot show. All animals appeared well looked after and kept in fairly large enclosures. My daughters enjoyed swimming with the sea lions (extra cost of 90 euros). In all a great day out and the only reason I‚Äôve given 4 stars was the on site food which was poor quality and expensive.

titulo: The Water Splash Park is perfect for young kids between 4-8 years
conteudo: The zoo experience was good and we can't recognise the reviews in here that claimed about bad conditions for the animals. They seemed to be in good conditions for a zoo. We liked the show with the sea lion and the show with parots very much. The Safari-train was more an average experience. It was impossible to understand the english part of the guides talk. We visited the Safari Elch Park with an almost 6 year old boy and even though the water Splash park is quite small, its just perfect for a kid on his age but it might be a bit boring for more grown up kids above 10 years I think.

Took the family again after a visit last year and once again we were not disappointed. Up close and personal with the animals was fab. Always buy some peanuts to feed the animals, especially the giraffes who are awesome.
New swimming area for the kids this year was great and I love the fact you can come and go all day as you please
A great day out and would recommend to anyone

We took our 3 boys (12,9 & 7) here on 21st August. It was very busy when we arrived at around 2pm so queues for big water slide were approx 20mins but the little splash area moved pretty quickly. Overall impression of water park was positive. Then went on to visit the zoo & were delighted to be able to feed the animals! We particularly enjoyed the emus, lemurs & giraffes. You can‚Äôt do that at twycross... again overall impression of animal welfare was positive. We did the safari train which was a good way to look around the whole zoo area but make sure you keep the bit of paper with your train time on and turn up at your allotted slot or you might not get on. Returned to the water park at around 6:30pm & it was much quieter. Staff were visible and helpful, food was q expensive eg hotdogs & crepes were around ‚Ç¨4 so lots of people returned to their cars for picnics etc but you can come & go as you please with your wristband. My boys had a great day & so did we! Not bad value too especially if you show online pic to get ‚Ç¨4 discount.

titulo: This is a rather good park
conteudo: We visited the park with two adults and two children, age 10 and 11. We enjoyed the visit, we took us good time to walk around to see all animals. It was interesting to join the feeding of the apes, orangutans and chimpanzees, especially the children loved to through in the fruit to them. It was also amazing for the children to pat the giraffes. The train was interesting and you could during about 15 minutes see all the park. We can recommend this park, especially for families with children.

titulo: A nice little place to wonder
conteudo: A pleasant visit and for younger children this is a great place. Both exotic animals and animals you can pet. It was a pleasure walking through the park. No crowds. The restaurant was very good and well priced. We did go into the Water Splash park but it was very crowded and it was difficult to even find a place to fit in the pool - but considering we came in August - no surprise there. I recommend it to families with younger children - they will have a great time!

We had a great day and our 6 year olds loved it. The shows are informative and only 20 mins long so the kids don't get bored. Different from a lot of animal parks, there are plenty of opportunities to get really close to the animals. The splash park is the icing on the cake, a great way to cool down after a lovely day. I only give it 4 stars purely because I don't really approve of zoos and keeping animals locked up, but this park has plenty of educational value for kids and adults, and the animals have space in keeping with their natural habitat.

Wow!!! Absolutely amazing experience swimming with sea lions. Staff were so friendly and explained about the animals. The animals looked very well cared for and were so excited to be interacting with us. It is expensive but well worth the money. Thank you for allowing us to do this.

So once I knew I was able to feed a giraffe, this place was always getting 5 stars!!
In all seriousness from driving into the car park this day was great, the guy on the car park definitely enjoyed his job and was very welcoming.
The entry price was great, about 60 euros for 2 adults, a disabled and an OAP. We were given a time for the safari jeep ride and purchased some monkey nuts at the gift shop. We only knew about the monkey nuts from reading reviews on here. Definitely buy some so you can feed the animals. I saved mine for the giraffes.
We ate at the restaurant near the entrance. Menu of the day was really good value and really tasty. Can't remember the price but you got a salad, drink, main and dessert and it was more than enough!
All of us enjoyed the whole day but especially feeding the animals. Here in the UK, you have to pay extra for that experience but it was included. The giraffes were so gentle and elegant. They're my favourite animal and this place made me encounter one of the best experiences I've had.

We enjoyed a good day out first of all at the safari with a picnic then headed to the splash park after the seal show my 7 year old and 2 year old really enjoyed themselves and I thought the entrance fee was reasonable for a whole day of fun
We went to the zoo and water park and had a lovely day out. We spent about 4 and a half hours there. It was the best day of our holiday and the children loved it! Would definately go again.

Me, my wife and child visited here in July after reading various reviews both positive and negative. Obviously we can only give our experience which was amazing.

The entrance fee was reasonable and we had a voucher to get free access to the splash park which in truth we wouldn't have minded paying for. We also payed to do the sealion experience which was only 35 Euros each for around an hour compared to Mundomars Dolphin experience which is/was 145 Euros for only 30 mins. The sealion experience was amazing and we got to do a variety of things with them including stroking the animals, we saw a total of 4. We received kisses from them, got them to jump through hoops and circle us following our hand and more. The instructors were very helpful with good English. They also had 1 sealion who didn't want to carry on so they stopped and explained that if the animals decide they aren't up to it then they don't force them, which we thought was very caring. They alternated the Sealions as the day was hot and did not want to overwork them. We even got a little spectacle of them training a new youngster after our experience.

The park itself was well run with nice friendly staff and animals that appeared comfortable and well looked after. They were very interactive and the experience of feeding the animals was nice. Some of them were even just roaming around the Zoo, posing no threat to anyone but being inquisitive and friendly and also wanting food. We did not see any animal that looked neither undernourished or over nourished contrary to some reviews we read. The giraffes, birds of paradise and billy goats were among the most memorable due to their cheeky characters. The white cockatoo was very entertaining and was whistling along mimicking us and making his own tunes up too as well as having a good old fuss.

The water park was a little overcrowded but it was the hottest day we'd experienced at 36 degrees. Everyone was polite however and the life guards were fair in letting everyone has their turn and managing the park safely.We did not eat in the cafe apart from a packet of crisps so cannot comment on the food unfortunately but it did look clean and prices were mid range.

Our travel included getting a bus from Alicante bus depot to San Palo then a taxi from there which all in all was about 32 Euros.

Overall and amazing all day experience with good staff and plenty to do.

Try it and enjoy. Definitely recommend the Sealion experience.

Only negative is the website says to call and book in advance however when ringing you get an automated voice giving opening times and then it cuts off. This is true for both the English and Spanish speaking phone lines.

The animals were in small enclosures and didn‚Äôt look to be kept well at all. The crocodiles had dirt and algae all over the very small puddles of water they were in.
The one seal we saw was in a pool around 6‚Äù x 6‚Äù shocking!?
The water park section was better and better looked after ham the animals.
Very expensive for what it was tbh.

I would totally not recommend it!! Very hot during the visit. My daughter ended up crying during the Curiozoo exhibition. Kids were aloud to touch the animals during the exhibit and she was denied, then we were offered to take the picture at the end of the show and we asked for permission to touch the bird, but the bird was too tired to be touched, but not to be taken the picture. Funny! Isn‚Äôt it? They just care about the money not the animals in that aspect!

Tried to book on line for a visit to Roche Safari park was unable to do so. No suggestion that website was down or anything, also each time of trying showed varying prices!!! It is suggested to book on line to obtain discounts but impossible to do so!!
Taking screen shots to ask about the discounts.... let's see how we get on?

We have had our 2 grandsons out this month & this will be our 4 th visit
The zoo was very clean and the animals were clean well fed and watered
The zoo changes the water in the crocodile & other water animals every other day which is great
The giraffes are a real delight they take monkey nuts from your hand this is all free
We have had to pay large fees to do this in Uk zoos
They have an extensive petting zoo with pigs horses donkeys goats etc who also can be fed monkey nuts
The oranatangs are simply beautiful
The new splash park is fantastic it kept our 2 3year olds busy all day till closing they loved it
You can take your own picnic & drinks
The new restaurants offer good food at good prices
Nothing was a rip off
Thanks Rio Safari see you very soon from the
Curtis Sanchez salmonte clan xxx

Took family here on a Sunday. Place was busy and a small queue at the entrance but no great wait. Under 3s get free entrance - adults 23 Euros. There is a train ride and various shows including sea lions and parrots. Also a great water park. Great for the kids with lots of different animals including lions and tigers! We were able to feed the lamas, giraffes and goats. Most of the animals were seeking shade in the midday sun so I would recommend going early morning or late afternoon when perhaps they will be more active. Well worth a visit if your holidaying and needing some kids attractions

Well what can I say, after reading some reviews we were feeling a little apprehensive about our family trip to Rio Safari Elche but the little one spotted the leaflet and was desperate to go. When we arrived we took a walk through to the kiosk to pay and we could see the water park which look spotlessly clean and well maintained. We then continue through into the park after payment and had a little wonder round, the enclosures were a as big as any other zoo enclosures and if I‚Äôm honest as much as I love going to zoo‚Äôs I am a little funny on enclosure sizes, I‚Äôve seen zoo‚Äôs with smaller ones and the orangutan enclosures were huge. Yes there are parts of the zoo that are looking a little tired and in need of a lick of paint but it looks like they have continuous improvement work going on. The truck/train ride was great fun as they take you through some of the animal enclosures and as are the shows, my little one was in love with the sea lions of which to our surprise he stood next to to have a photo taken. I would highly recommend going there for a family day out, but take swimming stuff as the water park is great fun. Beware of where you have a picnic if you take one as there is designated areas as they encourage you to buy food from them. Great fun for younger children

Talk about value for money , if you download a picture from their website it gives you 4 Euro per person off the list price so 17.50 for kids and 22.50 for adults
We visit here regularly but now for 4 Euro a day you can use their brand new water park it‚Äôs not massive but excellent value and lovely and clean , we arrived at 11 and were still in the water park at 5 ,it wasn‚Äôt manic like most water parks in July as you have a whole zoo to look round aswell , you can also enter and leave as much as you want and bring your own food and drink
GREAT DAY OUT AND VALUE FOR MONEY

It is expensive. The animals are kept in small ill kept enclosures. The animals do not appear to be well cared for and some actually look ill. The swimming pool is not suitable for adult swimming. The food is of poor quality and expensive. In addition, you have to pay for lots of 'add-ons' e,g, camel ride, children's pony ride etc. It is not to be recommended and indeed shouldn't be supported.

After paying their pricey admission fees they ask for an extra ‚Ç¨4 per person for splash park. (Beware you can‚Äôt get a refund on splash park if you decide not to use the pool at the end of the zoo, therefore I would recommend just purchasing it at the end of the zoo part).

The large fees don‚Äôt seem to used for the animals or their enclosures as their orangutan looks so unhappy and trapped on that little island day after day. Also the water levels seem pretty low for the hippo etc although I‚Äôm not a zoo keeper so maybe this is ok. The track around is dusty and dirty and the toilets are yuck.

The staff are a little unfriendly and lack good customer service as we had two OAPs with us and they wouldn‚Äôt let them in to the splash park to sit at the side with a coffee and watch the grand kids without paying and extra ‚Ç¨8 even though they had paid into the zoo. It was clear that the OAPs had no interest in going onto the water slides, but they did not care, pay up or go away is basically what they were told.

Luckily the kids don‚Äôt notice these things and seem to enjoy the animals.

Fantastic trip feeding animals little train around and a fantastic small water park suitable for kids up to 12yrs old you can bring your own food/drink also plenty of animal shows to keep the kids interested and not overpriced overall definitely will be back as happy kids happy mum and dad

The family and I visited here on a Thursday. It wasn't too crowded which was nice as it meant you could stroll around and look at the animals without swarms of people around you. The animals shows were good and you all got a chance to have a photo taken at the end with the parakeets and sea lion, you could purchase the photos at the end of the day from the kiosk near the entrance/exit. Nuts were ‚Ç¨2 a bag which is a bargain when you can feed quite a lot of the animals including the camels and giraffes who were all very friendly. I thought the park was very clean and the animals looked well fed and cared for. There's a water park here too which is a good way to cool off on a hot day, we however didn't use it. Would recommend.

titulo: A great way to spend a day
conteudo:
Came to R√≠o Safari park with my mother, husband and 2 children and we all had a great time. The park isn't too big and the splash park is a very good addition. We could keep our swimming stuff in the car while we took a small walk in the zoo and we went on the train ride which was very nice. Then we picked up the bathing suits and dipped in the water. After my 7 yr old had enough there we kept on walking around the zoo - the giraffs, zebras and goat area which is very nice and the animals looked well kept.
A great value for your money and the time goes by really fast. Only 1‚Ç¨ for the parking and brilliant to get a wristband so you can enter and exit the park as you want. Highly recommend.

I came here some years ago and swore never to come back as most of the enclosures and animals were miserable. Still my wife and kids persuaded me to go again.

And I must admit, that this small zoo has improved somewhat when it comes to the welfare of the animals, which is very important som me. But there‚Äôs still a lot to do. Especially when it comes to animals that I believe has some kind of ‚Äúself awareness‚Äú - watching the male orangutan mad me sad. If this park could somehow convince me, that they use a certain (large) part of their pretty high entrance fees to ensuring the improvement of the animals I would give a better rating. Until then I‚Äôm afraid this is more about getting money from tourists than animal welfare. The small water park is a nice addition though.

Really enjoyed our day here. All the animals look well cared for and lots of babies around, so the animals must be happy. Really good value for money with what‚Äôs included. We were there when the Lemurs were being fed and you are allowed to go into the enclosure which is a really lovely experience. The sea lion show is very good also. Went on the train ride around the park which was also enjoyable. Will definitely go back next time our Granddaughter is out with us.

Nice park to visit for 1 h, if nothing to do. Great experience with animals around farm area.

We was slightly disappointed of splash area, as main area is still under construction. Not lots of animal to see and very, very poor restaurant. Food was just awful - cold, greasy and expensive. Also charged us for car park what was not mentioned in the website and looked slightly suspicious.

We‚Äôve visited several times over the years and it‚Äôs great to see the improvements and investment in the park, particularly the animal enclosures. You get really close to some of them. Our highlight would have to be going into the lemur enclosure at feeding time, being able to have them hop onto your shoulders is amazing, lovely gentle animals, we totally recommend doing this. The meerkats were adorable, tigers fascinating, and the goats very entertaining and friendly! The restaurant served good fresh food, and the baguettes were made to order and delicious, much better than we‚Äôve come across in similar type parks. There‚Äôs a new extension to the water park opening soon, kids will love this to cool down and have fun. Compared to other zoos, I thought that 18.50 euros each (adult) with the discount was good value for money. We spent about 5 hours there and thoroughly enjoyed our visit.
it was a good day out took a while to get to know how to find things,i liked the train ride round the enclosure.

We had a lovely day here. Firstly, the car park is close by, it costs just ‚Ç¨1, and when you pay your entrance fee you get a wristband which allows you to exit and return as many times as you like, so we could leave our picnic and swimming stuff in the car. It was a hot, sunny day, but there are plenty of places in the shade when you've had too much sun. The exhibitions were good fun and interactive, especially the 'curiozoo'. Plenty of places for snacks too. This is not a huge park, and without taking in the exhibitions you could probably complete it in a couple of hours, but we went on the little train, which was fun, and the three exhibitions and were there for about 4.5 hours. You can finish off with a dip in the lovely pool with slide. We also had a close experience with the giraffes who love the nuts you can buy on site!! A really enjoyable day. Don't forget to pick up discount vouchers in your local tourist information or on line.

titulo: Great collection of cared for animals, and you can feed them!
conteudo: We spent 3 hours here and are so glad we did. Its very relaxed, a good selection of Animals that all seem well and happy. They have various high vantage points where, if you have purchased a bag of monkey nuts at the entrance, you can feed the Animals!! And they know the sound of the bags!! The Giraffes are soo gentle and insist on more ha ha! And the Horses, Mules, Goats etc are the same and let you know if you missed them!! Concessions are Euro17.50 as opposed to the 22.50 normal price. And Included in this you get the Train ride which is a 4 x 4 towing carriages around the park through the various enclosures.... sometimes getting stopped by Bison or other Animals. The shows are also very good. And on the way out, we came acroos a pool area where people had paid to swim with the Seals, which was amazing!
