Visit here very often with my partner. It's the nicest one we have been to in the area, where all the animals seem to be in good condition and very well looked after. You can feed a number of the animals including the giraffes. The shows are very good fun although limited seating is available. Food on site is very expensive and basic but have many picnic spots and toilets around in different places. Nice play area at the main entrance for the kids to. Not very big so only takes a couple of hours to get around but well worth it.

titulo: Great fun for kids, a great day out.
conteudo: We spent about 5 hours there with our 2 and 3 year old toddlers and they had a lot of fun, price seems a little expensive at first (22.50 EUR adults and 17 EUR kids over 3) plus 1 EUR for parking but includes all 3 shows and the safari ride around the park in the afternoon. There is also a swimming pool and water jets that they spent a good 40mins playing with so if you manage to find the time to do all those it's quite reasonable.Food at the restaurant near the entrance was ok kids meal for 7.50 EUR includes main meal i.e chicken nuggets and chips plus pasta plus youghurt and drink. Park was nice and clean including the toilets. We had a great day out well done to the staff at Rio Safari Elche, not forgetting the car park attendant who is very friendly and welcoming.

Visited here with family and thought the place was fantastic. The price was good for all you see. Free parking and lovely staff. Theres lots of animals which you can up close and personal with and feed!! We ate in the restaurant and the food was reasonably priced and very tasty. All in all would highly recommend and would defo visit again!

We all enjoyed our visit, but a bit pricey for a relatively small zoo and some of the animals didn't look very happy, especially the primates. Some animals who would normally live in groups were either alone or had only one or two companions.
Admission for 3 adults was over ‚Ç¨50 even with a discount, and despite covering the whole zoo thoroughly and allowing time for lots of photographs we were there for less than 2 hours. Most of the catering outlets were closed and we couldn't access either the sea lion exhibition or the bird show because all the places were already taken by school parties.
The parking area didn't seem to have any disabled spaces which could be a problem in high season, but the wheelchair user in our party managed to get around the zoo itself relatively easily despite a number of very steep slopes and lots of sand and gravel on the paths.

We've been to Rio Safari several times now and it has improved quite a lot over the years. It has gotten better and bigger. The parrot show has been renewed a couple of times, so even after a few visits it doesn't get boring. At certain times you get to feed the monkeys. Kids will love this place

titulo: Brilliant conservation park with close encounter animal experiences
conteudo:
We visit here every time we go to Spain, we hire a car so don‚Äôt know about public transport to and from the park however free to park (once we have paid 1 euro). Its 22.50 euros for an adult but there are discounts for children and seniors, you can also easily access discount vouchers on their facebook site and they have a stand at Alicante Airport. The vouchers give a 4 euro discount per person.

This is a conservation park, where animals are moved to and from this place, I think its important to remember this as we have seen some in temporary enclosures, yet the next time we visit they are in proper full enclosures. Plenty to see, but not too large, plenty of space for the animals, there are shows (birds of prey, parrots, sea lions), new lemur enclosure, there is also a farm animal side where you can again feed the animals and pet them. Train ride around the park is part of the entry fee. Soft play for children and plenty of choice for lunch, or you can bring a picnic.

Best part‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. You can buy food from the park shops (monkey nuts) and feed them to most of the animals, it allows a close encounter. Some animals are not allowed them and these are clearly labelled (crocs, monkeys, etc). In England, an experience like this to feed the animals and go in with the lemurs can cost approx. ¬£50 per person extra.

This is a very good park and excellent value for money.
Didn't expected that it will be soooo bad.The price quality ratio is very bad. The animals are in bad shape.

Not a great fan of zoos but this is much better than the usual. They have gone for quality over quantity so that the animals have space. Quite compact as well so you can easily walk around. Reasonably priced for families. Food ok and inexpensive. If in the area well worth a visit.

Not cheap to enter park. Friendly staff. They will call you a taxi to get home but it already has 10‚Ç¨ on the meter when you get in. Otherwise big free car park. Good selection of animals and impressive sea lion show. The restaurant gets very busy after this. Soft play for children is good. Food not at all bad. Don‚Äôt miss chimp feeding and sea lion show. Dusty paths. Wear old shoes.

I went to Rio Safari Park in Elche with my family and we loved it, the staff is first class and great service and atmosphere is great,I love it and recommend you don‚Äôt miss this before leaving Spain,great job Rio Safari. :)
It was really nice, since there was not crowded and weather was perfect. Safari train was nice and the zoo okay in total. We did also karting, wich was conviniently there aswell.
Both my husband and I really enjoyed visiting rio safari. Would recommend for couples and for families.

After much research without a car, we caught train from Alicante to Elche Parq and called Radio Taxis to get to Rio Safari- there is no direct train or bus and is 11km outside of town. Did end up costing more to travel there and back than entry fee.

Safari park itself was very quiet, some good exhibits, some so-so. Felt several animals were overcrowded in too small spaces but overall the animals looked well fed and ok. Train safari about 20 mins, 3 shows 15-25 mins (parrots, mixed small animals and sea lions) and you can pay to have photos taken after each show.
Overall enjoyed the day.

This zoo is an amazing day out. Entry is well priced but can be cheaper if you can pick up one of the discount leaflets in town.

The layout is very well laid out which allows excellent close up views of the animals. The safari ride is an opportunity to get extremely key close to the wild African animals.

The lemur enclosure allows them to climb all over you to get great photo opportunities.

One of the best Zoos I‚Äôve ever been to
What a great day we had. We got to feed most of the animals just parrots and orangutang couldn't be fed.

Very impressed with everything about this facility. You can easily spend a day here. Admission is not overly expensive and lets you into the Safari facility for the day, including free access to animal shows and safari rides.

Obviously there is a lot of controversy about zoos and about wild animals being kept in cages- at Rio Safari, however, it feels like the animals welfare is consistently put first and their habitats are reflective of that. Additionally, the various shows- about the sea-lions, the birds, and the menagerie- are all informational: not about the animals doing tricks, but informing the public about the individual animals and what they can do. I was really surprised and impressed by this! There's also a chance to meet the animals at the end, and you can tell that all of the keepers are really passionate about the animals.

Also, at each of the shows and during the safari, the keepers will speak in both English and Spanish, suitable for a diverse audience!

The safari itself is well laid out and accessible for all, and there are snack outlets all around the safari, as well as a restaurant outside. On the grounds there is also a small waterpark (closed for the winter) and a racing track- this we did visit and the staff were super friendly, although it is slightly expensive- 15EU for 8 minutes.

Overall, I would definitely recommend a visit here- it would be easy to spend a day here, especially with younger children, and the safari park is clearly dedicated to the animals and their welfare, and this definitely comes through in the running of the park. Congrats to the staff of the park for such an amazing job at running the park!
Great place for any age and a great place to get up face to face with the animals - shows are good for the kids and adults alike with English translations
Second visit to this fabulous place. They are making it even better. The staff are friendly and helpful and shows are all good. Great place for young children and us adults! Will go again!

titulo: Kept us occupied for the day
conteudo:
Were a little unsure looking at the mixed reviews. Can't say we had any real complaints though to be honest.
Kids enjoyed feeding the animals, and the animals were enjoying being fed! They were all coming over, including the zebras and giraffes!
A shame the water slides close out of season, but the splash park was open and the kids loved it!
I don't think the animals are poorly looked after. Yes it's hot and dry but nothing compared to their natural habitats and they were all fed well and looked healthy, if not a bit warm in the midday sun.
One word of warning -WEAR BUG SPRAY- I was eaten alive!!

titulo: Good Zoo. Well worth a visit.
conteudo:
This place gets mixed reviews, but you can safely ignore the bad ones which seem to be from tree-hugging vegetarians and animal rights activists.

This is a value for money attraction. You can get up close and personal with species from all over the globe, Have fun and learn something at the same time.

For ‚Ç¨22.50 you have access to the zoo with several shows (parrots, birds of prey, sealions etc) thrown in.

Animals all seem healthy and active. Enclosures vary in degrees of salubriousness but all are accessible and laid out fairly well.

Ok, some areas could be better and some are in the process of construction and renovation but still well worth a visit.

You can come and go all day on a ticket and there are several snack bars and picnic areas with a reasonably priced restaurante at the front door.

Enjoy this place. Where else can you feed peanuts to a giraffe in Alicante?

titulo: Perfect for the first time in a zoo
conteudo: For our son it was the first zoo ever. He totally exhausted with all the new experiences. I never could imagine he liked it soo much. There are nice animals, the zoo-trip shows you around. There are some roads which were perfect to sleep on daddy, not crowded, not sunny.

Three of us went to the safari park (but it's a zoo really) to celebrate a birthday. We had a great time. It's small enough to walk around and has all our favourites: big cats, monkeys, reptiles, rhino, giraffe and more. Free parking, friendly staff, events, a train and plenty of cafes, picnic areas and children's play areas. Unlike UK zoos you can get up close and feed/pet the safer animals. Our fav: feeding nuts to giraffes. Great family day out.

We have been in the area for 16 years and never been here before so thought we'd finally give it a try. We paid ‚Ç¨18,50 per adult and booked online the night before. We had no email confirmation or anything, but the website just said bring your ID which we did. This caused a little issue when we arrived as the ticket office seemed to expect proof of purchase rather than ID, but we got in OK in the end. On arrival we also had to pay ‚Ç¨1 to park all day. We were there for about 10:30 and were given an itinerary for the day. This included a parrot show, a bird of prey show, a sea lion show, a lemur experience and feeding the orangutans and chimps. So whilst we were going round the various animal enclosures we also had another activity every half hour or so. There was also a free train ride which actually went inside and through several of the animal enclosures so we got up even closer to the animals. The staff were all very enthusiastic about the safari and mostly spoke English too. We stayed about four hours by which time we had seen all the shows and all the animals. We did not eat there, but there were several options and also other activities for children, play areas, farm, pools etc. So had we gone with kids we would probably stayed much longer and made a full day of it. We have been to better safari parks in the UK, Spain and elsewhere, but this is certainly worth a visit if you are in the area.

Good place where spend time with children . Giraffes are fabulous!!! Take with you eucalyptus leaves for giraffes and enjoy feeding them.
Don't forgot take food for you also.

Was really fun and enjoyable. Loads of different animals staff were nice and friendly needs a cash boost to finish off attractions and upgrade the place for staff and animals. The place does come equiped with a swimming pool so bring your trunks too.

titulo: NOT GREAT-needs some TLC and staff need to be happy!
conteudo:
Came today with an open mind having read the mixed reviews ...
Would I recommend to to family/ friends...sadly I wouldn't ,the staff are not friendly ,seem a bit rough with the animals.crocodiles and hippos need more water in there pool.train tour lasted about 15mins tops and didn't go in the zebras or Giraffe enclosure but yet pictures on website show the train in there.The exhibition shows are terrible, don't speak much in English and when they did couldn't really understand them..
If you are thinking of coming I would say DON'T ...go to mundorma instead!

We came here thinking we would only spend a few hours but ended up spending all day here. When getting there you receive a wristband which allows you to go in and out if the park which you can leave bags etc in your car. There is even a swimming pool outside for children and families to use. There are also nuts you can purchase for 2Euros at various places to feed certain animals. Train ride and shows are included in the standard price.

titulo: A more animal friendly approach needed
conteudo:
I went to the Safari Park with an open mind , having read the reviews . I'm not one of those 'anti -circus' people but someone who has worked animals all by life .
On a positive note the shows - parrott , sea lion etc were brilliant , but the living conditions of the animals leaves a lot to be desired . You can judge how an animal feels by its general demeanour & the condition of its cost . What I saw yesterday wasn't good / inadequate shade, water , feed & living conditions .
This park needs a major upgrade and a more animal centred approach before I would return again with my grandchildren .

Can only comment on the sealion experience which was amazing. We prebooked the experience for two children. They had a wonderful half an hour experience. Plenty of interaction with the sealions. They were in a group of 12 people. Plenty of opportunities to take photos from the side. Photographer also there taking photographs. Experience cost ‚Ç¨35 each plus photos 1 for ‚Ç¨6, 2 for ‚Ç¨16 then ‚Ç¨5 each thereafter. You do not need to pay for entry to Rio Safari itself as the experience is just outside the main entrance. Lovely little picnic area and splash pool area while waiting for the photos. A wonderful experience.

We drove 50 mins from Campoamor to Elche and stopped off for a quick McDonalds in the town before heading to the park. At first sight / or smell we were not sure ü§î there is a parking area and restaurant there's also a pool and small water park / slide area to cool off... we didn't but it would be suitable for smaller kiddies üë∂.. we paid ‚Ç¨62.50 for entry for the three of us. They charged kids price for our 14 year old!! There is a train / jeep with seated-trailers at various times but we decided to walk.. some parts to be honest were a bit depressing but there were some special animals the lions ü¶Å and especially the giraffes. On entry buy the peanuts ü•ú you will have some fun moments with the giraffes and will get close up!!! That was a highlight and we laughed as we didn't know you could feed the giraffe or that that get close up and personal üëçüëçüëçüëç

Great 3rd time we have been here first during summer months and the water park was open !!!
Lots too see and doo great day or food good priced aswell and drinks over all fantastic

titulo: Disgusting conditions - animals had no water.
conteudo: WOULD RATE 0 STARS. (From the U.K.) I am disgusted by this place. In the 31 degree heat, not one animal had a reasonable amount of water except for the tigers. Lions had none. First impression as I walked in was not good, small horses and camels were tied to the fence (obviously where they are kept when they are not being ridden) in a small enclosure, the horses forced to stand in the sun with no shade as they were restricted by the rope. These animals HAD NO WATER in the boiling heat. I spoke to two staff members telling them this, the first did not understand what I was telling them (that they had no water) and the other, who was holding a snake, did not seem bothered by said that she would tell someone in the office. Many animals were forced in enclosures that were clearly way too small, again with none or barely any water. But the worst experience of the day was seeing a day old newborn BABY GOAT, UNCONSCIOUS ON THE FLOOR. This poor goat was clearly suffering with the heat, with flies climbing inside its eyes, nose and mouth. I was disgusted and my family and I told a woman who was in the nearby shop and she had said that she had called someone about it. We waiting at least 30 MINUTES for someone to come to this baby goat for them to pick it up and say that it would be taken to the vet room. After it had gone, the mother of the baby was clearly distressed where her child had gone and sniffed the ground and was making horrible noises. My recommendation is to not go to this horrible place.

Been annually for 12 years. its become a family must on holiday. Improvements made constantly. Love feeding the giraffes and petting the goats. Dont miss the Safari Ride and all the shows. Food good and not expensive, but can take a picnic, tables available. Price includes all day use of outdoor pool which is very clean. Thoroughly recommend a visit.

titulo: Great for kids of all ages ...
conteudo: Excellent experience with my nearly 5 year old granddaughter. Especially the 'Safari Tour' , 'Farmyard' , picnic areas , and the water park out front. A great value day out for kids of all ages. I personally loved the 'Reptile Caves' ~ as often in Spain, poor signposting is a slight issue !

Brilliant day! Highly recommended! Make sure you bring swim clothes/nappies and plenty of suncream it was 34 degrees when we went. Food was lovely and not badly priced! There are plenty of shaded areas. Staff where lovely and helpful.

We visited the parj yesterday, as we did for the last two years. We spent a great day. New playing areas around the swiming pool are great. We took lunch at the same time the kids were playing there just in front of us, in a very shady and fresh area.
The bad things are that management need to take care of cleaning in the changing room, it was disgusting.
In the other side, I agree too much with some of the previous comments, the overal state of the park is getting worst every year, despite the never ending renovation works.
It is sad to see how the park look more abandoned every year.
Nevertheless, I will continue coming every summer hoping this situation improves.

We visited on a Friday, we got there as it opened and it was quite quiet and not too hot at this time. The staff are very friendly and helpful. If you take a leaflet or get a voucher online it reduces your price by ‚Ç¨4 per person. The animals are well looked after and the zoo seems to be constantly improving it's enclosures. The train ride wasn't particularly good, and doesn't go around the parts on the map it says it does. Lots of photo opportunities are captured by staff and vary in price from ‚Ç¨6.50 for a magnet and key ring to ‚Ç¨8 for a picture with a sealion (which was a lovely experience)

The sealion show isn't great and the trainer doing it speaks so quickly in English and Spanish, we couldn't understand a word he said! But be sure to get their early if you want to see it as the best seats at the back are sheltered from the sun. The photo with the sealion takes place after the show and you'll need to pay before having it taken and collected an hour after it's been taken.

So if your family love a day out at the zoo and see some animals that maybe you don't get to see so often, it's well worth a visit. Animals are well looked after and happy. The chinpanzees are amazing and very entertaining. And don't forget your swimwear for the pool or if you want to swim with sea lions (‚Ç¨35 extra)

Overall the goods outweigh the bads! A good day out had by all the family!

titulo: Kids had fun. Park needs maintenance.
conteudo: I went here in June 2015 - and again in July 2017 and I had this feeling that since then, the overall standard decreased a bit. Many toilettes out of order. Dead/ badly maintained plants all over. But still, our kids loved the experience (2-6 years). Swimming pool is perfect addition to the Zoo for cooling down (no extra charge)

titulo: Lovely day out.. better than expected
conteudo: I visited the Rio Safari at the beginning of July and thoroughly enjoyed the day. I was slightly concerned about some of the animals who did not have enough space to properly exercise etc. However there were staff members attending to the majority of the animals and lots of babies. The options for food were limited which was to be expected but could do with some more choice. The swimming pool was a welcome addition after walking around in the heat for a few hours. Would visit again.

Animals are amazing very educational for children.
However alligators in enclosures no water, work being done to maintain enclosures animals don't look as though they are cared for. Correctly.
Animals look underfed.
Pool great to cool down but changing rooms we're discussing state.

This is one of the biggest examples of animal cruelty I've ever seen.
We made the mistake to come here, and I write this review that maybe some others wont.
Please, don't support this park by visiting it.
The animals have far too less space. No species-appropriate attitude at all.
The crocodiles not even have water!
The shows are cruel and far too loud. No shadow to sit in. Not suitable for kids.
We left after the first show. Thats why I can't say anything about the food...
Really nice track, with great fun also for first-timers in go-cart! Friendly hostes and Good guidance before take off.

Our trip to day at rio safari was disappointing all they are interested in doing is selling you photos at 7-8 euros each and one of the men's toilets both urinales covered over not working one of the other toilets flush button not working and then the taps move when you try and turn them on no sign of plumber the signs around the bird of prey show all torn or water damaged and the ropes around the same exhibit all on the last legs nice new picnic area with good seating but generally all the silly small jobs that need doing are being over looked witch makes the place look tired questionable whether it's worth 22euros a person won't be rushing back.

We took a day out at Rio Safari with two teenagers as a day away from beach or shopping. Rio Safari is a small size safari park between Elche and Santa Pola. They have a fair assortment of animals with varying backgrounds. The park may look tired but this is due to the intense heat during the summer months. Equally the animals are most active in the early morning or late afternoon.
A train ride through some of the enclosures provides a closer experience along with a number of shows providing some entertainment. For additional cost you can enjoy a swim with sealions which is very much worth the cost of 35 euros. The food outlets are fine without the normal extortionate costs that most UK outlets demand and there is a pool during the summer for some much needed relief from the summer sun.
The park is interesting and enjoyable for all ages but visitors should not expect the well polished facilities and presentation of other European partners. Overall a good trip for those spending time in the local area

Most of the shops were closed , very few people and some animals were missing. Morever it seems like they are not kept in very good conditions. Mundo mar in benidorm is better. Dont waste your time here

titulo: Worth a visit - more than a Mini-Zoo
conteudo:
I visited Rio Safari with my 9 year old son while my wife and daughter did Corte del Ingl√©s and more shopping in Alicante.
I had pre-booked a sea lion swim session by phone (easy) and booked tickets online (easy and with discount).
We paid ‚Ç¨31,50 for entry, ‚Ç¨70 for 2 x sea lion swim, ‚Ç¨30 for swim-pictures, ‚Ç¨8 for 8 minutes carting (my sons succesfully debut) and ‚Ç¨12 for lunch. And it was worth it :-)
You need the admission to enjoy the park, the waterpark-area and the safari train ride.
You should absolutely spend ‚Ç¨35 for a half hour in the pool with the sea lions. A great and rare experience. Save somewhere else and give yourself this: 10 people, 2 skilled trainers, 2 friendly sea lions and 30 minutes in a pool with wet kisses, tricks and touching an unique animal.
The carting was a nice surprise and my son loved it!
We arrived at 11 pm, parked closely to the entrance and didn't experience queing or crowds.
If you do a safari park in Spain during high season this is in the higher range. It's not spotless or in mint condition everywhere, and they do want you to buy photos, but that's no surprise. However they are comitted, service minded, english speaking (or eagerly trying) and the animal have good conditions.
But again - the fifth point we give because of the sea lion swim experience.

The zoo part was worked down and many cages were empty. Some of the cafeterias were closed in the middle of the day.
The big swimming pool wasn't suitable for 5 year olds and it was only the women's locker room that had lockable clothes storage. Go kart area was worned down.
Food existed but not exactly a great experience.

titulo: Especially fun for the train and the swimming pool
conteudo:
Small zoo compared to the ones we have in Belgium, but still a lot of different animals to be seen.

I would really recommend the train that goes through the exhibits of some animals (which is included in the price of the entrance ticket). We also enjoyed the combination with the swimming pool, especially because the zoo isn't big enough to spend a whole day watching the animals. The shows with the animals were nothing spectacular.

In whole, it is a fun trip to do with smaller children, but I think somewhat older children will not find their amusment here.

titulo: Nice little safari, the shows are very good
conteudo: Went on a hot day, there is not much of a shade there, although it has a lot of palm trees, so prepare for that. The roads are rock, so we would recommend either socks or closed shoes. We saw the sea lion show and the parrot show and went on the train ride. All of those were fantastic. The food in the cafeteria is pretty simple, so we recommend some extra food and drinks. If you buy some food there the kids get a free entrance to a soft play castle though, which our 4 year old found pretty fun.

Went off season so the pool and slide were not available which was a bit of shame as it was so hot. I do admit that most of the animals were inside or hidden under shade so hard to see as it was so hot. Don't blame them! Other than that it was a good trip out and the kids seemed to like it. Loved the orangutans and the sea lion show.

There are enough reviews of the zoo itself so I'll focus on swimming with the Sea Lions. Amazing to say the least. I went in with my two children. 8 and 11. Importantly they are both above 135cms which is enough to keep your head above the water. Firstly the staff were amazing and really patient with the children. It was full immersion with the animals. You could stroke, dance and do tricks with them and the Sea Lions loved it! You get a good 30 mins as well. There were 9 in our group which was plenty. It's a must for the area and the money goes to charity and the animal upkeep.
My children will remember it for ever! üëç

A great day out with the kids! We choose to drive from our Vila and found it extremely easy to find thanks to TOMTOM.

Parking - thought this was a chance for the company to rip us of but we were extremely surprised to find it was ‚Ç¨1 ALL DAY! Brilliant !!

Entrance - we prepaid before arriving and saved around 4 euro per ticket , which was a bonus!

Park- the park itself was great, a real authentic feel ! Felt animals were happy and looked after , staff were amazing !! Constantly smiling and welcoming !! Those little things make a difference!

Shows- the shows were great, I would recommend the 'zoom in ' show as the trainers themselves made the show !! They handled the animals amazingly and again, perfect attitude towards their jobs! I hope they're paid well!! Almost all the shows were timed so you could enjoy one after another instead of having to pick and choose which ones you seen and which ones you didn't ! Train ride was great!! Kids loved it !

Overall- perfect day out , and cheap enough! We brought food with us and saved on buying ! Will recommend !!

titulo: Needs some TLC and updates on website!
conteudo:
We visited the Safari today- we travelled from Alicante so took a taxi,a bus and another taxi to get to it and we'd planned on spending the guts of the day there as there's a pool/water slides/restaurants etc all under one roof... we arrived and if you have any discount vouchers, mention them as they cashier would have happily charged us the full amount if we hadn't asked about it!

It was BAKING hot, a lot of the enclosures had very little shade or water for the animals and I felt sorry for them. Our two children didn't seem to notice these things and were delighted that there were lions/tigers and giraffes!

The park is very spread out so make sure you bring loads of Sun cream/drinks etc and not flip flops!! The ground is gravelled and was very uncomfy by the end of the day!

The pool/slide wasn't open although it didn't state that on their website so check before you go!

One of the cafes/photo shop only take cash so bear that in mind and also note that even if you get there an hour before closing, you're charged full whack! ( We witnessed a very irate Spanish lady complaining about this- ‚Ç¨79 for an hour!)

There is an indoor play area for kids inside one of the restaurants at an extra cost of ‚Ç¨3 per child plus socks for ‚Ç¨1 each... if your child eats there, play is included in the price.

The sea lion exhibition was definitely the highlight of the day- the trainer obviously loves his job and you could sense the bond between him and the sea lions- it was lovely to watch!!

The park closes at 6, we asked the reception staff to call us a taxi which they did, although we figured that maybe they get a cut from taxi call outs as our return fare was double what we paid on our way there?!

All in all, the kids did like it but I was disappointed..

We have now visited the zoo 4 times in the last 12 years as the grand kids grew up.
It trys, but now looks tired. The animal enclosure are small and have minimal stimulation for the animal s.
The show's are rushed and little translation is given.
This probably will be our last visit.
Good day out , young kids will enjoy here . We bought lunch and enjoyed the food . Had a splash in the pool too . Enjoyed the seal show . Will return .

titulo: Some of the animals looked a little worse for wear.
conteudo: Overall it was an enjoyable day. You could get close to most of the (Safe) animals and we fed the likes of Giraffes etc. It would be a good day out for the kids (I don't mean the goats) and there is plenty to look at.

titulo: A little bit too sad to be really enjoyable
conteudo:
Close to Santa Pola and Elche, the safari was almost a great day out. There are plenty of animals and shows but everything is a bit sad. The grounds, cages and enclosures just aren't very well maintained, and there is a lack of space for the animals. The staff clearly love their jobs and try hard, but the animals just look sad. We went when it was quieter at Easter so can imagine that it would be a tougher day when busier and hotter later in the season.

It's not cheap either and they take every opportunity to get more money from you once inside. With investment in more space and refurbishment I could be a great place for the animals and a great day out.

Visited here recently, 3 adults and 3 kids and had a really enjoyable visit. The park is quite expensive but we used an offer advertised on the website so it is worth checking. The park is fairly big but walkable and has a nice train ride around where you can see the animals before setting off on foot. You can feed giraffes and watch some shows.

Parrot, sea lion and bird of prey shows were all very good. It is definitely worth a visit and the souvenirs, key rings, photos etc are very reasonably priced too. Lovely visit enjoyed by all.

titulo: 3 time visiting and kids love it
conteudo: It may not be the most modern safari however our 5 and 3 year old have a great time here. It has animals you can feed, a safari tour, and a sea lion show. It also has a nice little soft play and pool. A lovely family day out.

Our son is a big fan of zoos and animal parks so we had to visit this one as well. If someone has a lot of time to spend around Alicante with kids it might worth a visit, however we didn't really like the place. The whole park looks quite plain and mostly worn out and/or old, and the lack of maintenance is obvious everywhere. The sea lion exhibition is definitely not a show. The bird show is so-so (but hallelujah, it was in English!). The place was actually quite depressing and made me think that some animals were depressed as well. It is off season currently so it might be normal that it's dirty and there are huge areas being actually closed or worked on by construction machines and workers. But there will be a lot of work till the place will look good finally...

I had heard mixed reports about Rio Safari Elche but we had a child coming to stay with us and animals seemed like a sure fire winner.

We bought the tickets online which saved us 3 or 4‚Ç¨ per person.

The site looks a bit scruffy when you arrive and it's the same as you walk to the ticket office. The place looks like it needs a refit and a spring clean. In fact it's like that all the way round but it's a homely sort of scruffy and you soon stop noticing.

The pens and enclosures seem like they could do with a bit of money spending on them but the animals look in reasonable enough condition and happy enough if you think that animals in captivity can ever look happy. There's plenty to see. We missed all the scheduled shows and even our ride on the train in the three or four hours we were there but we were still finding new things to gawp at before we left. In fact we intended to go back in after lunch but, children being children, we went on to the beach at Santa Pola instead.

The restaurant by the way said self service but we got table service. Prices were a bit high for very ordinary (plato combinado style) food but it was perfectly reasonable. If I were doing it again I would be happy to eat there a second time. Oh, and we bought a few drinks and crisps at one of the bars somewhere in the park and the prices there were on the top side compared to street prices but nothing outrageous.

All in all we had a good time for a reasonable price.

We loved the safari park. There are various shows through out the day that they alert you too with music, they are also listed on the brochure and map you get on entry. We saw the sea lion and the bird show which were really good. There is also a trailer pulled by a truck that takes you through the enclosures to get a closer look at the animals. Which we went on twice as we liked it. There is a cafe/restaurant at the entrance that you can go to. Once you have purchased a ticket you are free to go in and out of the park. Inside the park are various kiosks selling snacks and refreshments. We were privileged enough to witness the birth of a baby lama. I'm going back in the summer to take my other grandchildren as I know they will love it as much as I did.

I got to hand feed a giraffe!!!!! Enough said I think.......
The safari park is a brilliant day out for all ages, we loved it and would go back again any time!

Lovely staff, good day out. Shows were well organized. Parrot show is a must, a very funny bilingual Spanish man getting the parrot to do tricks and the children loved it.Good size park not too big to get around.

titulo: great day out for the whole family
conteudo: Had a great day out. Loads to do. Nice play area for the kids and really good picnic area. The whole place was very clean and the enclosures looked really well kept. The staff were really friendly. Enjoyed the shows too. We had half price tickets so we thought this was extremely good value for money. Being February it was really quiet and easy to get around, get seats for the shows and get served in the restaurant. Won't be so easy later on in the year and without the half price tickets, not sure we would go in the summer. Downsides were the pool area not being open but it's too cold anyway and the go-kart track was closed for maintenance. Otherwise, a really nice park in a nice setting.

I liked this Safari park before, it had boats going around (Rio means river) and everything was more green.
Now you have to go in some kind of train and the spirit is gone, also quite dirty and dusty.
I find it super expensive ‚Ç¨ 22,- for coming in, thats why probably there was almost nobody there, if they make it more payable then they probably get much more people.
Outside the park there is a restaurant that seems to belong to the park, the food is good and all home made.
Bernie's World Wide Travel Experience.
Low season and you have the zoo almost for yourself. The kids (3 and 7 year old) had a fabulous day! No resturant inside so one tip is to bring food if you want to stay a while.

Amazing day with family loved it will be back this year. Photos were much more reasonable priced than normal places similar to it. We took our own picnic so can't comment on the food. Pool with the slide was a great bonus!

I visited this zoo with my 5 year old on the 3rd of November. Even though it was off season there was lots to see there. The scheduled shows are really good and the staff get the kids involved. In fact the staff in general are fantastic, very friendly and helpful.
You can really get up close with some of the animals,the giraffes and camels came close enough to touch.It is a really nice walk around the zoo and is well shaded for those hotter days.
Food in the restaurant is quite good,with a nice selection to choose from and reasonably priced.
I would definitely recommend a visit if you are in the area.

titulo: Late October visit with young children
conteudo:
A very entertaining and educational visit. Children 3 to 12.they thoroughly enjoyed it and particularly the petting area. Visited also two years ago. Late in year so pool closed but several shows and many animals. They all looked healthy. Some beautiful tigers.
One reviewergave a poor review on this web site but must have visited on a very hot day when animals sleep.

It was a cool day when we went, if I'd gone in the summer it would have been too much. Rather expensive cost over 80 euro for 4 adults and 1 child and we had a coupon for money off, was quite a good day. Lots to see if would go again if it wasn't so expensive.

Visited in October half term with my husband and 2 children. They loved the reptile house and the train ride. They were also amazed by the tigers. The shows were good and just the right length
There was a lot of maintenance going on but it was the end of their season.

The zoo itself is slightly run down and health and safety isn't exactly priority clearly but it's nice and spaced out, it was lovely how it wasn't busy! It's a nice zoo compared to others abroad. Swimming the sea lions is so worth the money!! ‚Ç¨35 I think but it was amazing!! 30 minutes but felt like an hour

titulo: A wonderful day in the sun!!
conteudo: I took my younger brother here back in August to celebrate his birthday. It was slightly expensive however we both had such a wonderful day. We had a train ride through the animal enclosures which was brilliant and then we had a walk around taking lots of photos. We then bought slushies from the little on site shop and bought some nuts and fed the giraffes from our mouths!! It was our favourite part of the day! We went to a seal show which was fab and had some lunch in the picnic area. After a long day in the sun, we then went for a swim in the pool on site which was so lovely. Definitely coming back here!

This Zoo is lovely and I was amazed at how close we got to feed animals like a giraffe and hippo.
The animals were well kept and the day was hot so many animals were asleep to start with but soon were awake and happy.
Highly recommend this place. Children would love this.
Little train ride and many animal shows but make sure you make a note of the show times. You can have pics taken with animals such as the seal and parrots for ‚Ç¨8 and it was a nice big pic.
There is a restaurant / cafe place which had flies over the food. We had chips and drink. Reasonable price.
It's ok to leave and come back again so you could take a picnic. There is lots of picnic benches throughout the zoo.
Nice petting zoo for children.

titulo: Great day out, offred so much more than we expected.
conteudo: From being greeted by the charming car park attendant our day was full of laughter and joy, great to be up close and hand feeding giraffes, take salad and fruit bits to feed them you wont be disappointed. The seal show although only took 25 mins was entertaining and grsat for close up photos. Would definitely return, best to pick a cloudy/cooler day and shoes you dont getting dusty. The animals appear well fed and looked after.

Animals were very lethargic, looked ill and some close to death, overheard one couple thankful that one of the young Lammas finally moved as thought it was dead. These animals need rescuing. On secondary points restaurants and toilet facilities were basic to poor. All in all shut the place down and save the animals.

Went to Rio Safari on Tuesday, and had a wonderful day looking round. It's not a huge site but there is plenty to look at. The animal housing is very good for most of the animals, there is some older housing but this is being phased out. A very good day out, some wonderful photo opportunities.

titulo: lovely day out at the zoo
conteudo: This zoo is very charming,went with husband and mother-in-law ,booked it through a tour company,as soon as you arrive there is lots to do,as well as enjoying all the animals you can join in with the shows that are put on for your entertainment,the bird show which ends with all the parrots flying over you,have your cameras ready,a trip on the land train great fun,and the seal lion show wonderful,didn`t like the photo opportunity after though,but thats my choice.There is a lovely cafe at the entrance and a pool with loungers around it,Had a great day,

A great place to spend a day with kids, see and feed numerous animals, when visiting Spain! Plenty entertainment shows with sea lions, parrots and birds of pry and other creatures. We went on a short tour onboard Land Rover trains, all this included in a reasonably priced entry fee. Helped by the very warm weather of course!
Great day out with our 2 year old x we all had a fabulous day x x 2nd visit and not disappointed x will come again next year x parrot show is definitely worth sitting through x x

We stayed in calasparra so it was a bit of a drive for us to get to the zoo but we set off early to avoid the peak of the heat. The zoo was easy to find and signposted well along the way. Even the guy working as car park attendant was very informative.

When we got to the entrance to the park we realised it was possible to swim with the sea lions! I wish we had known this before as we definitely would have done this. Everyone looked to be having great fun!

The zoo has a lot of different animals to see and had a variety of shows for all to enjoy. I would definitely recommend the sea lion show.

I didn't rate the restaurant as there was so many flies in there which I suppose can't be helped, and I didn't try the pool so I couldn't comment on that. However it's good to have a pool available as you will constantly be in the sun whilst walking around the zoo!

I would recommend anyone in the area to give this zoo a try! I will definitely be returning when I go back to Spain!

We stopped off at Rio Safari as we had a 6pm flight and had to be out of our apartment in the morning. They have a good range of animals but the park is not very big. You can see most things on the jeep safari tour they take you on which is included in the price of your entrance ticket. It is very dusty so wear sensible shoes and there are lots of mosquittos and flies around. The animal housing is rather basic which some visitors may not like. There is a pool area and water slide so take your swim suit. However the showers are very basic, not particularly clean and some do not work. The children appeared to enjoy the visit and it passed some time while waiting for our flight but I wouldn't want to return anytime soon.

Awkward to review because if we don't go then it will be the animals in the park that suffer first,,,,

You do get very close and in some cases upfront and personal with many of the animals ,,,,

You can ,,,, if you pre book ,,, swimming with the sea lions at the park which is really fantastic but be aware this will cost you 35 euros per person.
Please note you can just book that experience and not actually have to pay to enter the park as well,

this experience was super the kids loved it, the sea loins love it and it was so much better and 5 times cheaper than swimming with the dolphins in Orlando USA

But the park itself is dirty, toilets don't work and no running water at the sinks, no toilet roll and worst of all,,, some one done a number 2 on the floor, how gross can people be !!!

So overal , average day out 20 euros per person to enter the park , plus included is the use of the swimming pool out the front

Camel rides 8 euros per person, boring, but what do you expect a camel to do, except spit at you, lick you and chuck you off !!!

Would not recommend the 'go carts' unless you have super travel insurance and your on a death wish !!!

But:

Swim with sea lions , just do it,,, it's fantastic , take your swimming stuff and 35 euros, pre book, the number is on their web site

On site photos are quite expensive and

safari train,,, well you can decide on that ,,,be ready for the emu's !!!

Have a nice day and enjoy the shows
Had a great day out here loved every minute. Great shows and loved seeing the animals. Plenty of places to stop for a drink or ice lolly.

titulo: Easy to find on the road from Santa Pola
conteudo: Overpriced. Apart from sea lions animals looked underfed. Driving around on the tour no stops for photos ,if you wanted to take any. the man doing the shows was good at his job and had a bit of humor.

titulo: Brilliant day out for all ages
conteudo: Traveled here last week as a young couple. The shows were entertaining, interactive and informative. Staff were excellent and very helping, even providing free use of lockers for valuables. Wide range of exotic animals, and they even allow you to feed most of the animals with peanuts which are sold on site. Plenty of shops/ restaurants and picnic areas if you choose to bring your own food/drink. Lovely pool area and slide for all to enjoy. Brilliant place to bring kids, with lots of families, young and old couples all enjoying the time. Would definitely go back sometime and maye avail of the option to swim with the sealions!!
Very good day out for the kids and reasonably priced if you get your tickets online with the discount.love the fact the giraffes are so friendly and eat gently out of your hand and my son loves it
Fun for the whole family. The giraff was realy friendly, you should go to the shops inside and buy nuts to feed the animals

titulo: Visit to the Zoooooo with small children
conteudo:
We were staying Quesada with our 2 children (2&3) and were looking for a day out.

We had read about Rio Safari and decided to give it a go...

We got there early figuring that the park might be a empty first thing and it was.

The weather was baking but this did not detract from the experience.

If you are going to a zoo in Spain in August - it's going to be hot!

We were there for about 3 hours with our children and they got to see/ feed animals - eat ice cream - watch animal shows and seemed to enjoy themselves :-)

There is lots of space here and it was a good day out.

EXPECT IT TO BE HOT IN SUMMER!

On arrival we were greeted by lovely staff who spoke English as well as Spanish which was comforting. We managed to get in with a coupon that offered us 4 euros off each which was good. I like how the tour spoke in both Spanish and English accommodating for most people! There were many different animals to see. However at taking a closer look at their pens, there was little.. If not any water that we could see as well as minimal shading for them. We were also shocked at how small some of the enclosures were for such large animals! The sea lion show was brilliant and there are plenty of places to get food and refreshments. All in all a good time seeing the animals up close and personal.. Just a shame about some of their living conditions!

titulo: Excelent place to be with kids
conteudo: Many attractions for kids. Nice restaurant with fresh made Paella. Lots of wild animals and Safari ride atound :)

We went to the Rio Safari zoo today. We had an amazing time: lots of animals, very easy to view them all, giraffes eating in your hands as well as zebras etc. Our kids for to swim with sea lions, and had a great experience touching the sea lion (35 euros and previous booking needed). The zoo seems very respectful of its animals and the staff is helpful. There is also an outdoor swimming pool. We lived the time spent there, the numerous animals we got to see, the hospitality of the staff. We would definitely recommend going there if you are on vacation with kids in the Alicante area. The only negative side is the entrance fee, which you can reduce by bringing a reduction coupon (which you can find in all tourist information booth or print on the Internet).

I went here with my family. My parents, sister and partner. We had a lovely day out but it was hot, too HOT, which meant that most of the animals were scrambling for a very small amount of shade within the enclosures. Most of the enclosures were small and a little dirty but that is the norm with any 'zoo' type situation. I do think it's worth a visit and I'm sure the charge does go somewhat towards the animals.
Price for adult is ‚Ç¨22.50, however u can get discount coupons in loads of places that give you ‚Ç¨4 off.

amazing place. friendly staff that try their best to understand our English. free scooter hire for my disabled mother and reduced rate for her. also gave us a ‚Ç¨4 off each voucher which saved us ‚Ç¨24! there is a water park attached which is free to use once you've paid entry. the safari train (jeep and carriages) was great and too us close up to the animals. drinks cost were what you would expect - about ‚Ç¨1-‚Ç¨1.50 each. lots of places to get refreshments and they also do English tea! lots of animals to see and also camels you can ride. ‚Ç¨8 euro per child for 3 loops round a couple of trees was very very expensive but you can get a photo with a baby python for ‚Ç¨7 per photo which isn't bad. after you've been on the safari train there is magnets and key rings available at ‚Ç¨3 each. nice family day out. could defo spend a full day here! also pictures and swimming with sealions for ‚Ç¨35 pp. we didn't do this but it's much cheaper then the water park in benadorm.

I went to the safari in August witch means it was very hot but lots of shade to keep cool, very interactive with the animals for ‚Ç¨2 for a bag of food !! Animals all well kept , happy and friendly , great day out lots to see and do, great deal for the safari and the water parc , all staff were really nice and helpful with all languages, definitely recommend, would love to go again , lots of little shops around to re-stock of get a drink crisps ice pops and lots more.. Suitable for all ages üëçüèºüëçüèºO.M

This is the second time we have visited and both times we were not disappointed. Both my son aged 13 and daughter aged 7 absolutely enjoyed it as did we. The highlight were the chimps and the giraffes. Such an amazing park particularly as you can get so close to the animals. We will be visiting again when we are in the area as we live in Cornwall. This was the highlight of our holiday both times. We also enjoyed the bird show which we did not particularly want to watch as birds are not our thing but we were pleasantly surprised and thought the man who did the show had the whole crowd entertained and thought he was great with the animal and could tell he enjoys his job. Fantastic zoo!!

The condition the animals are living in are very poor.There was no water in the cages and pens..The animals were very hungry...The poor little donkey had wax hanging from its ear ...The condition of most of the animals feet were terrible..How can this zoo get away with these poor conditions ..I came away most upset...Surely there must be standards that the zoo has to abide with ....

This is a great family day out, there's lots of different animals and you can feed the giraffes peanuts. There's lots of interactive activities and there is also a water park at the front of the zoo which is a bit random.

Didn't enjoy 1 bit. These poor animals had little to drink and little shelter it's so barren there nothing for them poor animals I even complained to a member of staff to how thin one of the pigs was. If you go please take a little food for these poor creatures it bothered me all day bout these poor animals The poor crocodiles had little water too swim in if you like animal pls avoid going

Visited the park with a mixture of adults and children aged from 6 to 14. Everyone had a great time as there was something for everyone. We paid extra to swim with the sealions a great experience something everybody really enjoyed, if you are in the area it's well worth a visit. It's not an expensive day out and I wouldn't bother with a packed lunch as meal deals can be purchased for 10euro( something with chips,a drink and ice cream)

titulo: More of a prison than a zoo
conteudo: Walked in got a 15 mins train ride around the tiny enclosures. Then had a 45 minute walk around looking into the tiny pools and enclosures at the depressed and lifeless animals then we walked out. If your an animal lover don't go unless you don't really care and just want a cheap day out and see some lifeless animal

Today on the 4th August 2016 we went to the rio safari, we were told not to expect much so we didn't have high expectations anyway. When we got there we were given a map of a train that would take us around the park so you could be close to the animals, giraffes,monkeys etc but the journey was 20mins long and all we basically saw were lamas, so we had a walk around The enclosures themselves were DISCUSTING they were too small for each of the animals,there wasn't much area for them to lay in the shade during that heat, hardly any food and could barely see any water for them to drink. In my opinion it should either get massively improved or shut down, what they have there is cruelty to animals.

After being recommended to visit by a friend, I was appalled to find what was supposed to be a well kept animal sanctuary.

It was heartbreaking to see animals kept in such conditions.

The crocodiles were in pools that had very little water and what was there, was filthy dirty filled with rubbish, empty paint tins and rotting food.

The rest of the area was barren , no shade for the animals, they looked totally neglected.

They had camels before you entered the park, where you could ride if you wished, these poor animals were walked around the entrance area the entire time we were there.

The only area that seemed to be kept well was the area with the seals and sea lions.
Our granddaughter loves seals so we had booked the seal experience for her. If I had known how bad the safari park was, we would never have went anywhere near it.

We looked at the pool area but it was too crowded to get anywhere near it, but again was not very clean.
Hopefully something will be done to improve this  safari park

My wife has a fascination with zoos and which ever country we travel too we have to go to a zoo/safari.

This was a zoo that looks like it needs a bit of money spending on the enclosures as they look a bit run down to be fair.

But the train ride through the zoo was fantastic as you got very close to the animals and the shows were very good. A must see is the sea lions - exceptional creatures!

The zoo itself is quite small which is actually ideal in the heat of summer but is certainly worth a visit to break the day up. There is even a pool to cool down in at the end there is go karting next door of you want to make a day of it.

Worth every penny!!!

this is a relatively small zoo with the opportunity to get close to the animals.There is a land train which takes you around the enclosures which is great fun for kids.There are a few shows throughout the day but be sure to check the website before you go to plan your day.You can then walk round and visit the animals at your own pace.Feeding the giraffes is great and something kids enjoy with them taking food out of your hand.There are eating places but you can take your own food so put it in a cool box and go and get it when you are ready.Swimming with sea lions is available but pre book due to limited spaces.There is also a swimming pool so when finished in the park go and have a dip.

Loved wandering around here looking at all of the animals. My daughter was very excited to feed the giraffe and the giraffe seemed happy too. Great little ride around the animals on a truck so we got a really good view.
Lovely little coffee shop on the way out and a pool which is free to use with entry on the park.
Would definitely recommend a visit here if in the area.

Trying to please teenagers and keep them amused on holiday is a nightmare but my 14 year old daughter loved it here. Although it is a small zoo there was lots to see and do. The eating place was also very nice and reasonably priced. We finished the day in the pool. Thoroughly enjoyed by the whole family.

recently went to this zoo whilst on holiday in spain. we had a dull day so took kids to the Rio Safari, you get so close to the animals such as lions and tigers, it really is a cracking place and all the animal shows are great too. highly recommend it if you are sick of the beach and pool whilst on holiday

Ideal for a young family not too big. We arrived around 10 so it was not too busy, toilets were very clean. Sea lion show was fantastic, the kids loved it. Food expensive, and not great quality but that is the case in any zoo,and we didn't go for the food. It was very hot when we went, 33 degrees would be a much better day out on a cooler day.

titulo: I need of some serious maintenance
conteudo: Although we had a good time , the park is a bit run down and many of the animals look a bit sad (I know it's a zoo , bla bla). Many of the birds seemed to be a bit stressed , pulling out their own feathers etc. All that said , it's entertaining for the little ones and lots of animals too see

The animals didn't seem interested it was to hot and not a lot of shelter in the shade. The safari ride around was good. There was donkeys and piggies that look really tired and had no fresh water for them to drink my daughter loves to feed the animals but I would not visit again.

It was ok. And definitely worth doing if you have young kids. But the set up was slightly disappointing. The giraffe wasn't at his feeding station, there was lots of building work being done, and the one show we saw (parrots) was underwhelming.... It was an expensive day that didn't include many oooohs and aaaaahs on our part. The food is awful. Take a picnic.

There is a free bus to the zoo. You have to book the transportation in advance in one of the Rio Safari stands. We booked ours in Zenia mall. The bus picked us up from Cabo Roig in front of Apartmenthotel Diamant Blue. It drove through Torrevieja and lots of people hopped on there. I don't know where exactly. The bus costs 4‚Ç¨/person but you get a 4‚Ç¨discount from the entrance fee in the zoo with your busticket. You can't get a discount with the discount coupon from internet or Ikea-card if you use the bus service. The zoo itself is ok. Thesafari train tour was very short and truly a disappoinment. The pics about it in the brochure look a lot more exciting than it really is. It was boring, short and you didn't get anything extra (you get a better look at the animals on foot. The parrot show and the sealion show were very entertaining/fun/exciting/animals were adorable. Make sure you take water with you to the sealion show as you will be sitting in a direct sunlight. 0,5l of water costs 1‚Ç¨ in the zoo but 1,50‚Ç¨ in the kiosk inside the arena. After the show you can have your pic taken holding a parrot or next to the big sealion for 8‚Ç¨. You can feed the ciraffes, just like for example in Budapest zoo. A bag of peanuts for the ciraffes cost 2‚Ç¨.
Bring your swimmers and towel as there is a pool and a waterslide too + free sunbeds. That is great as the bus back to Torrevieja/Cabo Roig left at 5pm (arrived at the zoo at 10.30am) and it would've been waaaaay too long time to just look at the animals.
Bring your own food/snacks/something to eat! Food in the zoo is absolutely horrible s...t!
They say everything in the zoo is included to the entrance fee, but the pony/camel ride cost 5‚Ç¨ and the go karts aren't free either.

Visited on a very hot World Giraffe Day in June. Straight onto the train which was very good with commentary in English. Then spent the day going round the whole site having a closer look at everything. Lots and lots to see and it would be very easy to spend the whole day here. The shows are very good. Lots of places to get away from the sun as well if it does get a bit too hot.

Visited recently was very surprised by diversity of animals. Well set out so you do not miss anything. You can buy peanuts when you go in to feed the giraffes, really up close experience. Good facilities for drinks, ice creams etc. You can exit and re enter if you take your own food. Animal shows also included. On site go kart track and take your swimmers as onsite swimming pool available. Very open, take a drink and a hat or visit at cooler times of the day.

titulo: Great day out with the family
conteudo:
Shaded and compact we were able to enjoy watching the sea lions, close enclosures enable everyone to see the animals and see them enjoying their surroundings.
The children's zoo was a hit as many of the animals had small babies too! Our grand daughter loved stroking the goats.
Shaded areas for picnics. Internet voucher enables a 4 ‚Ç¨ discount on admission prices as well as discount price for pensioners.

I would really recommended going if you find yourself with nothing to do!!, it was Surprisingly a great day out but it's more of a half day out as the Zoo isn't massive like in London for example but it has loads of different animals and worth a visit!.

If you pay online you get a ‚Ç¨4 discount per ticket which works out to about ‚Ç¨18 each but this includes everything within the park!. They have a safari ride which takes you around inside enclosures so you get a close up look with most animals!. You also get all shows included and would really recommend going to see the Sea Lion show!!.

A typical old style zoo suitable for a half day activity. There's a land train ride through various parts going through (or quite close to) the enclosures. The bird of prey display was quite good. I still find it hard to accept seeing big cats and larger animals in small cages though.

Nice zoo lots to see they have a pool area open in the warmer weather with slides for the little ones. The animals could do with a bit more to do like thinks in there cages seemed a bit bored,need more stimulation.

titulo: Great day for all the family
conteudo: Great day out. Buy the monkey nuts to feed the animals, what great fun, hilarious to have a 18ft+ giraffe following you round after the nuts, don't forget the wet wipes though. The safari train was good and when you buy the entrance tickets, the time of your train trip is stamped in your park plan, so everyone gets a seat with no pushing or queue jumping. All animals looked well cared for and enclosures clean. Go on enjoy.

In April 2016 me and my sister visited this zoo. At the gate, when we had just finished to pay the tickets a nice young woman comes up to us with a giant snake (Albino Burmese Python) and asked if we wanted to hold it. Oh boy, was I scared. We decided to walk through the garden and THEN hold the big snake. Which we did, and we got a picture of us holding it. It was frightening but absolutely worth it. For those who don't like walking too much, there is a train in the zoo that goes anywhere. At the gate, when you up the ticket you also get a map of the areas and a schedule.

I recommend this zoo 100% for all ages üòÑ
this was the best ever day out, we were so close to animals,and the shows were great,my son loved it as did we.

Visited in late April, not too busy or hot. Good value for money although there is a charge of 1‚Ç¨ for car park outside safari park. Grandchildren loved been able to run freely (within reason) through the park to see all the different animals. Sea lion show brilliant and the train ride through the park good but check out times they run. Lots of picnic areas but take lots of sun hats/creams as not that much shade when walking around.

titulo: Quite large Safari Park with Seals, African animals, a Train Tour and a Swimming Theme Park
conteudo:
An expansive Safari park, which houses seals in a custom pool, lions, tigers, monkeys, giraffes, baby hippos and all manner of animals roaming almost freely! You can walk round the outside fences to take your time looking at the animals, and you can also take a mini-train tour of the Park, to save you walking, though there are tables and benches dotted about! The animals are well looked after and appear very healthy and contented, generally ignoring the public! At the end of the tour of the park, you can visit the restaurant / cafe for a drink and a bite to eat! If you still have plenty of energy, you can also pop into the swimming pool, which has chutes, for a cool down!
Very entertaining and reasonably priced! To be recommended if you like Safari Parks!

Great safari park , get up close and stroke the giraffes and ostrich is you dare , Safari trip is good and inc in price as well as daily shows and you can pay extra to swim with sea lions. There is a farm also. Go karts and a free to use pool and slide in the summer months , easy to find and free parking.

You can go in and out for free with your ticket same day and they do discount with ikea family card or ‚Ç¨4 off pp with leaflet.

titulo: Absolutely awesome a great day out
conteudo: We visited here in April as our son loves animals. We had heard mixed messages but had a brilliant time. Some of the animal enclosures are a bit small, but most were brilliant with the stand out enclosure being the tiger pen. It's superb being able to get so close to the animals. We can not recommended this place enough if you are in the area, but we would recommend you taking a picnic as the food prices are on the high side. We would also recommend the sea lion show, it's very entertaining and very funny. We would also recommend the free safari train which takes you through some of the bigger animals.

titulo: Family visit whilst on holiday with an age group from 80 down to 12
conteudo:
Interesting well set out park accessible both on foot and by trailer train which is included in the price. Shows at different times of day showing parrots and sea lions - the sea lion show was very entertaining and informative and monies go to a foundation helping endangered species. The usual photographers are around for group photos and photos with animals/reptiles.
Train gives passengers close proximity to the big cats etc.

We visited here with our 2 young daughters. It really reasonably priced for a day out - about ¬£50 (although we did have some vouchers which gave us about ¬£15 off). The girls loved it - the train ride is brilliant, worth the money on its own.

You can buy a bag of monkey nuts for about 2 euros and feed pretty much all the animals, the giraffes were the best.

I've seen some reviews saying the food is poor, but there's plenty of picnic areas for you to take your own food. There's also some decent snack stands to get a drink or an ice cream.
origem: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, UK

conteudo: Came here a few years ago, and again in March 2016 with our little kid. Well priced with undercover picnic area and place to eat if you want to.
I dont know if its since we where of season, but most of the animals looked like they were unhappy and placed inn small spaces. And the food was awfull, bring your own

We went here early march so it was very quiet, suited me has I love animals better than humans so spent more time with them! It cost 25 euros each including transport which is good value has its an hour journey to elche . The park is well kept with a few shows for you to watch like parrots and sealions all are very good so look out for the times of the shows. You are very close up to the animals which I liked best especially the giraffes they were fab! Never realised how tall they were until your up close, they have a safari train which tales you inside the enclosures included in the price and its great. There are several eateries throughout the park with good toilet facilities and places to sit and rest, takes about 4 hours to enjoy this wonderful park. Make sure you get your pictures taken with the parrots sealions ect they are good pries about 7 euros each and come in a nice frame. Well done to all the keepers and staff who look after these fabulous animals one of the best parks for me that ive visited and ive been to many!.
I took my grandchildren here for a day out, they throughly enjoyed their time there, this is a small place compared to some in England but it is clean and friendly and a lot of fun

titulo: Great day out but beware the photographer
conteudo:
We had a really lovely day here in February. The park is nicely kept and the animals seem very close to you as you walk around. I have never got so close to a giraffe before. It was also great to see the orangutans and the other primates. A highlight for me was the little Safari train that takes you around the enclosures and into the midst of some of the animals .
There are good toilet facilities for visitors and places to eat and drink . The Safari Park is easy to find and there is plenty of free parking.
I must point out however a major problem when we arrived. As soon as we had paid and got into the entrance we were asked to pose for a photograph. That was fine and we did not feel harassed. However we were very unhappy with what happened next. The female photographer opened a box next to us and took out an enormous snake for us to pose with. I am completely phobic about snakes and screamed and ran away shaking. It took me a long time to compose myself to enjoy the trip around the park . We feel that rather than just take out a snake the photographer should ask if we agree . Luckily I still managed to enjoy the day but for this incident alone this has become a three-star review and we want to warn guests and management .

titulo: Great day out and lovely lunch
conteudo: Visited the zoo.. great value for money. Good shows. . At the zoom in show. .we were the only family watching and he was still fantastic. Well organised and lovely train ride. Meal was lovely. .had pork baguettes and chips. . Good value!

Pleasantly surprised at the quality of the surroundings and the condition of all of the animals. The shows could have been a little longer perhaps half an hour instead of 20 minutes. Well worth a visit.

You can do it all under 3 hours inluding the train and the sealionshow. Some animals don't have according to me not enough space. Strange that not the train are electric driven when they are around the animals. The zoo has to rethink in this matter. March was good time to visit

Reasonably priced plenty to do and see. Take swim wear as there is a pool and slide open in summer. Restaurants are very good and polite. There is also a Go-Kart track this costs extra but is a good circuit.

titulo: really good day out for the family
conteudo: great place to go but check to make sure pool open too - food is very expensive so good to take a picnic and leave in car until ready to eat - plenty of picnic areas and if you get too hot you can go for a dip in the pool or swim with the sealions although best to buy this special ticket and get free entry to parc with it

titulo: Like in Africa - Super day out in Elche!!
conteudo: Been there with my cousin and it is worth the price. Beautiful animals and shows and lovely staff. I went to several safaris and zoos and this one was one of the greatest. Highly recommended if you are in the Elche area!!

titulo: The best zoo I have been to
conteudo: Visiting here made our holiday, the variety of animals and shows were fantastic and I didn't feel ripped off. There is a great pool area as well do take your costumes and chill out after, you really can spend the whole day here either as a cooper, family or slime, I really recommend a visit.

We have been to Rio Safari about eight or nine times which will tell you how much we enjoy it. We bring our Grandchildren here and they love it, the animals always appear to be well kept without showing any signs of stress. We have seen the development of the place over the years and they seem to have the animal welfare well under control with the new Orang-utan facility being a good example. The animal presentations are entertaining and at about 15 minutes they are not too long for us or the animals. We have photos of our grandchildren as they have grown taken on the safari trucks; they always seem to take great photos and at reasonable cost too. The food and drink cafe and kiosks are also good value and quality of the food is good as well. We shall be back there next year with our youngest grandchild for another photo. We usually go before or after July and August as we prefer the cooler times, so we haven‚Äôt experienced the water park which is part of the attraction.

For a place which states they are dedicated in the salvation of all these great animals, I think personally they would all be better off in a human prison.. at least this way they would have clean facilities, WATER and shelter from the scorching heat.
I saw at least 3 enclosures where the animals had not even been securely closed in, posing danger to themselves and the public.
At least 3/4 of the Croc pens had little or NO water in. They have roughly 40 turtles with not even a large puddle of water to use.
The pens are not large enough for the 4 white lion (large) cubs - with only a small apparatus to make use of - again no water/ shelter in site.
One quarantined animal was left in a box cage with straw, no water and in direct sun light.
I couldn't even begin to describe the mess of the sheep/ goats and the conditions they are being forced to live in and what the public are given to walk through to view them.
Absolutely appalling conditions. They should be completely ashamed of themselves.
Says it all when an 8 year old child comments on how cruel it all is.
I'd wished I put the extortionate amount of money to get in to good use with a Spanish animal rescue centre or at least a few gallons of water!!!

We visited here the last week of september the zoo is an amazing place and i highly recommend it. My father came with us and he can't walk very far the zoo had electric chairs it made his day so much better and there was no charge. The staff were helpful and friendly.The best part was the train ride inside some of the animal componds so we got really close to the animals my personal favourite was i got to stroke a giraffe it was my highlight.There is some building work going on but this can only make a great place better.We would definitly go back.

We had a very nice time at this zoo.
The kids especially enjoyed being able to feed the animals, the giraffes in particular.
I also appreciated the smallness of the area as I had children with me (although I am sure the animals do not appreciate this as I do).

We went to both the parrot and sealion show and enjoyed them.
It is also fun to go on the safari ride, which is complementary.

I am in two minds about how to review this attraction because my family did enjoy the visit but some of the conditions that the animals are kept in are not exactly ideal. On the positive side - the seal/ sea lion show is very entertaining and they appear happy, many of the animals on the safari have plenty of space to roam ( although the whole safari area is just barren dry earth with not a blade of grass in sight) and the catering is reasonable. The negatives are that some of the animals really do not appear to have enough room- crocodiles, monkeys near the entrance and two baby hyenas who pear to be kept on a birdcage no more than 10 feet across spring to mind. Also the safari train spends ages in an area full of cows and lamas but the when you come to the interesting stuff ( lions etc) you can barely see them and they don't slow or stop to let you get a better view. The cost is around 22 euros per adult and 14 per child over 3 ( think we got a discount with a leaflet) which on balance is expensive for what you get, however my kids did enjoy it and it is worth coming. Last thing make sure you put mosquito repellent on as the animals, heat and water are a perfect combination and we did get eaten alive!

titulo: Run down - depressing to see some of the animals
conteudo: Read some reviews before we went about poor conditions and animal welfare and we were thinking, just a few animal activists, however it did actually influence our experience as well. Just a few of each species in small cages, you felt sorry for them, and that is a bit unlikely for us to say, as we are not that into animals.

I went there with my family, we were pretty much dissapointed. first of all it was just too expensive.
