Moreover they dont even let you take a photo with the seal, they take you a photo and to collect it you have to pay 20 euros. they are goddam thieves. we saw animals in such poor conditions. the tigers didnt even have much space, they must be suffocated. i wouldnt like if someone put me in a cage, these animals must be sad. they need to improve the conditions otherwise the results will be that those animals wont survive.

The zoo has a good variety of animals with good views of them on the high walk ways, a free train and swim voucher o n entry makes it very good value, I had a picture with a snake on entry too that cost only 7‚Ç¨, the shows were good, good choice of food, go-karting was a lot of fun, the pool was brilliant to finish the day off, the slide was ace, all in all a very good place for all ages.

We met the kindness and most attentive car park attended ( Javier )when we arrived and when we left after an enjoyable few hours viewing the animals, the children having camel and miniature pony rids and we finished with a few laps on the Go Karts, a good day out on a non beach day.

Well we wanted a day out away from the beach and to do something other than the normal and so we went to the Zoo. We got there early, so we did not have to rush around.
The Zoo is laid out well and the staff are good, we got to go to most of the shows- The parrots, the sea lions, the birds... at the end we joked on the cost of the photos, they tended to be 7 Euros! we did get some as they were nice to take home!

We were really surprised at the cost of food and drink, we are used to the silly prices in the UK at Zoo's and safari parks so to get things at reasonable prices was nice. I wished we had lunch a little later, the Paella looked amazing.

We had a great day and ended leaving very late, so a good time.

Good tip, you can get 4Euro's off each ticket if you pick up a booklet at the airport. It makes it even better!!

titulo: Beautiful animals and great days fun
conteudo: Amazing day. My family spent the whole day here. It was very hot. We pre booked the sealion swim which I recommend booking in advance to guarantee the swim. It lasted about 30 - 40 minutes and was great value for money. The animals look well cared for and you can feed most of the animals. The monkeys clapped at us and blew raspberries for monkey nuts. The most amazing part for me was the giraffes, they were so tame and friendly and you can feed them. I actually got a cuddle and slobbered on by one lol. I could have just stayed with the giraffes all day. They also provide camel rides and pony rides. Pictures are good value for money compared to most places. I wasn't keen on the buffet in the caf√© but this was more me being fussy. I would recommend this as a family day out just remember to book the swim in advance and take a hat, sun cream and water and swim wear for the pool.
Took my daughter to swim with the sea lions,absolutely fantastic day out well run and worth a visit, took a picnic lunch with a lot of places to have your own food.

Arrived around noon for afternoon of fun and started off with birds of prey show which was a mix of small animals and owls etc very good show in English and Spanish.

Lunch menu is very limited with Spanish fair or toasted cheese sandwiches don't expect much more.

Afternoon in the zoo was great buy a ‚Ç¨2 bag of monkey nuts and you with have every animal eating out of your hands including the giraffe who were so tame and friendly.

For a Spanish zoo animals are kept very clean and tidy way better value and standard than the one in murcia.

Highlight of the day sealion swim and daughter doing a camel ride ,good afternoon out but take a packed lunch :-)

We booked our tickets online which saved queuing to enter, we arrived about mid day, so we had a short walk around prior to watching the Sealion exhibition, which lasted about half a hour, seemed that from 14:00 to 15:00hrs all is quiet so a good time to have lunch, we had a picnic, as on previous visit the food was not to our taste.
At 15:00 we watched the bird exhibition,which was highly entertaining.
We were aware that at each show the handlers were very caring towards the animals.
We had a trip on the Train around the park which was equally entertaining.
All the animals looked healthy and happy, enjoyable day out, we would recommend it as a fine day out.

titulo: Typical low quality food at tourist attraction
conteudo: Typical food at tourist attractions. Low quality due to high turnover without the neccessary focus on the food. This is not a place I like to eat. However, the Rio Safari park itself is very nice. It is the food I am not happy with.

Loved this place...went on a safari drive and bought some lovely pics of kids at end. Parrot show was great kids got to sit in cage with lemurs and the lemurs sat on their knees and got fed ...amazing. Got loads of pics kids holding snakes owls parrots and feeding giraffes, recommend this place. Free car parking. We bought a picnic with us as there is a picnic area

Not the most posh zoo but well worth the visit if you don't mind searing heat and dust. The animals are brilliant , there is horse and camel rides available and a good seal and bird show. Eating venues are limited but just what you need . Cost wise ok but a good day out .

I first visited the Safari Park a few years ago and did not have a positive impression - but now is a different story. The park is vibrant and clean, a far cry from what it was. I am very pleased to say the breeding programme is showing fabulous results credit to all the staff there. The water park outside the Safari park is free to enter and has a terrific water slide and wonderful place to cool off either before or after visiting the Safari Park. The highlight of our visit was swimming with the sea lions, but if you want to swim then its a must to book early as spaces are limited. I highly recommend a visit if your anywhere near, the children loved it and so for that matter did the adults. Entry fee is very reasonable and concessions for the elderly and children.

This is a reasonably priced day out for a family (always check online for any offers).
We have visited on several occasions and its never busy which makes it even better.
Please check their website for all the animals but the white lions, giraffes (close encounter if your lucky) and many others are all wonderful to see close up.
We went in August and the temperatures were high but lucky enough there is a swimming pool to cool off in before continuing a tour of the park.
The food and drink is reasonably priced and you will get the chance for a few photo opportunities.... Sea lion and snake are just a few.
Overall, there's better zoo's but there's something different when walking around Rio Safari. You won't leave totally amazed but you will have a good family day out.

titulo: Revisited after 11 years and it's great now!!!
conteudo:
My wife and I visited this place 11 years ago and it was very run down, the animals look very unkept and the poor elephant looked very disturbed, we were reluctant to go back but now glad we did, we now have 3 young children of 9, 6 and 2 and they all said at the end of the day that it's was great and then all fell asleep in the car on the way back to the villa, we can quite clearly see that there has been a lot of investment made, and also the animals all looked well kept, the kids loved being able to feed the camels and giraffe, we didn't manage to get into the pool as it was to busy and had closed to to any more people.

Well worth a visit and also look out for the discount tickets int he local shops and petrol station

The zoo overall was really good. They have a restaurant, free swimming pool and a play park before the booths where you pay. The animals there were amazing, and all of them were very active. My faveourites were the Tigers (huge!) and the white lions. They had lots of shows and you could pre-book to swim with the sea-lions. It's a great day outfit all ages.

titulo: Wish I had visited before ....a gem
conteudo:
I have owned a house about 10mins away from Rio Safari for 13 years and I always meant to go there. I started to rent the house out and decided to visit a few local attractions.
What a gem ! I read about their conservation work with sea lions and some really bad reviews but well I will visit and make my own mind up.
Yes prices seem to have gone up but so have wages and the cost of food.
I thought it was value for money and we spent 4-5 hours there and could had some lunch and time at the great pool area.
I enjoyed the train ride ....and the giraffes were amazing .....so gentle and up close.
I am a horse owner and the horses were all well fed and better than a lot I have seen at stables in the region !
All in all highly recommended.......Heat can be an issue but hey it is Spain.

to say the animals are very poorly looked after ...you need glasses mate!!
In 20+ c heat they wont be doing a tango and neither would you !

The animals all seemed happy and well fed which is always my main concern. The park was undergoing work when i visited so id like to visit again to see if there are improvemnts on the animals living facilities as some were a tad old fashioned.

We had a nice visit to Rio Safari. We visited with 2 twelve year olds, a nine year old and a four year old, fun was had by all of them. All 3 shows were entertaining for them all. The sea lions were our favourite. Quite hot while you walk around some more shade and some sprinklers would be nice. Train ride was great getting to go close to some of the animals through their paddocks'. All staff, shows and tours are done in English and Spanish meaning almost everyone can understand.
Only main fall back is the aquatic park that is too small and overly crowded with only one slide and a small pool. It's worth skipping and going in the pool where you are staying.

titulo: Very disappointed. Animals look very poorly looked after.
conteudo: Visited here 4 years ago and had a great day. Visited today for our daughters 12th birthday and so disappointed and upset. This place has been really let go and the most worrying is the animals look in very poor condition. Especially the lions they look I'll and under feed. The elephant no longer here I hate to think why. And there is only one little hippo left in barely a foot of water. So very sad. It took us just an hour to get around it at the cost of 45 euro for the 3 of us and that was with a 30 % discount. I feel very sad now as I was not expecting to see these poor conditions. üò¢

titulo: Well worth a visit but there is no sun escape in park!
conteudo: The zoo is pretty good and we actually swam with the sea lions which was really good but pricey! This was our second visit and prices have gone up so be sure to get the money of vouchers from various shopping centres and restaurants from surrounding areas .. In the park they have added a new little safari ride which takes you quickly around park so you can scope the area before adventuring your self which is good .. The animals do have mostly adequate space could maybe be slightly improved .. Lions and tigers need more shaded areas though definitely.. There's a slush machine in there which is help yourself once you have bought cup are amazing !! Buy one you need it to stay cool !! The shows are moderately ok .. Prob wouldn't go back again but we have been twice now so that shouldn't really be a negative point ..

We have been coming here for a few years and have not been since the upgrade. It doesn't have the same feel and the staff just want to take photo's of you and the family every second. The prices have increased a lot from entry,food and photo's. The seal show is good but get in early or you will be in the sun without shade okay for sun worshippers but not so good for young children . They have a parrot show and other shows at different times so you have time to walk around the park. The camels are good to see and very friendly you can buy animal food from the kiosks . they have a cafe outside of the park with a little aqua park but this does get full quickly. they do have picnic areas you can use.

Was a great day out with the kids despite the fact it was 40 degrees.

Have a great sea lion show, and a new baby seal.

Moral dilemma though. Conditions for a lot of the animals could be much better........so what do you do?! Avoid it and they get no money to make it better..or...go and they get funds to prove it!!

Decided that it will exist anyway so better to help fund improvements.

Was a good day out so hence gave it 3 due to the dilemma! The choice is yours.

We spent a few hours walking around this zoo. There was a good variety of animals, all looked well looked after. It was cheap entrance fee for adults and children. We didn't have any children with us but I am sure any child would be amazed at the selection there. There were some bridges but I would say it was disable friendly. There is plenty to see and do with rides and a pool.

Had a lovely day here in july. The sea lion show was great, was very nice to be able to have a picture took with one after the show too. We got to feed the giraffe which was good, and stroke the pigs. Only downfall was alot of the park was under construction when we visited so was a little disappointed, but glad they are improving the park..

titulo: Terrible animal welfare, below all standards, the worst place I have ever been with animals.
conteudo:
My family and i visited this zoo in 2014 and i still remember it well for all the wrong reasons. I'm northern European and I understand the standards on animal welfare are different in different parts of the world but this was truly terrible.

Small and poor cages, animals in poor health and anything for a Euro. Wanna feed a giraffes some snacks, buy it at the desk. Wanna swim with some sea lions, no problems there a shows all day long. Everything is based around extra money by making the animals do stuff and they do not have the animals best interest in mind. Pony, camel rides in the hot sun all day long and so on.

This is not a place for people who care even a little about animal welfare.

titulo: Good day out especially for younger kids!
conteudo:
Went here with family recently and four grandkids under nine years old, they all really enjoyed it!
Although a little on the small side for a safari park it was still an enjoyable day.
The parking was a breeze and next door to the entrance.
Their was a good selection of animals and reptiles and everyone loved the parrot display.
It was all very chilled and relaxed and the final thing was the seals and the show at 5pm which again everyone enjoyed.
All in all it was a good valued , interesting and informative day out and not too bad on the foot leather as well!
As long as you don't expect too much you should have a decent day out and the lunchtime swimming pool which is free is a welcome bonus!

titulo: Always you'd for a trip to the zoo...
conteudo:
Really enjoyable day out.

They have improved some of the enclosures an added some lions - very impressive.

The overall feel is still of a small scale, budget operation but none the worse for that.

Worth a visit if you are in the area.

titulo: very enjoyable day with the family
conteudo: Today we went to the safari park with our son and family including 3 grandchildren and in laws. First went to the sealion show which was very good and some of the commentary was in English. We then went to the covered area to eat. The food was delicious and I thought all the staff worked very hard to provide a good service and welcoming atmosphere. The grandchildren were treated to swimming with the sealions which was very well organised and they loved the experience. We then spent a short stay at the pool area before visiting the animals in the zoo. A good selection of animals, loved the orangutan and the white lions were very grand. Although not a large safari park I think it is well laid out and a very pleasant relaxing time was spent by all walking around the zoo area. Lots of palm trees to provide shelter from the sun. Certainly recommend this attraction for a relaxed and interesting day out with the family. Only negative comment: the bathrooms could be serviced more frequently during the day especially the one near to the cafe and outside pool area.

Visited Rio Safari recently and had a really good day. All of the animals seem really well looked after and happy however there was one animal who seemed a bit distressed and I emailed Rio safari to express my concern about this animal. They responded the next day and reassured me that they were aware of the problem and that they were making changes to make the animal happier. The shows are entertaining and informative and my 11 month old son loved the zoom in show. There are some negative reviews about Rio on here but I would say go and see for yourself and if you are concerned then let them know because they seem genuinely concerned about all the animals and their welfare.

Very poor
2 adult and 2 kids ( 3 years old)
‚Ç¨86 total
When late in the day very few people there
no pool open ,no food left at 1730
seen two shows and when around on the train
Feelt very sorry for most of the ainamas
They looked in poor condition and very sad
Frist and last time I would go


.

titulo: A good day out for all the family
conteudo:
We enjoyed our day at the Rio Safari in Elche and our kids loved it.
You can take your own picnic and eat it in the shaded picnic area just outside the main entrance.
The shows are fantastic and the safari is very educational.
We took our swimming stuff and went swimming in the pool for half an hour to break the day up.
The really good thing about this attraction is that apart from food and drink everything we did was included. Although we did pay extra for pictures of the kids with parrots.
If you buy a bag of nuts you can feed most of the animals with them. You can swim with the sea lions but this has to be booked and paid for in advance.

This time my daughter was old enough to fully enjoy the trip and that's just what she did.

She's nearly 3 so we enjoyed her being allowed in for free. For a Saturday it wasent as busy as I thought but was great for my daughter. All the monkeys were out in force.

We saw the parrot show, went on the car ride around the zoo (which was amazing) and then the sea lion show (which is my favourite) all of which were great fun.
We even got to meet a sea lion and have a picture taken with him.

It's a great price for a day out and it's great for the family. Maybe next year she will be brave enough to go on the pony.

This places brings tears to my eyes as I see animals with no leaves, and no fresh running water. I saw a turkey just rotting a dying. The other animals looked sick. They are not educated on how to care properly for animals. They had rotten stale, contaminated water full of poop to drink from with NO SHADE just rotting in the sun.

The snack bar food was nasty. The speed cars were terrible and toxic.

Don't support this barbarianism.

We had a lovely day here on 31 May 2015. All of the animals appeared well fed and looked after. I had downloaded a discount voucher so got a 30% discount on entry price. Well worth looking on the website to see if they have any offers on. Both the Parrot show and the train ride were in both Spanish and English which was good, the only downside to this was on the safari we were sat in the back trailer and couldn't really hear what was being said, this was due to the speakers not being very loud and a group of Spaniards having their own very loud conversation. The sea lion show was only in Spanish but you can get the general idea of what is being said by the actions.
All in all a really enjoyable day.

we had a lovely day here on 13th May 2015.We packed a picnic and we stayed for over 6 hours . Can't believe some of the negative views . They are not deserved .yes we can all find something we feel is wrong but all I say is try yourself. We visited with our nearly 4 year old grandson who loved every minute . Down loaded a discount of 30% from website on to phone . The safari train takes you through and up close to the animals .well worth it. The shows were good especially the sea lions . No animal were over used and really enjoyed them selves . Overall it was good value .plenty to see . Plenty of picnic areas. Childrens play area . We all loved it. One point I would say is we all had open saddles on and the stones were uncomfortable we were forever shaking them from our saddles as we walked around next time would wear full shoes. Little price to pay for a great day out .

We visited Rio safari today 14/05/15. the animals were starving and very dirty! Some of them didn't even have water bearing in mind it was 42 degrees!! There were very few staff either! Didn't get to feed any of the animals at all today except the giraffe and that was only because myself my mum and two little girls picked him some grass!! I thought it was very expensive for what was there ( not much )! Has definitely gone down hill from when I last went!!! Also the goats there supposed to be fat iv seen more fat on a skelington very very disappointed!!! Will not be returning!!!!

We always visit here and have a thoroughly enjoyable time. Went on the free 'train' ride which gets you very close to the animals. Also saw the new and lovely white lions. Unfortunately could not feed carrots to the giraffe this time as its enclosure was being refurbished along with a couple of others - but that's really good news for the animals in question. Upgrades are always positive to see. The displays are excellent - the parrots, sea lions and also the birds of prey. And after almost 4 hours of viewing lovely cool beers and possibly the best bacon bocadillos ever!

titulo: Absolutely brilliant and worth the money to get in!!
conteudo:
Not quite the boat ride that it used to be, they have now replaced this with a safari truck ride, is probably the same length of time as the boat used to be.
But really good zoo, lots of animals and a wide variety and lots of hands in interaction with kids.
If you but the peanuts in the way in you can feed hear to the animals, pretty much all of them are allowed! Which is good as the animals 'ask' for the food and properly interact with you.
The shows are also quite good and there are ample opportunities to have photos taken with the animals, they do charge for these but the kids get to touch/hold them.

Absolutely brilliant hands on family fun!

Not quite as advertised, it's only a small whereas the adverts make it out be something bigger.
However the children enjoyed it which was the point of the visit. We took a packed lunch and drinks as we had prior info from friends who had been. I suggest you do the same as we checked prices in the eating areas and they are on the expensive side.

It was a fun visit and a good way to end an incredible holiday.
The wide variety of animals was great!
However I didn't like the fact that on arrival I was forced to pay 7 euros after a woman forced a SNAKE on to my neck and took a picture.
The ticket prices are very fair at a 22,50 euro each.
Defiantly worth a visit.
Thank you Elche

We had a lovely visit with 8 month old, 6 year old and an 8 year old. They all really enjoyed. One of my daughters even got called up to help with one of the shows with a parrot. She was delighted . Only thing it was a little expensive but thanks to some discount vouchers was a great help. Burgers were good but I would advice bring your own picnic. We were sorry we didn't. Words of advice.... wear insect repellent :-)

Went here before we had to fly home as we had to be out of our apartment at 10am and flight was at 9pm. It is quite easy to find, although we did have a sat nav.

The staff all speak English and take a photo of you when you arrive. It is a nice walk around the park and as we went in March it was easy to see the animals. Some of the animals, such as the jaguars and tigers, did not have big enough cages in my opinion, although the park was working on that and are currently building some new enclosures. Most of the animals looked healthy and looked well cared for.

The safari train was quite nice and took you into the enclosures of some animals. The sound didn't work when we went but there is normally information about the animals and conservation I believe.

We ate some dinner in the restaurant near the entrance and there are a wide range of snacks available here as well. I had a cheese toastie and found it was lovely. My husband had a burger and he said that was nice also.

Overall I had a nice time, although I thought the price was a bit expensive for the amount of animals there were to see.

We visited Rio safari with our daughter in March which is out of season. The safari was under going some works to improve the enclosures and overall park and there was limited staffing the place did look run down to. After mentioning all that we had a good time and we will return to see how the improvements have gone and during peak season to. I would advise getting hold of the discount voucher flyer available at bars and supermarkets. Like the header says worth a visit.

titulo: Nice place to spend a few hours with young children
conteudo:
The weather was lovely on the day we went and being in February the place was very quiet and had about 40 visitors whilst we were there.

We went to see the parrot show which the boys enjoyed and then we went on the small train to go round to see the animals which was great as previous reviewrs state, its a good way of seeing where the particular animals you want to see so that you can come off the train and make your way back to your favourite animals - which mine were the giraffe as one came right up close to you over the fence! :-)

We had seen everything we wanted to see in 2 hours and then we went over to the Go Karting section which was reasonably priced and so we spent another hour.

All in all, a lovely family day out and I would recommend anyone who have children to visit.

We took our 2.5 year old while on holiday. We were impressed it was open in March, out of season. There was lots of work going on to better the park but we had to walk through building sites to get around. The food and drink stalls around the attractions were only open one at a time, due to running on skeleton staff. We would definitely go back in season, think it's a little over priced at ‚Ç¨22.50 each so look any for the discount flyers. It just needed a clean and tidy up and the farm animals at the back of the park just needed a little more attention, think it would be great in season with pony rides n animal holding etc. Enjoyed all the different exhibitions of animals and the variety. There was a little water park which think will be great with the weather.
Would recommend this to all.

Visited in Feb 2015 with my children. The animals are well looked after, albeit the parrots could do with more space. The Sea Lion show was very entertaining and the park is a good size for young children. We visited during a transition period so there was quite a lot of construction work going on, but the staff were very pleasant and welcoming. Having a 50% off voucher made this a very worthwhile experience.

We visit this safari park every year, we love it so much! The staff always greet everyone with a friendly welcome. As soon as you enter the park you get your photo taken with a large snake (not obligatory of course) or if you prefer just a family photo it's not a problem. You have the option of touring the whole safari park in a train pulled by a jeep (different sessions throughout the day) which gets you up close to the animals or if you prefer you can stroll round the park on the pathways laid out. We always do both as both ways are great fun. You have the opportunity to buy small bags of peanuts at the reception and cafe so you can feed the animals. Our best experience was feeding nuts to the gentle giraffe which went down a treat with our young grandchildren! There is also an opportunity (for a small fee of 5 euro) to get inside the ring tailed lemurs enclosure where you get to feed them pieces of fruit and get your photo taken with them. They have an excellent sea lion show and a parrot show at various times throughout the day - well worth seeing! You can bring a picnic or eat at one of the two restaurants or cafe and I can recommend both restaurants for good variety of food at reasonable prices. There is also a pool at the entrance of the park for any visitor wishing to use it for a small fee. At the far end of the park there is also a go-kart track suitable for kids and adults alike. My only disappointment this year is the fact that there was no elephant show which was there every year up until summer 2013. It was excellent and afterwards you had he chance to get a photo sitting on the elephants back. Also they used to have an area where you could feed kid goats with pieces of apple which you purchased for 2 euro - it has now gone, sadly, as it was a great hit with all who participated. One thing I highly recommend is to book a session with the sea lions. It is totally worth the experience for any age group. We did it this year and thoroughly enjoyed interacting with the sea lions, getting photos with them and even getting a kiss from one! Unbelievable! We all came away with huge smiles on our faces and vowed to do it again next year! This park is an absolute must for all ages and is a wonderful day out in the sun!

√Å small place but that means you can cover the whole place within a day. The safari ride is a fun way of exploring the zoo and allows you to go into the animal areas. The sea lion show is very entertaining, don't miss it!

Visited in October, it was surprising. We first walked in after going through the entrance and was greeted by a employee with a snake in her hand! We hopped onto the safari jeep which drove us around the grounds. Lots of different animals. Some of the shows were funny. The giraffes were fantastic. Food to be honest was ok, would take a lunch from home next time! Staff are very warm and welcoming. The bird show was very odd as at the end they involve a Jack Russell dog!! This is quite a small place so do not expect too much but still a good day out.

We are now regular visitors and thoroughly enjoy our day here. Always something going on with the parrots, birds of prey and the sea lions showing how intelligent and clever they all are with their displays. The animals all look in fine condition and the staff clearly care about their welfare. It's a joy to see the inter action between the animals and the visitors, especially the children and it's just a lovely day out. BUT please do not feed peanuts to the parrots!

A lot of people seem to think that Rio Safari were a bit neglectful with there animals and that the staff are directed to get you to pose for charged photographs rather than look after the animals interest.
OK, so number one, this is a zoo, animals will always look a bit unhappy caged up, wouldn't you, I know I would. Secondly, this is a business, and so to look after the animals, a business has to make enough money to pay for it's overheads. So posing with the snake when you go in, or posing with the parrots or the bird of prey etc, is all part of their trying to make a better, more successful business, and of course up keeping a place so to make it a pleasing experience for the visitor. Now I sound like as if they are my mates, but no they are not, and I am not fond of dishing out too much money unnecessarily, but I don't like seeing people picking holes in something like a zoo. If you don't like seeing animals in captivity DON'T VISIT A ZOO, you are going to be really disappointed.
So now less of the rant, I was here with my 10 year daughter, she posed with Julia, the Boa Constrictor, and bought the packet of peanuts to feed the animals with, had a laugh at all the goats running around in circles and the chimpanzee eating it's fleas. Same stuff I used to do with my parents when I was a kid, and she really loved it.

titulo: One of our favourites whilst on holiday
conteudo:
Take the train to work put what's where. Then watch the shows they run so you can make it to the next.
You get a photo opportunity at each show.
Sealion was awesome.
We got 30% off voucher and felt it was a bargain
Take your swimming stuff as there's swimming opportunities.

We visited this park last week,all I can say is thank goodness we went on the safari train first instead of walking round in the intense heat,I didnt expect to see animals running around as way too hot but felt very sorry for the lions,from what I could see there was just a big square of dust,no grass,rocks or anything for them to interact with,just laying in what shade they could find,even when it cooled down I couldn't imagine them doing much,I know there is building going on for them but will it be any different from what they have now?The plus side was the swimming pool,we couldn't wait to get into it.

I read all the reviews before today's visit - good and bad - but was not really concerned about the bad reports. I am on the Costa Blanca with my Daughter and 3 year old granddaughter. This is our 3rd visit to the Rio Safari and, overall, we have had good experiences. Today was a quiet day in terms of visitors and so the seal and parrot shows lacked a bit of atmosphere but still entertaining. All the animals appear to be well looked after, the staff are polite and helpful and notices about animals are clear. Lunch facilities are plentiful and reasonably priced.

There was no elephant this year but the Lion enclosure is being re-vamped. The giraffe is still as knobbly as ever! We came away slightly earlier than we might have done due to the excessive heat - but you can't blame Rio Safari for that!

We managed to print out a discount voucher ahead of arriving which save us 30%. Check beforehand to see if there is a discount for you!

We went to this zoo with moderate expectations as knew it would be small compared to many other parks that we have visited over the years. However it was a lovely surprise. Plenty to see and do and it's a great idea to have a little swimming pool with slide on site for when the kids need to cool down in the afternoon. Highlight was the sea lion show. Low light was the alligator area where the conditions weren't ideal. Having said that, the alligators themselves looked pretty indifferent...

Worth the long drive to see healthy happy looking animals compared to the animal park in benidorm. Worth the money easily. Big park and plenty of space to see the animals not crowded round trying to look over peoples shoulders so ideal for smaller or younger children

titulo: Great Zoo, Easy to walk around and see the animals
conteudo:
We have been to this Zoo a few times over the last 10 years. This last visit was the best. Even though it was peak time there was so much space to the animal. We never had to wait for people to move away.
The Orangutang enclosure is excellent, as is the monkeys.
The giraffes actually lean down to you to be stroked.
The Pygmy hippo was fun to see and no one else was around in that part of the zoo.
If you do go, take your swim wear as there is also a swimming pool out front next to a restaurant. You have full use of that while visiting.

We did have a good day out. Swam and fed the sea lions and had a swim to cool off later in the day. Only thing, It wasn't as clean as I would expect and some staff could do with having better manners!

We had a day here about a week ago and all had a fantastic time!

Even though it was August it was not very busy so we had plenty of time to see the animals without others blocking your view.

The sealion show and the train tour is a must!

Now for the downsides....
There is some construction going on for new enclosures, which is a must as some enclosures are very worn and dated and the animals could do with better!

Overall worth a visit

We visited here on a hot August day and we're amazed by the variety of animals. The train ride 'safari style' through the park was brilliant with the animals often approaching to within a few feet if you. The lions, tigers, orangutans and giraffes in particular were amazing to see, but there were just too many to mention. Definitely worth a visit

Have visited Rio safari a couple of times over the years and have found it to be getting run down, it's not worth the high entry price needs a revamp badly, brought the kids swimming with the sea lions which was expensive but good

We recently visited Rio Safari and booked to swim with the sea lions. It is a nice experience however it is a bit costly. The experience lasts 30 minutes at a cost of 30 Euros per person, children are charged at the same rate as adults. There is one to one interaction with the sea lions but there can be up to 14 people in the pool at the one time which does restrict the time. There are 3 different time slots, 12noon, 4.15 and 5.30pm. The 5.30pm slot seemed to have the least amount of people which I would recommend. There are no lockers for your valuables so keep that in mind when you are booking. All in all I do think the name should be changed as you are NOT allowed to swim in the water with the sea lions but rather walk through the water slowly. Maybe Sea lion interaction would be more apt.

This place provided a change from the pool or the beach. Not a bad price if you have the leaflet which offers 30%off. (we got ours at the tourist office) it could do with a better map as we wandered around a bit. The included train ride round the park was good as was the included pool and slide where we cooled off before driving home. The shows were funny but you had to listen carefully as done mainly in Spanish with short English bursts intermingled.

titulo: stay away from the tube at the  pool
conteudo:
6/10
okayish
but the flume at the pool go up stairs about 40 foot high then get told by attendant to make sure kids sit down on tube ....turns out otherwise they may go to fast , tube also open air one ....hmmm not safe at all

Yeh it is very outdated and not sure it's worth a visit. Animals are cool, the swimming pool was pretty good, food was average, but the place itself seems very outdated. Not many places like it around that part of Spain so worth a trip, but don't get your hopes up!
I did really enjoy the train ride around the venue but the animals seemed in poor condition and I wonder exactly about the conditions they are kept in.
It really need a complete make over, a paint job and a better road leading into it. Not exactly what's described on the posters but as I said does pass a few hours. Not served very well by bus routes either and can be difficult to find unless you have it on the sat nav.

What a good day out. Very good value for money especially with the discount voucher. You can go in and out all day. Free swimming pool and rides. Ride on a camel. Take a trip round the zoo on the safari ride or walk (we did both). Lots of shows at different times of the day. The sea lion one is very good for young & old. As it was very hot lots of the animals were resting in the shade. Whole place is much improved since we were last there

Went for the 2nd time today. Yes it's hot so be prepared. Shows are excellent and you get the chance to have photos with the animals for a fee. New swim with the sea lions is excellent. Buy the peanuts to feed to most animals even giraffe and zebra. You can go into lemur cage to feed them and have photo for 5 euros. We sat on an elephant last time but he's not there this season. Bring swimsuits to cool off in pool after. Kids loved the slide. Also camel or donkey rides out the front

What an absolutely super place. Very well laid out with Aztec feel. Myself and my children were able to ride on a camel for only 5 Euros each. We did pay extra again to allow them to sim with sea lions. 30 Euros each but what an experience for them we are certainly glad we paid for this as the kids faces were priceless. You do get stung for the photos at the end of the day at 8 Euros each but you don't have to buy them but they are so good you cannot resist a momento. Yes we splurged out but to actually stroke a giraffe and we even fed it mouth to mouth was an amazing moment. To stroke it and be so up close was a treat. The orangutan looked sad all alone but I googled the life of an orangutan and they usually live alone and prefer to be solitary animals. His enclosure was super. The shows were informative and very entertaining. Feeding of the crocodiles was a bit rubbish but that was because they just lay there lazy beasts. The pool area and slide was great for cooling off and there were plenty of facilities to eat or have picnics . wash your hands and toilets etc. You can walk in and out to your car easily so a mpicnic we will certainly take next time we are on holiday here. Amazing day out which cost us a bit but worth it xx

Went here in August 2013 with 2 children 7 & 9 years. It was a boiling hot day and there was not a lot of shelter. Animals are not in abundance and place looks a bit dry for them.
Anyway there were some fun shows. Sea lion show was very entertaining as was the elephant and parrot one. The keepers English was not that good so it was difficult to follow the commentary.
Walking around the giraffe took some food from our hands ( don't know if this was allowed) but my daughter enjoyed it.
There were a few additional things to do such as feed the lemurs that jumped onto your lap and have photos taken with various animals. All this cost extra so take some extra euros! The whole day wad not too expensive and it was a bonus to use the small pool with slide at the end of the day for a cool down.
I would recommend this day out for children of a similar age to mine. Nothing much for teenagers.
Don't think it's the kind of place you would go to twice.

Rio Safari Zoo near the town of Elche is somewhere you must take the kids for a grand day out. It may seem expensive but no more than you would have to pay for a family day out in the United Kingdom. The Sea Lion attraction is included with entry fee and is well worth the visit, you are able to swim with them for an extra fee. If you do not feel like walking round the park, take a tour ride on the train. There are plenty of exotic birds to look at and the Parrot display is fun to watch. If you have no fear of snakes, you can have your picture taken with the snake usually draped around your neck, and all the family could be in the same photo. Do not forget to take the camcorder and camera and don't forget to wear a hat. Drinks and eats are on sale and the Zoo opens at 10.00 am in Summer and 10.30 am in Winter. Have a nice day.

We visited the safari not sure what to expect. Armed with our 30% off leaflet we arrived and were pleasantly surprised to see a lovely pool and flume slide for use by guests. We took the safari ride round the park which was ok but there's a lot of improvements going on to ensure all animals have larger and more suitable, so some were temporarily in small enclosures (lions). The parrot and sea lion shows were amusing. Lots of clear info of timings etc.
we took the opportunity to 'bath' with sea lions and it cost 30‚Ç¨ each but it was well worth it - we had a brilliant time, especially with Nanoo the sea lion.
Lots of opportunities to buy souvenir photos which can bump up the gist if your day. We planned to stay till 2.30 but didn't leave until 6.30!

We almost didn't go to this park after reading the negative reviews on Tripadvisor about the poor state of the animals and the park, however I'm really glad we did! It was a great day out for my two 3 year olds, the animals appeared well looked after and there was plenty to do there to last at least 4 hours. Well recommended, take your swimming costume for a relaxing swim in their free pool afterwards!

We booked with a rep at La Zenia shopping mall which is worth it as he has a direct bus from Cabo Roig and he has discount vouchers too (30% off entry fee when we went!) nice trip in a modern air conditioned bus took us to the park in just under an hour. The park itself is pretty good. Lots of animals, well cared for and nice enclosures. The jeep bus ride is a MUST you get very close to the animals as is the sealion show, very funny. There is a swimming pool at the entrance and you are allowed to bring your own food for a picnic. We were there from 10:30 till 16:00 which is maybe a bit long, we were ready to go by 15:00 but if we'd been in the pool we might have felt differently. Definately a place to visit while here.

titulo: Lovely day out for the family
conteudo: We had a lovely day here, we have a 2 year old and she really enjoyed it, good selection of animals who have nice big enclosures. The zoo itself is not too big so perfect for young children, They do various displays throughout the day with parrots, sea lions and other animals and at the start of the day you can do a train ride through the whole park with a commentary. You also have access to a swimming pool which looked nice although we did not use it. Good value

Great value, great day out dont forget to take your swimsuits to visit the small onsite water park. Food and drink at the park is reasonable and the seal and parrott show are a must. Why not hold a snake.

Good value very enjoyable the giraffe is very cool eats out your hands alot of animals and shows are good the only thing that lets it down is the pool the slides are good but feel dangerous and the swimming pool well i wouldnt rush to get in it unless it boiling very over used and looks abit tired

titulo: Better places in the region to visit for the same sort of money
conteudo:
I hate being slightly negative on tripadvisor because of the impact it has but......

I didn't go here for myself I went for the kids and it is the first outing in a long time when they asked to go home to the pool.

There are better places to visit in the region for the same sort of money.

We went when if was very quiet which was good, the shows weren't busy. The map they give you is wrong and the enclosures and paths appear neglected and dirty.

All places to buy a drink close at lunchtime and you exit the park to the restaurant and low and behold it's full of the staff.

On a plus note the animals appeared well cared for!!!!!

Rio Safari is a short drive from Santa Pola, easy to find and a fab day out for the family. You're greeted with a photo opportunity on entering the zoo and for those brave enough I'd highly recommend it. The staff are friendly and most speak good English and are happy to answer any questions you might have. Plan your day around the shows which are fantastic, you can tell the keepers have a special relationship with the animals and hence they are very well cared for. We weren't going to bother with the last show of the day, the parrot show, but were corralled by one of the staff along with a few other people (in a friendly way of course!) and have to admit we thoroughly enjoyed their antics, the keeper presents the show in Spanish and English and is well worth a look, my 5yr old was laughing so hard at one point!

There are a wide variety of animals to see, from Alligators to Lions, the Giraffe's are really close and curious and the new Orang-utan enclosure is fantastic, although he was a little shy when we visited. The chimps always provide some entertainment and the kids can get up close to lots of tamer animals such as cows, goats and sheep. The reptile house is full of some amazing creatures and the park as a whole is well kept, reasonably priced, and fun to visit for a whole day. There is a play area and swimming pool near the entrance but it wasn't open when we visited but it was still May - most pools will open 1st of June in this area. Fun day out for all the family, highly recommended.

After reading several earlier reviews I was dubious about taking my family there,but decided to form my own opinion, and I was not disappointed. We all really enjoyed it There were several school parties which was a bit worrying at first but they posed no problems and were well supervised. If you wish to avoid this perhaps leave your visit to early afternoon.The staff were really welcoming and helpful especially the guy who drove the train The animals all seemed happy and well cared for and various shows were arranged. The train ride was great enabling us to get really close to the animals but it was also a pleasant walk round and there was a picnic area selling refreshments. We were a party of 4 adults with my 2 year old grandson and there was something for everyone.It cost 55euros for us all which I think was good value Do look out for discounts online,I booked before we went After the train ride we were offered fridge magnets and key rings with my grandsons photo on,but were under no pressure to buy and we were not ripped off at 2 and 3 euros.A really good day out for all the family which I would recommend. .

Our second visit and thoroughly enjoyed our 4 hours or so there. There is now a birds of prey display to replace the elephant interlude but the parrot and sea lions are still a treat to watch as they enjoy themselves larking about. Our day coincided with the visit of dozens of school children who were exceptionally well behaved and were enthralled with what they saw. Made our visit even more enjoyable. The giraffe was really beautiful and it was good to see that some conservation work was being undertaken. Ok it may look a little run down in places but the important thing, the animals, all seem very well looked after. We'll certainly return for further visits. They have some very attractive ticket discount offers ( via online ) and the bacon bocadillo we had at the end of our visit was simply wonderful. Some people have made really strange and ill-informed remarks regarding the condition in which the animals are kept. Have they not seen them in tv documentaries in their own natural habitat??

We went there yesterday,2 grown ups and 1x 8years and 1x 2years old.
We all did have a blast!!
The animal were great and ALL of them seemed to be in good condition.
Green trees and grass...
We have nothing to complain about ;););)

I visited the park with my grand children and had a good day out it was small enough to walk around with plenty of shade, I am not a professional on animal welfare like some seem to be on here but most of the animals were moving around there seems to be an improvement policy going ahead with a new lion enclosure being opened this year, its not the best i have visited but its not the worst my grand children loved it, the safari train was ok and so was the sea lion show, there is only a couple of each bread of exotic animal. The food, rest areas, WC, and the park it self was clean with some nice play parks for the little ones, it was a pity the swimming pool was not open yet

titulo: Needs a good clean up and new enclosures ! Some TLC .
conteudo: The poor crocodiles looked dead ! They were in poor condition ! Needed cleaning badly.The water was green and not much of it either ! The lions enclosure was far too small and in bad condition.Very sad to see.

I visited the 'safari park' today, and was disgusted by what I saw there. The enclosures are pitifully small, especially the Jaguar's enclosure. The tigers and lions too are living in terrible conditions which are clearly effecting their physical health and mood. They have no toys to play with, no ropes, and only a single raised area. In the four hours I spent at the park, I did not encounter a single staff member walking around and keeping an eye on the animals, the staff congregated around the entrance where they put all their efforts into selling pictures and souvenirs. I saw people throwing things at the monkeys in the outdoor enclosure, as well as banging and kicking on the glass and cages of many other animals. A lot of money must go in to the park because there were a lot of visitors there, however it is painfully obvious that none of the profit the park makes goes towards improving the animals quality of life. Instead, money seems to be being spent on go-karts, water slides and the park restaurant. The enclosures are filthy, tiny and lack necessities. I was left feeling distressed and angry by the park, and will deter people I know from visiting. The 'safari park' is a disgrace and those involved in maintaining it should be ashamed. (P.s. This is the condensed version of all the readily apparent faults).
This place Is vile I love animals it's not a fun zoo it's a dirty poop ridden torture chamber.... Don't give them your money

I cant comment much about the overall park itself as my daughter had a very bad**** ACCIDENT ***** go karting so we didn't get any further that that .it is extremely dangerous , I didn't realise how much so until it was too late :( there are helmets but no seat belts and for the speed these karts travel at its unacceptable . its very badly supervised and a very bad crash resulted in an 8 hour visit to A&E with broken bones , I was asked by the park to tell the insurance and hospital that my daughter had fallen in a street as it would easier hmmm ! to be fair they did help us to the car after refusing to call for emergency services and gave us a free bottle of water
my advice is keep away !

‚Ç¨45 for two adults......bit steep! But hey, we're on holiday!
Big mistake. Staff at gate very very pushy regarding a souvenir picture, eventually escaped their grasp. Souvenir shop woeful.
Didn't see staff again until we left, all sat drinking coffee in the cafe.
Enclosures in awful state. Animals dirty. Tiger's looked fat & depressed. Giraffe was in good form though!
Toilets by the sea lions were clean.
In short, disgustingly over priced......Animals in poor state, in conditions that my wife & I found substandard to say the least.
Save your money, head for a beach!

arrived at 1.30 pm to see seal show, unfortunately that was the best part of the visit. lots of enclosures dirty with animals that didn't appear happy. no staff for the 1 1/2 hours we were walking round only to find them all in the caf√© outside as we left. We saw animals which appeared to have no drinking water in their enclosures and the hay looked as if fresh food had just been put on top of old.

Easy and free parking reasonable entrance fee.Better than average catering very helpful and friendly staff. The zoo is very well laid out with easy access for the less mobile.The animal encolsures are of a decent size with excellent viewing points while still allowing them some privacy. Also to be recommended are the shows and feeding times.combined with the fact that you get the chance to get up close and personal with many of the animals This is the only zoo that I have visited that will sell you peanuts to feed many of the animals they all seem to love them from the elephants and the girafes down to the tiny goaats and the parrots. The icing on the cake is the many palm trees, shrubs and flowers some of wich always seem to be in bloom no matter what time of the year i have visited.

titulo: There are much better zoo's on this cost!
conteudo: Visited the park in late September with my parents who are both animal lovers and my boyfriend. We have been to several similar parks on this cost and decided to go to Rio Safari for a change. We were very disappointed with the 'safari' part - being carried out on the 'train' around a badly maintained park with to my opinion badly looked after animals. The show programme was quite good and interesting and kept us moving around and entertained. The food counter was very poor, I highly recommend to bring your own food and drinks.

Oh, I loved it here when we visited in January. I think there were only a few people in - more staff than visitors! Even so - it was excellent. The shows were brilliant and the animals obviously took pleasure in the performances, but my favourite bits were the train ride, petting the giraffe and the elephant and holding the Boa constrictor. In fact all of it was my favourite! I didn't want to leave and can't wait to go back.

It is only a small park, and in some places looked a little run down, but it is all the better for that. Just so you know - we didn't take children - we went for ourselves.

We visited here from our holiday base in Torrevieja and we were very surprised when we arrived as the park was almost empty (October). We practically had the park to ourselves which was nice but a little strange.
The staff were lovely and friendly and it was clear they had a great relationship with the animals. We began by taking a short train ride around which was fun for the children. We saw crocodiles, tigers, giraffes, zebras, snakes, lions, farm animals, seals.
The shows (which were included in price) were definitely the best part. We saw the elephant show which was entertaining and there was a photo opportunity to sit on the elephant's back after it, which my children did and it cost ‚Ç¨10.00. We then watched the seal performance which was very entertaining. The trainers seemed to have a good relationship with their animals and had great knowledge of them. Again there was a photo opportunity available after the show where you get a photo with the seal giving you a kiss and photos are also available on key rings, magnets etc.
The cafe seemed a little run down but as it was so quiet perhaps they had a bigger restaurant closed. Swimming and play area also seemed to be closed but we were given a discount on the way in from a brochure which are in tourist information offices throughout the area.
My only criticism of the park is (and I am reminded of it from reading the other reviews) is that I do believe the enclosures were a little on the small side, I did point that out to my husband at the time. But having said that, the animals appeared to be happy and well looked after.
We would go back, it was a fun day.
Bring lots of spending money as it quickly added up between photos, gift shop, snacks etc.

Visited last week. The animals all looked in good health and well fed. The displays were fun and thankfully of fairly short duration so animals not tired out in the heat. But, of course, they would be used to the heat in their natural habitat. Looked a little run down in places but NOT in the animal enclosures. Haven't been to a zoo type place for over 40 years and they have changed. It is clear that every effort is made so the animals are more comfortable , have space and are not just a side show exhibit. Unfortunately its all about money and hopefully more people will visit to ensure it can continue for many years to come. The keepers were clearly devoted to their charges and treated them with kindness and respect. Definitely going back.

Took a trip with Nephew to park. Average park but unaware that most of the attractions like train around park, feeding certain animals all stops for siesta. As we had limited time would have been useful to know. Some of the animals looked a little cramped but on the whole the park appeared clean.

I visited the Zoo with my 3 year old Grandson and a couple of family members. We got discount tickets that left us to pay just over ‚Ç¨15 each. We took a picnic lunch as they have benches set up for the use of picnickers. There are a few places that sell food and drinks as well.
For how little we paid I think it was a great day out. Although it does look a little run down in places the animales appear to be very well cared for. They look in very good health and none of the usual signs of stress or boredom that you see in some parks. The shows are on twice daily and the train ride runs a few times a day. All of which we enjoyed. Take a big bag of apples and carrots with you to feed the animals or you can buy peanuts to feed them. I have never fed a giraffe before and couldn't believe how gentle it was.
There is a swimming pool for use but it was closed as it is now winter !
Definetly will return next year,

Plenty of animals to see, 3 shows through the day, parrots, sea lions & an elephant.
Few areas of the zoo seemed a little deserted, but quite a big zoo as i was only expecting a small place with about 4 different animals!
They do try to get you to have a lot of photos with animals etc to make money.
Take insect repellant as there are a lot of flies, my wife was bitten a lot!
Over all though good day out especially if you have kids.
Take your trunks as they offer to swim with sea lions & there is also a small pool area with a big slide. Children's play area & i saw a sign for go karts as well.

titulo: cruelty to animals, so do not visit.
conteudo: We drove some way to this, thought it looked a bit dodgy but still paid our money and went in. Every enclosure was too small, filthy and unkempt. The animals were suffering from mental stress.. We left after 15 minutes, upset.

titulo: Excellent day for all the family
conteudo:
We visited here at the start of August with me, my husband, our 6 year old, my mum and mother in law. The entry price is very reasonable at 16 euro for adults and 12 euro for kids/oaps (this was a discounted rate as we collected a 30% off voucher at La Zenia Boulevard).
Its is a little cheeky that you have to pay for parking but this does seem to be quite common at attractions in Spain, only a couple of euro though.
The staff cannot be faulted, they are very helpful.
The park is immaculate, the animals well cared for and there is lots to do. I was very impressed that you are allowed to go in and out of the safari park so that you can get things from your car such as swimming clothes or picnics.
As with all attractions the one thing they make their money on is the pictures with the animals. We bought 10 in total costing us an additional 46euro but you know what it was worth every cent to see the look on our sons face as he sat on an elephant, had the sea lion put his head on his and we all played with the sea lions (30 euro each). It was amazing to get up close and personal with these amazing animals.
Included in the entry price is a little safari trek around the site, a sea lion show, parrot show and elephant show.
Additional things just outside the entrance are camel rides, donkey rides, go karts - small charge for each. Free picnic areas, swimming pool with one slide and play areas. Small restaurant too which looked good but we only bought cold drinks/ice creams as had our own picnic
Can't wait to go back next year. I would definitely recommend a visit. (we arrived at 10.30 and left at 7.30pm, make time to see everything!)
A fantastic day out. My 4 year old loved it. Loads to do&see although would like to see the animals given some more water in the boiling august sunshine.

titulo: A little pricey - but a lovely day out
conteudo:
We had a really good time at the safari park.

The animals all seem well looked after and there is a good variety to look at.

The zoo allows for a good level of interaction with the animals which our kids enjoyed.

Wasn't a fan of all the 'optional extras' for purchase - but i suppose that comes with the territory when you recieve a 30% discount voucher for entry.

The free swimming pool and slide was a great added bonus which we utilised. Also the slide has no height limit - which our 4 year old greatly appreciated.

One of the best Zoo's we have been to in Spain. All of the animals were very lively and alert unlike other zoo's we have been to where you hardly see any of the animals. All seemed very well looked after and happy in their environment. Staff very friendly and helpful. Some great shows and the interaction with different animals like the monkey's, a very large snake and swimming with the sea-lion's. The zoo is very good value for money, especially if you get a discount voucher which are plenty-full from local markets and tourist info centres.

I visited this Safari park while on my family holiday to Costa Blanca and to put it simply it was a very bad experience! The park is dirty and the animals are treated like commodities, 10 euro to sit on an elephant, 7 euro to hold a snake, 5 euro camel rides, 3 euro to hold baby lemurs. Some of the animals were kept in filthy conditions (the animals that couldn't make them money) such as the crocodiles. Most shockingly on our visit one of the tigers died, scores of people were allowed to watch the zookeepers pull a dead tiger from a filthy pool of water which distressed my younger cousins greatly. We were later told the tiger died of old age. Yes there are shows and yes there is a pool (dirty) but I would advise anyone against going, the brochure makes it look amazing but in reality it is far from it.

The zoo is nicely laid out. There are a few animal shows and a swimming pool. Good value for money. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The sea lion show was great and feeding the animals was a real highlight. The animals didn't seemed to be the most cared for which did upset me and for that reason we probably won't return.
Only ever been once but would go again! Nice day out. Could do with a bit of modernising but it's a zoo at the end of the day! Defo worth a visit!

Been here twice now, great place for the whole family young,old, picnic areas in the shade provided, splash pool, take the kids swimwear and towels, sightseeing tour safari cars, go carts,*pay*
I do feel for the Elephant poor thing looks so sad, and was not really happy with the beautiful big horse chained up in the sun,for a family of 4 it was 80 euro's a little steep but there is alot there.Could do with some TLC.... beware the young ladies taking photo's with the snakes on entry they approach you quite harsh.....

My son loves animals and so we visited this park in july, on the plus side the staff (all of them) were wonderful, they all came across as warm and helpful. The cafe is ok, we took packed lunches but used the cafe for drinks and snacks all reasonably priced. The animals all look fit and well, the biggest drawback for us were the enclosures, there was very little imagination used, some looking very sad indeed. The place has the size to be something quite magnificent but it all looks a little bit tired. The shows again left a little bit of a bad taste in the mouth, not sure a dancing elephant is apropriate in this day and age! The pool is ok, not huge and has one water slide. ok to finish your day there.

My children love animals, and being close up is even better. As the Rio Safari Elche offers close encounters with sealions, it seemed like a perfect destination. We got our tickets five minutes before it started. The event was outside the park, so they just rushed into the changing room and got in the pool. They enjoyed every minute! Being able to kiss the sealion was heaven for animal-loving children.

But then we got inside. The first thing that met us was a girl who wanted us to have our picture taken with a snake. Of course, only official park pictures, we were not allowed to use our own cameras. When I said we wanted to catch the elephant show which was about to start, she lied and said it did not start for hours. After a few minutes, we found out we had been duped by someone who would rather push pictures on us. Then we took the tour of the park. It was nothing but depressing. Filthy or cramped or sometimes both cages was the order of the day. The animals looked unkept. The zoo were changing the water in one of the alligator pools, but they did not bother to clean in between. The alligators seemed uninterested in the food - there were many chickens in the pool, floating or lying on the bottom - which to me is a sign of malcontent.

A few times too often, I have gone to zoos and been depressed about how animals are treated. This was yet another such occasion. Animal shelters should be supported, but not Rio Safari Elche. Zoos are becoming more and more last millennium.

You may want to do the sealion swim, as it does not require you to enter. But after that, please stay away.

We've visited Rio Safari several times before when holidaying in the Alicante area. Although it looks a bit run down, I think its just a Spainish thing.
This time although the swimming pool area was open the water slide was closed, which was a pity as the Grandkids were looking forward to it. The staff in all areas are all very freindly and the swimming with seals for the disabled was pleasant to watch.
The Safari its self was taken in trailers around the park, which lasts about 20 minutes. I did feel sorry for the animals, as their pens/areas were very barren and with temperaturers in the 40's was almost torture for us let alone them. we then walked the remainder of the park, which again was hard going with the heat. But the kiddies touch area was brillant, at one point one of the Rangers dumped a goat on a lead on one of our grandsons and left him with it, we had a job to return it. We did'nt get the timings right to view the several performances in the different arena's. But did overall enjoy the experience.
We did find that by picking up leaflets from Elche Tourist Office saved quite alot off the entrance fees.
You only pay for entrance to the Safari, everything else is Pay as u Go. Which wasn't a problem. The carpark is free although a ticket man offers a 1E ticket as a donation for some worth while project.
You can ride a Camel or Shetland pony, they have mini electric cars etc.
The Go Karts are something else, the guy who worked them was brilliant with the kids and encouraged them to race harder. So much so we went back several days later, just for the Karts.
All around the park is photograhers and you can purchase the photo's in key fobb's fridge magnets or just as a photo for about 3-5 Euro's.

Great day out.

This safari park is a hidden gem that is great for anyone local to it

The park provides entertainment all day with great animal shows (Elephant and Sea Lions in particular) and some great photo opportunities to get up close and personal afterwards.

The spectacular attraction is the chance to swim with the sea lions (we didn't do this personally but did watch another family enjoy it) - seeing the mammoth sea lions swimming around with the kids was amazing and will be doing that again next time we visit.

There are also many other animals on display, chimps, a giraffe, lions, tigers and even a hippo or two!

Make sure you get on the free safari ride through the enclosures - a great photo opportunity

Mi mensaje y valoraci√≥n va en consonancia con el anterior mensaje. En la primera semana de junio pude disfrutar de una visita guiada con Jimena, visita de grupo, que por diversas circunstancias (temporada baja, entresemana, crisis de covid...) hice yo solo con la gu√≠a. Jimena es una gran profesional y en una hora y media y solo por 5 horas hace una visita muy amena y did√°ctica de Elche, haciendo especial √©nfasis en las tres joyas de la que la ciudad ilicitana puede presumir: Misteri, Dama de Elche, y Palmeral. La visita se concreta en la oficina de turismo y empieza all√≠ mismo. En la visita Jimene transmite un gran cari√±o por su tierra. La visita termin√≥ con asesoramiento gastron√≥mico y diversos consejos sobre cosas que visitar. Un 10.

Nunca falla en mi viajes que aparte de la informaci√≥n en gu√≠as de viaje o en Internet, me acerque a las Oficinas de Turismo a que los/as trabajadores/as originarios/as de la zona me den planos, referencias propias, gustos personales. curiosidades varias, etc.

Dentro de los servicios que ofrecen, quiero destacar el de una visita guiada por diferentes puntos de la ciudad (parte del Palmeral, Bas√≠lica, la Glorieta, etc.) a un precio muy m√≥dico (5‚Ç¨). Tuve la inmensa suerte de que el d√≠a que me acerqu√© no era festivo y estuve solito con la gu√≠a especialista. Una gozada en todos los sentidos: a veces hablando de cosas m√°s informales pero siempre dando una explicaci√≥n exhaustiva de todo lo imaginable (adem√°s de muy simp√°tica y de buen trato...hasta me aconsej√≥ unos restaurantes para comer bien). Se notaba que ven√≠a del mundo de la Historia (mejorando lo presente) pero lo q m√°s destacar√≠a es la pasi√≥n por su trabajo.
Muchas gracias, Jimena!!

Aprovecho el presente comentario para sugerir a sus superiores jer√°rquicos que le suban el sueldo pues lo tiene bien merecido. Hay que cuidarla.

Ni que decir tiene que si vuelvo por all√≠, repetir√© la experiencia am√©n de la publicidad que pienso hacer a mis amistades para que hagan lo propio.

Informaci√≥n de horarios incorrecta o incompleta. En concreto nos dieron en los horarios una hora de acceso a la torre de la bas√≠lica de Santa Mar√≠a como m√°ximo hasta las 15h. Se les olvid√≥ poner que a las 14,30h ya no dejan subir, con lo que llegamos a las 14,31h y no nos dejaron entrar

Las personas que atienden la oficina de turismo son muy educados, profesionales y amables, te dan todo tipo de indicaciones sin perder un momento la sonrisa. Destacable el muchacho que estaba el dia 6 por la ma√±ana. Un encanto.

titulo: Pesima, su entorno mal conservado y ratas como gatos de grandes.
conteudo:
Una autentica Politica Medio Ambiental, consensuada no por politicos que no entienden nada de Medio Ambiente ni Proteccion del Entorno Natural, sino asesorada 100% por los grupos Ecologistas y cumpliendo todas las normativas Europeas cursadas en este sentido. No vale la pena firmarlas y luego no cumplirlas.
¬øNo es toda una total contradicci√≥n?
Siempre es grato volver a esa ciudad, los museos, el palmeral presente a cada paso, los jardines, sus monumentos. Hay que volver siempre.

titulo: El trato correcto en el momento oportuno.
conteudo: Justo acab√°bamos de llegar a Elche y quer√≠amos coger el tren tur√≠stico, y empezaba en 5 minutos justo delante de la oficina, con lo que nos di√≥ tiempo a√∫n a entrar dentro y que nos informasen sobre todo aquello que podr√≠amos ver. Aunque siempre llevamos consultado,siempre entro en las oficinas de turismo, porque resultan de todos modos de gran ayuda.

Organizan visitas guiadas de hora y media que cuestan 5 euros. Los domingos solamente abren por la ma√±ana. Tambi√©n venden un bono de museos por 8 euros y proporcionan mapas e informaci√≥n sobre la zona.
Todo DEPENDE DE QUI√âN TE ATIENDA y del momento del d√≠a, aunque no est√° mal para conseguir informaci√≥n para aprovechar nuestro tiempo de visita.

titulo: Magnifico punto de informaci√≥n de la ciudad de Elche
conteudo: Lugar emblem√°tico, a lado de una de las puertas del maravilloso parque municipal de la Ciudad de Elche. Trato amable, informaci√≥n generosa e ideal para organizar una bonita jornada dentro del t√©rmino municipal de Elche.

El otro d√≠a fui para recopilar informaci√≥n sobre la ciudad y me sorprendi√≥ la poca informaci√≥n con la que cuentan los trabajadores. En cuanto a los trabajadores tengo que decir que eran todos muy simp√°ticos y dispuestos a ayudar.

solicitamos un mapa de la ciudad,nos lo dieron,nos preguntaron de donde veniamos y no se ofrecieron para nada mas.
deberian ser un poco mas proactivos, fomentar su ciudad, vender su patrimonio...al fin y al cabo son la imagen de ELCHE

Encantadora ciudad, con su gran palmeral, paseos , El Galliner para comer , viajar con su trenecito entre palmas, visitar el Huerto del Cura, la Iglesia, etc. Volver√©. Solo estuve ocho horas y me gust√≥ much√≠simo. Ir a punto informaci√≥n tur√≠stica y comenzar la ruta por ah√≠.
Est√° atendido por personas muy cercanas y amables que te informan de los puntos m√°s interesantes para visitar en la ciudad de elche y los medios que puedes utilizar, muy recomendable.
El personal est√° muy cualificado tanto a nivel ling√º√≠stico como de conocimiento de la ciudad. Realizan un gran trabajo

titulo: Buena atenci√≥n y un edificio singular
conteudo: Entramos para recoger informaci√≥n y el trato fu√© muy agradable y muy bueno en cuanto a la informaci√≥n recibida. El edificio es singular y merece la pena entrar.
El trato es correcto, el sitio donde est√° ubicado es muy visible y puedes hablarles en varios idiomas.

Mi opini√≥n es m√°s sobre el parque (que es donde est√° la oficina de informaci√≥n). En la ofi de todas formas son muy amables e informan genial. El parque es precioso, tranquilo, fresco... se puede ir en grupo, en pareja, con ni√±os... tiene cafeter√≠as, restaurantes, vistas preciosas... si se visita Elche, es un lugar obligatorio.

Edificio bonito y gente amable en el interior.

Es verdad que la visitamos para pedir informaci√≥n de la provincia de Alicante y no de la ciudad y los consejos dados de los sitios que pod√≠amos visitar en 1 semana fueron escasos y demostrando alg√∫n desconocimiento. Eso sin contar que una chica nos hablaba constantemente en valenciano cuando nosotros s√≥lo habl√°bamos castellano. Tambi√©n sabemos hablar otros idiomas, incluidos auton√≥micos, pero me parece de mala educaci√≥n utilizarlos para hablar con personas que no los hablan. A mejorar este aspecto.

Elche es una ciudad eminentemente tur√≠stica y se nota, saben que deben tratar bien al visitante y un ejemplo es la gente que trabaja en la Oficina de Informaci√≥n al Turista, pura amabilidad, que no van a dudar en aconsejarte para que disfrutes al 100% de la visita.
Recuerdo de la expo del 92 del zapatos y ahora es un museo de la historia de elche y sus mas de 2000 a√±os

titulo: Atenci√≥n singular de la Sra. Ana!
conteudo:
Gente muy atenta.
Explicaron todo, en detalles e sin prisa
La Sra. Ana merece todos los elogios
Felicitaciones
no soy de aqu√≠ pero resido y cada vez que necesito de los servicios me trataron muy bien, muchas gracias.

titulo: No te pierdas las vistas guiadas
conteudo:
Fuimos solicitando informaci√≥n de ayuda para nuestra visita y acabamos realizando una visita guiada muy interesante.
El gu√≠a ten√≠a muchos conocimientos de su ciudad y los trasmit√≠a con facilidad.

La oficina de informaci√≥n y turismo de Elche, es un edificio singular que se encuentra
al comienzo del Parque Municipal, en la misma acera que el Palacio de Altamira.

He ido con un grupo de amigos que vinieron de visita a elche y fueron muy educados, orient√°ndonos de donde ir y qu√© hacer para pudieran conocer lo m√°s bonito y destacable de la ciudad, te informan tambien de precios y horarios...

Muy buena atenci√≥n, muy paciente quien nos atendi√≥; con una opini√≥n bastante equilibrada del tipo de turismo que se puede hacer all√≠. No es turismo de playas, m√°s bien turismo cultural y ecol√≥gico.
Oficina que SIRVE DE AYUDA para todos aquellos que decidimos visitar la ciudad de las palmeras... y no la conocemos lo suficientemente bien.
Nos informaron bien de todas las zonas a conoces. Horarios. Precios. Y zonas comerciales. Muy agradecido.
Esta es la oficina de turismo de la ciudad de Elche, esta junto al parque municipal, uno de los mas bonitos de nuestra zona, rodeados de palmeras.
indef

Muy bien la informaci√≥n.
Muy bonito el parque municipal.
Pena el estado del parque de los patos (mucho olor y muchas palomas).
Pena tambi√©n como los indigentes se dedican a molestar y pedir limosna en sitios de tapeo ( plaza glorieta,bas√≠lica.etc).No entiendo como la polic√≠a municipal consiente esto. Al final se espantar√° el turismo.
Creo que hay que fomentar m√°s el museo paleontol√≥gico que est√° muy bien en comparaci√≥n con los otros museos.
De todas formas la oficina de turismo muy bien.

Personal eficiente, r√°pido y con ganas de ayudar al turista.
Aunque haya mucha gente, no os har√°n esperar m√°s de 5' y realmente vale la pena.
